loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman lives in Khachmaz town, and is single. This 23-year-old man sells home products. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy more home products and to increase the range of goods.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 34 years old and supports a family of four children. All the children are of school-going age. The eldest -also the only girl- is in Grade 7. All the rest are boys and two of them are enrolled in Grade 5 while the youngest is in Grade 3.

Alex rents a small room in the city suburbs of Kampala where he stays with one of the boys. The rest of the children stay in the village with their mother because the cost of living in Kampala is too high for the family. Alex is employed in the transport business and rides a motorcycle ferrying passengers to different destinations. This has been his source of livelihood for the past few years.

Alex now wants to acquire a motorcycle of his own, which will help him increase his daily income, meet the children's school fees requirements and provide for their other basic living expenses. He is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase a new motorcycle. He will be able to repay the loan in a period of 7months

loans.use: Puchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Aiméé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aimée B., 37, is married and mother of two children. She sells “pagnes” (i.e., lengths of cloth used as a sort of sarong or to sew traditional dresses in Africa), using her income to contribute to the support of her family. With great care in managing her micro-business, she has managed to make it profitable. She has already taken out and repaid four small loans successfully. In order to satisfy her customers’ demands and keep up with the latest fashions, she is now asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will permit her to build a shelter where she can display her cloth since walking around with it in the hot sun fades the colors. This loan will also allow her to buy her cloth from wholesalers and thus have a higher profit margin on each sale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 37 ans, Madame B. Aimée est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. C’est une revendeuse de pagnes et elle arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer grâce à ses revenus. Par la gestion rigoureuse de ses activités elle arrive à la rentabiliser. Elle a à son actif 4 crédits bien remboursés. Pour être à la hauteur de sa clientèle et suivre les nouveautés, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour construire un hangar et exposer les pagnes car le fait de se promener sous le soleil agit sur la couleur des pagnes. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner chez les grossistes et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Building a shelter where she can display her African cloth Construction d'un hangar pour vente de pagne

loans.name: Bernard

texts.fr:
Mr. Bernard G., 32, left school at an early age to devote himself to learning carpentry. Hard working and courageous, he decided to open his own workshop after he had finished his three years’ apprenticeship. He is married and has one child. He makes upholstered sofas and arm-chairs for living-rooms, chests and buffets, beds and other such necessary furniture.

Unfortunately, Bernard is always short of capital for his business, which makes it hard for him to fill his customers’ orders appropriately. He is asking for a loan of US$ 900 to buy teak wood, drawer pulls, etc., so that he can keep up with orders in a timely manner.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 32 ans, Monsieur G. Bernard a vite abandonné ses études pour apprendre la menuiserie. Brave et courageux, il décide d’ouvrir son propre atelier de menuiserie après 3 ans d’apprentissage, et s’est installé à son propre compte. Marié, il est père d’un (1) enfant. La confection et la fabrication des meubles, des fauteuils (salon complet), des armoires et buffets, des lits et autres sont sa spécialité.

Malheureusement les moyens financiers font toujours cruellement défaut à Monsieur G. Bernard qui a du mal a satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Il sollicite un crédit de $900 pour l’achat des planches en Iroko et Teck, des chevrons et autres afin de pouvoir satisfaire dans le délai les commandes de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchasing wood to build furniture  Achat de planches pour confection des meubles

loans.name: Hadjigulu

texts.en: Hadjigulu has been in this business for 2 years. He is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children. He and his family live in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Garagurtlu. He would like to improve the conditions of his cafe to attract more clients, therefore he is applying for a loan of $725 to buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar-bowls.

loans.use: To buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar-bowls

loans.name: Immaculée

texts.fr:
Mrs. Immaculée A., 32, was born in Attitogon (Lakes Province, Togo) where she also attended school. Because of the impossibility of paying school fees, she came to Lomé to go into retail trade in order to earn her living. That is how she began selling onions.

Immaculée is married and mother of four children. Her husband works for a larger company in Lomé but his earnings are not sufficient to support the family, so Immaculée does her part to help earn their livelihood with her little onion business. Quite ambitious, she would like to expand her micro-business by becoming a wholesaler, however this requires a good deal of capital. That is why she is now requesting a loan of US$ 800.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 32 ans, Madame A. Immaculée est née à Attitogon (Pr Lacs) où elle a fait ses études primaires. Faut de moyens pour poursuivre ses études, elle est venue à Lomé pour faire le commerce afin de subvenir à ses besoins. C’est ainsi qu’elle commença le commerce des oignons.

Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son mari travaille dans une société de la place mais le revenu est insuffisant pour les charges de la famille. Ce qui fait que Madame A. Immaculée l’assiste grâce aux revenus de son commerce. Très ambitieuse, elle veut agrandir la taille de son commerce en devenant grossiste. Mais ceci demande beaucoup de moyens financiers. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un apport financier de $800.

loans.use:
Becoming a wholesaler of onions
Achat et vente de sacs d'oignons

loans.name: Better

texts.fr:
Mrs. Better A., born in 1948 in Badou, Wawa Province, Togo, is married and mother of six children. She earns her living buying and reselling used clothing. Her husband is retired and has difficulty supporting the family so most of their livelihood has to be earned by Better. In view of this situation, she sometimes finds herself without capital. For that reason she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which she will use as business capital so that she can make her business more viable and hopefully even profitable.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Better est née en 1948 à Badou (P/Wawa). Elle est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. C’est une revendeuse de friperies. Son mari un retraité arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de la famille ; ce qui fait que presque toutes les charges se reposent sur Madame A. Better. Devant cette situation, elle se retrouve dès fois sans fonds de commerce. C’est ce qui l’amène à demander ce apport financier de $500 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour pouvoir redynamise son activité et en tirer plus de profit.

loans.use: Buying and reselling used clothing Achat et vente de friperie

loans.name: Bénédicte

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bénédicte Djitovo, born in 1962 in Kouvé, Yoto Province, Togo, is married and mother of five children. Trained as a seamstress, she earns her living buying used clothes and turning them into children’s clothing for resale. Her earnings help support her family’s daily needs.

She is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which she will use as business capital so that she can also buy sheets, tablecloths, and dishcloths. This will allow her to increase her turnover and make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame DJITOVO Bénédicte est née en 1962 à Kouvé (P/Yoto). Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Couturière de formation, elle achète des tissus de friperie et faire des habits d’enfants pour vendre. Le revenu de son activité l’aide à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui va lui servir d’acheter aussi des draps, des nappes de table et des torchons. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire.

loans.use: Buying sheets, tablecloths, and dishcloths for resale  Achat et vente de draps, nappes de table et tochons de friperie

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Mrs. Jeanne T., born May 25, 1970 in Ghana, is married and mother of two children. She earns her living buying and reselling used sheets and cleaning rags. She lives and works in the Bè slums, and her earnings help support her family’s daily needs. Jeanne’s husband is a taxi driver who lives in Aného, in the Lakes Prefecture of Togo. Since her customers are asking her for diverse products, Jeanne would like to add selling shoes and dress lengths (African print cloth) to her micro-business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 600 which she will use as business capital so that she can expand her business. This will allow her to increase her turnover and improve living conditions for Jeanne’s family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 25 Mai 1970 au Ghana, Madame T. Jeanne est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est une revendeuse des draps et des torchons. Elle habite dans le quartier de Bè où elle exerce ses activités. Grâce au bénéfice de ses ventes, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Son mari est un chauffeur de taxi, habitant à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs. Sur la demande de sa clientèle, elle voulait ajouter la vente des chaussures et des pagnes. Pour se faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $600. Le financement de ce projet va améliorer les conditions de vie socio économique dans le ménage.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of shoes, sheets, and other cloth items  Achat et revente des chaussures, des draps de lits et des torchons

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Miss. Kafui F., 25 years old, left her secondary education to pursue training as an office system secretary. Unable to find a steady position and with her limited funds, she opened a telephone booth with word processing to provide for her needs. At the request of her clients she would like her store to offer office supplies and school supplies but she does not have the resources to do so. This is why Miss. F. is requesting a loan of $900 that will allow her to carry out her plan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 25 ans, Mlle F. Kafui a abandonné ses études au niveau secondaire pour se former en secrétariat bureautique. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi fixe, et avec ses maigres moyens, elle a ouvert une cabine téléphonique avec traitement de texte afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Sur la demande de sa clientèle, elle voulait doter sa boutique fourniture de bureau et d'article scolaire mais les moyens lui manque. Pour cela Mlle F. Kafui sollicite un crédit de $900 qui va lui servir de réaliser son projet.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of office and school supplies

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Born in 1949 in Zowla (Prefecture of les Lacs) Mrs.A. Reine is a widow with two (2) depending children. Her principal activity is the sale of corn, manioc and clay also called “kalaba”. This is a growing business that requires much financial means. To increase the size of her business, she is applying for a $500 loan. This loan will allow her to stock up on sacks of corn and manioc in order to satisfy her clientele’s need and will improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1949 à Zowla (P/Lacs) Madame A. Reine est veuve avec deux (2) enfants en charge. Son activité principale est la vente de maïs, du gari et d’argile communément appelé « kalaba ». C’est un commerce florissant qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers. Pour agrandir la taille de son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs et gari afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn and manioc for resale

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr:
Mrs. Geneviève A., 43, was born in Vogan (Vo Préfecture, Togo). She is married and mother of two children, but is also responsible for one other person. She sells used scraps of cloth, bags, sheets, etc. in N’kafu slums. Her husband has been out of work for two years now because the company where he was employed closed its doors. Geneviève thus is the breadwinner for the whole family. She manages to eke out a living for them with her rag business, however she would like to expand her little micro-business and earn more money from it. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 700 which will allow her to buy and resell more used cloth and such.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Geneviève est née en 1964 à Vogan (Préfecture de Vo). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge une autre personne. Elle est commerçante de friperies (sacs, draps, torchons) dans le quartier de N’kafu. Son mari est au chômage depuis plus de 2 ans car la société dans laquelle il travaillait a fermé ses portes. Madame A. Geneviève se voit dans l’obligation de supporter toutes les charges du ménage. Elle arrive à s’en sortir grâce aux revenus. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un apport financier de $700 qui va servir à l'achat et à la vente de ces produits de fripperies.

loans.use:
Purchase and resale of used cloth (bags, sheets, etc.)
 Achat en gros et revente des fripperies (draps, sacs, torchons

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoua K., 42, is married and mother of five children. She sells little smoked fish to earn a living. Her husband is a driver but he does not have a car to use which means that Akoua is the sole breadwinner for the family. Because she lacks capital to invest in her micro-enterprise, she often runs out of fish and is not able to satisfy her customers’ needs. For that reason, Akoua is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which will allow her to buy more fish at a time and thus be able to keep her customers satisfied and coming back to her.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 42 ans, Madame K. Akoua est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des petits poissons fumés. Son mari un chauffeur n’a pas de voiture à sa disposition ce qui fait que toutes les charges se reposent sur Madame K. Akoua. Par manque de moyens, elle est souvent confronté à la rupture de stock et n’arrive pas à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Pour remédier à cette situation, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en grande quantité et fidéliser sa clientèle.

loans.use: buying and selling little smoked fish  Achat et vente de petits poissons fumés

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo T., 50, has been widowed for the past 18 years and has the sole responsibility for her three children. In the village she and her children lived a miserable life, so she came to Lomé to engage in business. Having been cast in the role of breadwinner for her family, she began selling cosmetics, candy, and simple groceries, which has been quite successful. Since she is concerned, however, about educating her children, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 which will allow her to expand her inventory and thus keep her customers satisfied and coming back to her. In that way, she will be able to earn more from her business and do better by her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 50 ans, Madame T. Adzo est veuve depuis 18 ans avec trois (3) enfant en charge. Le niveau de vie au village avec les enfants est misérable, c’est pourquoi elle est venue s’installer à Lomé pour mener ses activités. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des produits cosmétique, bonbons et les produits d’alimentation générale ce qui lui réussit bien. Soucieuses de l’éducation de ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour élargir son étalage et fidéliser sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Sales of cosmetics and grocery items  Achat et vente de produit cosmétique et d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Marie-Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Marie-Madeleine E., 58, was born in Djagblé, Togo, is married and mother of four children. She sells African print cloth (“pagnes”—used to make clothes and head wraps or as a sort of sarong) in order to earn her living. Ambitious and a hard worker, she would like to expand her business by buying the cloth wholesale which would increase her profit margin on each sale. Since she does not otherwise have the capital for this expansion, she is asking for a loan of US$ 800. This will enable her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Marie-Madeleine est née en 1959 à Djagblé, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce aux revenus de son commerce de pagnes. Très battante et ambitieuse, elle veut agrandir son commerce en achetant en gros les pagnes, ce qui augmenterait ses revenus. Mais faute de moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $800. Ceci améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying African print cloth wholesale for resale  Achat en gros et revente des tissus pagnes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs Nguyễn Thị Việt is composed of 5 members: she, her husband and their 3 children. They live in the village of Nghi Lộc, district Nghệ An. Her husband, Mr Nguyễn Văn Ninh, works in construction, far away from home. Mrs Việt is determined to overcome the poverty. When her son was 1 year old, she contracted a loan from "Quỹ Tình thương" organization. With her first loan of 75 USD, she bough a peep of chickens, some goods and vegetables that she would resell. The modest revenue from her business is enough to feed her family. Now that she is familiar with the loaning process, she is requesting a new loan of 500 USD to buy a buffalo to help her with the manual labor in the field. She already repaired the stable for the buffalo

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Việt gồm 5 thành viên: hai vợ chồng và 3 con sống tại huyện Nghi Lộc, tỉnh Nghệ An. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Ninh, đi làm thợ xây ở xa nhà. Là người luôn có ý thức vượt lên khỏi đói nghèo, nên ngay khi đứa con đầu lòng được 1 tuổi chị đã tham gia vay vốn của Quỹ Tình thương làm kinh tế. Với mức vay ban đầu 75 USD, chị Việt mua gà và dành một phần vốn cho việc buôn bán rau và phế liệu. Những khoản thu nhập hàng ngày từ 2 -3 USD tuy nhỏ nhưng đã giúp cho gia đình có đủ ăn. Sau khi quen với cơ chế của Quỹ, chị đang xin vay 500 USD để mua thêm một con bò kéo để hỗ trợ thêm trong công việc đồng áng. Hiện nay, chị đã sửa sang chuồng bò để dùng cho mục đích trên.

loans.use: buy a bull for filed work

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjo A., 45, is married and mother of four children; she is responsible for another child as well. Her husband was a farmer in the country but since she did not have work there, Adjo came Lomé with her children so as to be able to earn a living. Selling porridge and doughnuts, she has managed to earn a living for her children and her husband.

A hard worker, Adjo is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase corn, sugar, wheat flour, and oil so that she will be able to make a go of her little Togolese fast-food business and satisfy the demands of her customers

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 45 ans, Madame A. Adjo est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge un autre enfant. Son mari cultivateur au village, et comme il n’y a pas d’activités intenses au village elle est venue à Lomé avec les enfants afin de mener à bien ses activités et mieux s’occuper d'eux. Revendeuse de bouillie et des beignets, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants ainsi que son mari.

Très courageuse, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs, sucre farine de blé et huile afin de bien rentabiliser son activité et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for her Togolese fast-food  Approvisionnement en sac de maïs, sucre, farine de blé et huile

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Đạt, 44 years of age, lives with her husband and their five children in Nghi Lộc, in the province of Nghệ An. In 2003 she contracted a loan of 200 USD. She used this money to buy a calf. After 4 months, she sold the calf for 250 USD. The profit from selling the calf was a big motivation factor for her to continue. She contracted another loan after that to start businesses of pig raising and liquor making. The liquor making business brings in 2.5 USD daily. With this revenue, Mrs Đạt repaid the loan and the daily expenses. The waste from her liquor making is used to feed her pigs, this helps cut the cost of pig food. Running both businesses in parallel is quite convenient, it helps reduce considerably the time it takes raising the pigs. Mrs Đạt is requesting a loan of 325 USD. With this loan she would buy 8 breeding pigs and a peep of egg laying chickens. Selling the eggs would bring in enough revenue to pay her weekly expenses. For the pigs she hopes to sell them in the new year, this would bring in 500 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Năm nay 44 tuổi, chị Đặng Thị Đạt sống cùng chồng và 5 người con tại Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. Với số vốn vay 200 USD vào năm 2003, chị mua một con nghé và sau 4 tháng chị bán lại được 250 USD. Số tiền lãi 50 USD từ việc bán nghé là sự khích lệ lớn cho chị Đặng Thị Đạt về việc vay vốn sản xuất. Những vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, nấu rượu. Mỗi ngày chị lãi khoảng 2.5 USD từ việc nấu rượu. Khoản thu nhập này giúp chị trang trải những chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần cho Quỹ Tình thương. Bên cạnh đó bã rượu có thể dùng làm thức ăn cho lợn. Việc kết hợp giữa nuôi lợn và nấu rượu vừa giúp chị giảm một khoản đáng kể chi phí chăn nuôi. Chị đang làm đơn xin vay 325 USD để mua 8 con lợn giống cùng một số gà đẻ. Số trứng gà bán được sẽ giúp chị hoàn trả tiền tuần. Chị hy vọng lứa lợn sắp mua vào dịp Tết sẽ mang về cho chị khoảng 500 USD.

loans.use: buy 8 pigs and egg-laying hens

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huệ is considered by the people in the village Nghi Hoa as an examplary businesswoman. She is 50 years old. She owns an acre of rice field, a fish farm and a paddling of 60 ducks. Her husband is a construction worker, her 3 children still go to school so she has to take care of all her business alone. Everyday she wakes up at 5 am and she rarely goes to bed before 11 pm. She works in her rice field all morning then in the afternoon she has to tender the ducks and work on the fish farm. On average, she makes about 3-4 USD from selling the duck eggs. Combining this revenue and all her savings, Mrs Huệ requests a loan of 325 USD to buy a buffalo which will be a big help to her for the manual labor in the rice field

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ luôn được mọi người trong xã nhắc đến như một hình mẫu về phụ nữ làm kinh tế giỏi tại xã Nghi Hoa, tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm nay 50 tuổi, quy mô sản xuất của chị bao gồm hơn một mẫu ruộng, một ao cá cùng hơn 60 con vịt đẻ. Chồng đi làm thợ xây, 3 con còn đi học, một mình chị phải nỗ lực làm việc để có thể duy trì được mô hình VAC của mình. Hàng ngày chị thường dậy từ 5 giờ sáng và ít khi đi ngủ trước 11 giờ. Sau thời gian làm việc buổi sáng ở ngoài đồng, chị dành phần lớn buổi chiều cho việc chăm lo cho đàn vịt và ao cá. Trung bình mỗi ngày chị thu nhập khoảng 3-4 USD từ lượng trứng vịt bán ra. Cộng với số vốn tự có chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay thêm 325 USD để mua một con bò cày nhằm tăng thêm hiệu quả kinh tế trong lao động.

loans.use: buy a bull for filed work

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akouvi G., 39, is married and mother of four children; she is responsible for another child as well. She earns her living selling plastic bags which is quite profitable but since she lacks capital, she has not been able to expand at all. In order to do just that, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to expand her little micro-business and better satisfy the demands of her customers. This will allow her to better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 39 ans Madame G. Akouvi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge un (1) autre enfant. Elle exerce comme activité principale la vente des sachets plastique qui lui réussit très bien mais faute de moyens elle n’arrive pas à plus le rentabiliser. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 agrandir la taille de son commerce. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Expanding her plastic bag business
  Achat et vente des sachets plastique

loans.name: Claire

texts.fr:
Mrs. Claire N’Sougan, born April 18, 1972 in Vogan, Togo, is married and mother of two children. She earns her living selling kitchen utensils and cooking oil. She manages to contribute to the livelihood of her family due to this micro-business. Quite ambitious, Claire would like to expand by opening a little shop so that she can attract a faithful clientele. In order to do that, she needs a good deal of capital so she asking for a loan of US$ 900 to expand her little micro-business. This will allow her to make her business more profitable and thus achieve financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 18 avril 1972 à Vogan , Madame N’SOUGAN Claire est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est revendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine et d’huile pour la cuisine. Elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage grâce aux revenus de son commerce. Très ambitieuse, elle veut agrandir la taille de son commerce en ouvrant une boutique afin de fidéliser ses clients. Ceci demande beaucoup de moyens financiers que Madame N’SOUGAN ne possède pas. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $900. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et lui confèrera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Expanding sales of kitchen utensils and cooking oil  Vente des ustensiles de cuisine et d’huile végétale

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada B. is a 39 year-old-mother of 3 children. She's a self-taught woman. Nada learned embroidery on her own five years ago and started her business one year later. She works from home in a village called Bayssour in Mount Lebanon.

Nada makes crochet sets and does embroidery work. To keep her business running, she currently needs $800 to produce 50 to 75 pieces. When she first started with Al Majmoua, she used to make a profit of $50. She now employs 5 free-lancers and can make up to $400 profit.

The current loan will help her buy fabrics, embroidery accessories, pearls, threads - all that is needed to produce her embroidery and crochet work. "My daughter is now learning the business. I am happy to know she will be able to grow on her own."

Nada is part of a group called 'Al Omara' which means the 'princes.' The group loan is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: Buy the needed material to produce the embroidery and crochet work

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Born January 10, 1971 in Tabligbo, Mrs. Angèle D. is married and the mother of two children, with one other child in her care. Her main activity is the sale of cosmetics - perfumes, creams – and also shoes. Her husband is a painter who is often out of work. His wife is able to help him with expenses thanks to the income from her business. Often faced with stock shortages and unable to satisfy customer demand, Mrs. D. is asking for financial help of $500 that will enable her to buy at wholesale and sell at retail. This will increase her income and allow her to improve the living conditions of her family so that they can truly blossom.

Née le 10 janvier 1971 à Tabligbo , Madame D. Angèle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge un autre enfant. Elle exerce comme activité principale la vente des produits cosmétique : parfums, pommades, et des chaussures. Son mari est un peintre qui n’a souvent pas de travail. Il se fait aider dans les charges par sa femme grâce aux revenus de son commerce. Souvent confronté à la rupture de stock et n’ayant pas les moyens pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Madame D. Angèle sollicite un apport financier de $500 qui lui permettra d’acheter en gros et vendre en détail. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille pour un épanouissement adéquat et efficace.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling beauty products

loans.name: Afriz

texts.en: You can see in the picture Afriz (short person) and her employee. Afriz is a mother of 3 children. She is 48 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. She has been in this business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $825 to buy a lot of clothes to attract more clients and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Immaculée

texts.fr:
Mrs. Immaculée D. is 24 years old, married and the mother of one child. She runs a business selling charcoal in order to contribute to the household expenses. It is a flourishing business but one that needs much financial input. Very energetic and ambitious, she wants to increase her revenue and have more income. To do this she is asking for a loan of $800, which will enable her to go herself to the production sites and buy supplies at lower cost. Achieving this project will contribute greatly to improving her family’s living conditions.

Madame D. Immaculée est âgée de 24 ans ; mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de charbon de bois afin de contribuer aux charges du foyer. C’est un commerce florissant mais qui nécessite plus de moyens financiers. Très active et ambitieuse, elle voulait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et accroître ses revenus. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui permettra d’aller elle-même sur les lieux de fabrication et s’approvisionner à moindre coût. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera beaucoup à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mawutoé

texts.fr:
Born February 27, 1961, Mrs. Mawutoé N. is married and the mother of five children, with two other children in her care. Her main activity is selling fabric and snacks at Lomé’s large market. Her husband, a retired teacher, has difficulty in providing for the family. Almost all the expenses rest on Mrs. N., who takes care of them thanks to the income from her business. She is asking for a loan of $900 to increase the size of her business and be able to draw more income from it.

Née le 27 février 1961, Madame N. Mawutoé est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants et à sa charge deux (2) autres enfants. Son activité principale est la vente de tissus et des amuses gueule dans le grand marché de Lomé. Son mari, un professeur retraité arrive difficilement à subvenir aux charges du ménage. Presque toutes les charges se repose sur Madame N. Mawutoé qui l’assume grâce au revenu de son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de $900 pour pouvoir agrandir la taille de son commerce et en tirer plus de revenu.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling fabric

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Thérèse K. is married and has one child. She is in the business of selling charcoal. Young and dynamic, she has been running this business for more than five years; it is very profitable but requires a lot of financing. She passes on orders to wholesalers, who deliver the goods to her at a higher price; this puts her at a disadvantage. Aware of this situation, she is asking for financial support of $900 to use to fund her business. She will be able to go herself to the production sites to do her buying. This will increase her income and give her financial autonomy.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame K. Thérèse est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant. Elle est commerçante de charbon de bois. Jeune et dynamique, elle exerce cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans ; elle est très rentable mais nécessite beaucoup de financement. Elle passe la commande aux grossistes qui viennent le lui livrer à un prix plus élevé, ce qui ne l’avantage pas. Consciente de cette situation elle sollicite un appui financier de $900 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Elle pourra aller elle-même sur les lieux de production du charbon de bois et faire ses achats. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying charcoal at wholesale to resell

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Kossiwa A. is married and the mother of four children. Abandoning her studies at a very young age, she took up the business of traditional cloth that she acquired from her uncle’s wife. This business is very successful and the profit enables her to meet some of her family’s needs. Gifted with a good sense of business management, she had no trouble repaying her first loan. To increase the size of her business she is asking for a loan of $500 to enable her to buy from wholesalers at low cost. This will make her business more profitable and ensure she can send her children to school.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Abandonnant ses études très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des tissus pagnes qu’elle a acquis chez la femme de son oncle. Cette activité lui réussit bien et lui procure de bénéfice afin de satisfaire certains besoins de sa famille. Douée d’une bonne gestion de ses activités elle a su rembourser son premier crédit sans difficulté. Pour agrandir la taille de son commerce elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour pouvoir acheter chez les grossistes à bas prix afin de plus rentabiliser son commerce et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Sale of traditional cloth

loans.name: Zibeyda

texts.en: Zibeyda is a mother of one child. She is a widow and lives with her child in the Khachmaz region, in Hulovlu village.  She has retailed  bedclothes and glassware for 15 years. Now she needs a loan of $1,000 to to increase her inventory and to get more income.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Abra A. is married and mother of four children. She abandoned her studies at a young age to take up the business of selling generic pharmaceuticals. It is a flourishing business, and one which needs plenty of resources. Aware of the danger of exposing drugs to the sun, Mrs. A. would like to build a kiosk in order to display the products and to protect them from the sun. This would require significant funds that she does not have. She is therefore requesting a loan of $900 to build a kiosk and stock it with all kinds of generic pharmaceuticals. This will cause growth in her clientele and thus her income. As a result of this loan and the development of her business, Mrs. A.’s socioeconomic standard of living will improve considerably.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame A. Abra est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle a vite abandonné ses études primaires pour ce se lancer dans le commerce des produits génériques. C’est un commerce florissant et qui nécessite assez de moyens. Consciente du danger d’exposer les médicaments au soleil, elle veut construire un kiosque pour pouvoir exposer les produits et les mettre à l’abri du soleil. Ceci nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers dont Madame A. Abra ne dispose pas. Pour ce faire elle sollicite un crédit de $900 pour la construction du kiosque et s’approvisionner en toute sorte de produits génériques. Ceci augmentera sa clientèle ainsi que ses revenus. Grâce à ce financement, la condition de vie socio économique connaîtra une parfaite amélioration pour un développement meilleur.

loans.use: To build a kiosk from which to sell generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Ahovi Christine

texts.fr:
Aged 37, Mrs. Ahovi Christine A. is married and has five children. Abandoning her studies during high school, she started selling fruit and plantain banana fritters. Due to lack of funds, she can no longer sell fruit and now just sells fritters. But there is virtually no profit in these. Worried about her living conditions and those of her family, she is asking for a loan of $600 to be able to start up the fruit business again, which is very profitable.

Agée de 37 ans, Madame A. Ahovi Christine est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Abandonnant ses études au cours secondaire, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des fruits et des beignets de bananes plantains. Par manque de moyens, elle n’arrive plus à faire le commerce de fruit et se contente de celui des beignets. Mais les revenus n’existent presque pas sur ce dernier. Soucieuse de sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour pouvoir reprendre le commerce de fruit qui est très rentable.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling fruit

loans.name: Azizakhanim

texts.en:
Azizakhanim has 4 years of experience in farming. She is a mother of three children. This 50-year-old woman and her family live in the town of Khachmaz. 
She needs a loan of $950  to buy  fertilizer and pesticide for improving her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is 58 years old, married, and has 2 children . She is lives in the Khachmaz region, in Muktadir village. Five years ago she started this business. In the picture, you can see the oven where she bakes the bread. This oven is called "kherek" in Lezghin. She bakes Lezghin bread and sells it to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy flour, firewood and other necessary things for baking bread.

loans.use: To buy flour, firewood and necessary things for baking bread

loans.name: Khatidja

texts.en: Khatidja is 45 years old, single, and lives in Khachmaz town. She started this business five years ago. She sells glassware, and now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a lot of stock to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a lot of glassware

loans.name: Akouyouvi

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Akouyouvi A. is single and has no children. She stopped her studies at elementary school level because of lack of money, and took on an apprenticeship. Now a master seamstress, she offers a quality service to a growing number of clients. In order to improve this service and meet her clients’ needs in a timely manner, Mrs. A. wishes to buy two sewing machines and an embroidery machine. This requires substantial financial means, which she does not have. She is therefore asking for a loan of $1,200 to enable her to buy these tools of her trade.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Akouyouvi est une femme célibataire sans enfant. Elle arrêta ses études au cours primaire à cause du manque de moyens et entra en apprentissage. Aujourd'hui maîtresse couturière, elle rend un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus grande. En vue d'améliorer ce service et satisfaire à temps ses clients, Madame A. Akouyouvi désire acquérir deux (2) machines à coudre et une machine à broder. Cela demande des moyens financiers important dont elle ne dispose pas. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d'acquérir ces outils de travail.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy 2 sewing machines and 1 embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu Kulwa is a 37-year-old mother of 5 and a resident of Buguruni community, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb. She has run a small business for 20 years. For the past 6 years, she's been a wholesaler for cooking oil, bed sheets and the local garments commonly known as Vitengi . She buys her items directly from the local processing industries sells the items to retailers both in Dar Es Salaam and up country. She has also has a retail charcoal business. Her wish now is to build a permanent shop where she can offer her services comfortably from one location.  She requesting a loan of $550 to expand her stock and to help her accomplish the permanent housing for her business and expand her stock

loans.use: To build a permanent location for her store and expand her stock

loans.name: Allahveran

texts.en:
Mr. Allahveran is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 59, married with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Allahveran sells beef in Saatli town and grazes cattle. The income is quite low to provide the necessities of life for his four children and to develop his business. That’s why Allahveran applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $600 loan to buy more animals to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of a good cow is about 300-400 USD. Allahveran will spend the rest of the loan amount to buy feed for winter.

loans.use: To buy one cow and cattle feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Mr. Ali is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 65, married with five children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ali and his wife (she is shown on the picture) run the family business together. Ali sells beef in Saatli town, while his wife grazes cattle. The income from the four cows they have is too low to support the family and develop the business.That’s why Ali applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $300 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of good cow is about 300-400 USD.

loans.use: To buy one cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his mobile phone repair business.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is an internally displaced person from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku together with her family in 1993. She is 49 years old, married, and has one child. She is settled in a hostel now. Since 1994, she has been engaged in small trade. Now she rents a shop where she sells books and stationery. She wants to develop this business. In 2006 she applied to the Normicro Baku branch and borrowed $300. As school will start soon, she needs another loan in the amount of $1000 to buy textbooks and stationery.

loans.use: To buy textbooks and stationery

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Mr. Marco F. lives in his own house in the region of Pasankeri, in the west hills of the city of La Paz, with his wife, his 2-year old son and his elderly mother. Mr. Marco works as an employee in a local bakery and his wife works as domestic help. Thanks to two previous loans, they built a room that is being used by the whole family. He presently needs to build an additional bedroom for his mother. The requested loan will be used for this purpose. This is the third time they have requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis and their credit report favorably qualify them to receive a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marco F. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, su hijo de 2 años y su madre que es de la tercera edad. El señor Marco trabaja como empleado en una panadería de su zona y su esposa es empleada doméstica. Con los dos créditos anteriores, construyeron un dormitorio que ahora está ocupado por toda la familia. Sin embargo él precisa construir una habitación adicional para la madre y así tener mayor comodidad. El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una habitación nueva. Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico y el historial los califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Room construction

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old and has a CD and computer shop in the Kirkuk market. He is applying to get $1000 from Al-Aman to paint the shop and purchase a new computer with a new printer and scanner. He has three children, and all of them are in school. He is looking to improve his life and his family life. He wants to increase his income and develop his shop.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new computer with a new printer and scanner

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Carmen L. lives in a house she owns, in the region of Pasankeri, in the west hills of the city of La Paz, with her two sons, of 16 and 12 years of age. In order to make a living for her family, Ms. Carmen is devoted to the sale of electric appliances in the province of Caranavi. Due to a street opening by the Municipal Government, Carmen is forced to remove soil from the front of her house and build two rooms, adjoining the municipal line, as has been requested by the neighbors committee. The requested loan will be used for the construction of the raw structure of the two rooms and the removal of soil for ground leveling purposes. This is the first time she requests a loan and the socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies her to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen L. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos, de 16 y 12 años de edad. La señora Carmen se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en la provincia de Caranavi, actividad con la que sustenta a su familia. Por la apertura de la calle, realizada por el Gobierno Municipal, la señora se ve en la necesidad de remover tierra del frente de su vivienda y construir dos habitaciones, delimitando así la línea municipal, como ha sido exigido por la junta de vecinos. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra gruesa y el traslado de tierra para la nivelación de suelos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente para acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio A. lives in his own home in the zone of Llojeta Ladera, west of the city of La Paz, with his wife and their two children, age 14 and 12. Toribio works as a builder in a micro-business in our city, and his wife is a domestic worker in a private home. Currently, they live in three rooms built with credit from our institution and their own savings, but they need to build a kitchen.

The credit requested will be used for building a kitchen/dining room, which would add to their small home.

This is the third time they are requesting a loan and the socio-economic analysis conducted favorably qualifies them, and they can access new credit. The two prior credits have been paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El señor Toribio A. vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 año de edad; el señor Toribio trabaja como constructor en una microempresa del rubro en nuestra ciudad y su esposa es empleada domestica en un domicilio particular. Actualmente ocupan tres habitaciones construidas con créditos en nuestra institución y ahorros propios pero tienen la necesidad de construir una cocina.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una cocina-comedor, que complementaría su pequeña vivienda independiente.

Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito. Los dos créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is an internally displaced person from the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. She lives in a hostel together with her family of 5 chldren. Her husband died in the Garbakh war. Since 2003 she has rented a cafe near the place where they live. This is the only source of income for a considerably large family. She employs five additional people. Her daughter, Raifa, also works in the cafe. (She is pictured). Zohra wants to develop the business. She applied to the Normicro Baku branch for a loan of $700 to buy minor furniture such as tables and chairs to be able to serve more clients.

loans.use: To buy small furniture

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 27 years of age and is a business lady dealing in ladies’ jewelry, hair holders, bridal hairpieces, bangles, earrings, babies' toys, and many more items. She has been in this business for seven years.

She is a business administrator by profession but as a result of the scarcity of formal employment in the country, she resorted to self-employment. She has two dependents for whom she pays school fees. They go to secondary school, and the family is renting a two-roomed house out of Kampala.

Her business is located in the city center next to the old taxi park where the demand for her goods is quite high. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to stock goods in preparation for the Christmas season. The increase in income will help her to pay school fees and rent for her work place.

loans.use: Stocking goods

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Mr. Tahir is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 50, married with five children, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Tahir sells beef in Saatli town, while his son grazes cattle. The income from the four cows they have is too low to support the family. That’s why Tahir applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for $500 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about 300-400 USD.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela is a very hard-working woman. She is 39 years old, is not married and is a single mother of three children who currently live wth her. She works two jobs in order to support her family. During the day she works at a nursery and at night she sells food from her home. She has very good experience in both of these arenas, especially in the latter as she has been doing it for nearly six years.

There is quite a lot of competition in the food selling market, so Adela has to work very hard at it. However, thanks to the time that she dedicates to it ,it has gone very well for her to date, although she obviously always needs money to keep developing her activities.

Due to this, she is not asking for much. As the market prices fluctuate, she will use this money to buy basic products such as: meat, potatoes, onions and oil. This present loan would be Adela's thrid with Agrocapital, having demonstrated good responsability in repaying the two previous loans. One can note that the loan goes up to $106.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Adela es una mujer trabajadora de 39 años de edad, no está casada, es mamá soltera de tres niños con los que vive actualmente. Ella se dedica a dos negocios que la ayudan a mantener a su familia, en el día atiende a niños en una guardería y por las noches vende comida en su domicilio. Tanto en el cuidado de niños en la guardería como en la venta de comidas tiene buena experiencia, sobre todo en el segundo negocio donde trabaja por cuenta propia ya cerca de 6 años. El mercado de venta de comidas es bastante amplio, por lo que Adela tiene que trabajar más duro ya que la competencia es elevada, pero gracias al tiempo que la se dedica a la venta de comidas hasta la fecha le va bien, claro que siempre necesita recursos económicos para porder seguir desarrollando sus actividades. Debido a que el monto solicitado es pequeño y los precios en el mercado son bastante fluctuantes, este crédito le servirá para la adquisición de productos básicos como ser: carne, papa, cebolla y aceite. La presente solicitud es la tercera de Adela con Agrocapital, habiendo demostrado gran responsabilidad y excelente cumplimiento en sus dos anteriores préstamos. Se hace notar que el monto del préstamo asciende a $us. 106.-.

loans.use: To increase her capital from selling food/Incremento de Capital de trabajo para la venta de comida

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela is a very hard-working, enthusiastic woman. Since she was ten years old, she has worked, selling shoes. her husband works as a watchman, and they have three children who are studying. It's difficult to meet the home epxenses, and the school fees with only her husband's salary. With the need for extra income Ángela started her own business, first selling very few shoes, but adding more customers. Now she fills large orders.

The desire to give her children a good education and for them to have a better future motivates her to work harder every day. Now Ángela is requesting a loan of $375 which she will use to purchase merchandise for the new season to have a better supply and increase her sales. She promises to return this amount in one month. Be an important part of Ángela's life. She and her family thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, desde hace diez años se dedica a la venta de calzado, su esposo trabaja de velador y tienen tres hijos que están estudiando, era difícil cubrir los gastos del hogar y las colegiaturas sólo con el salario de su esposo y ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Ángela inició su propio negocio, primero vendía muy pocos pares pero pronto fue haciéndose de más clientes y ahora ya surte grandes pedidos.

El deseo de darle a sus hijos una buena educación y que puedan tener un mejor futuro la motiva a esforzarse más cada día, ahora Ángela está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de la nueva temporada para tener un mejor surtido e incrementar sus ventas, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un mes. Forma parte importante en la vida de Ángela, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Anibal Amilkar

texts.es:
Anibal is married and has two little children, one of them is two years old and the youngest is nearly one year old. Anibal inherited a restaurant, where roasted chicken was traditionally served, from his father. Along with his wife, they have incorporated additional dishes, which have fortunately gained a great acceptance among his clients. He presently counts with the help of five employees and his business has rapidly grown. The love for his family and his wish to provide them with the best has motivated him to put forth an excellent work and become better every day.

In order to improve his business' appearance and buy more chairs and tables, Anibal is requesting a $1200 loan, which he has committed to repay in five months. With your help, Anibal’s business will be able to keep growing and offer jobs to more people, and he is sincerely grateful for any help you can give him.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Anibal es casado y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, una de 2 años y la más pequeña está por cumplir su primer año de edad. Anibal heredó de su padre un restaurante donde asaban pollos. Entre él y su esposa fueron incorporando la venta de otros platillos, que afortunadamente han tenido muy buena aceptación de sus clientes. Ahora cuenta con la ayuda de cinco empleados y ha hecho crecer este negocio rápidamente. El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de darles lo mejor lo ha motivado a realizar un excelente trabajo y a mejorar día a día.

Para poder mejorar la apariencia de su negocio y comprar más mesas y sillas, Anibal está solicitando un crédito de $1200 dólares, que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses. Con tu ayuda, Anibal podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio y ofrecer empleo a más personas, por lo que agradece sinceramente el apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: Renovation.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina is originally from San Juanito, Chihuahua. She is married and has 2 daughters. Her husband works in a sawmill, but his salary is not enough to cover all the family's expenses. Due to the need of extra income, Enedina started her own business by opening up an ice cream shop. Due to her clients' demands, she also added video game machines (video arcade). Thanks to her good customer service and good location, her sales have increased considerably.

To keep growing, Enedina is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD to purchase a video game machine in order to provide better customer service. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of the development of this business and of the lives of Enedina and her family. They greatly appreciate your trust and support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedina es originaria de San Juanito en Chihuahua, está casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero de la localidad pero el salario que recibe no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ante la falta de un ingreso extra Enedina inició su propio negocio vendiendo helados, a petición de sus clientes después incorporó la renta de máquinas de video juegos y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y a su buena ubicación se han incrementado mucho sus ventas.

Para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora Enedina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de una máquina de video para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Enedina y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To purchase a video game machine

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro lives in San Juanito, Chihuahua. She is married and has 2 children. Her children were her main motivation to start her own business years ago. She previously used to work in the United States in a mechanic shop. She learned the trade well, and when she went back to Mexico she decided to open up a mechanic shop with the help of her husband. Together they have been able to run a succesful business and provide great customer service.

In order to continue to grow, Socorro is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 USD which she will use to purchase the material she needs to do car repairs. Since car parts/material is scarce in the area where she lives, she needs to place an order and leave a deposit. She commits to repay this amount within 3 months. By helping this family, you will also help their quality of life. They will always be thankful!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de San Juanito vive Socorro, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio, anteriormente ella trabajaba en Estados Unidos en una carrocería, ahí aprendió este oficio y ante la falta de empleo que hay en México decidió emprender su negocio donde recibe la ayuda de su esposo, juntos han logrado hacer crecer el negocio y mejorar la calida del servicio que ofrecen.

Para continuar creciendo, Socorro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra del material que necesitan en las reparaciones, y como es muy escaso en su localidad necesitan hacer un pedido y quiere dejar una parte en reserva, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: To purchase more material

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios is married and has 4 children. They live in San Juanito, Chihuahua. Due to the lack of jobs in town and the need to provide for his family, Juan started his own business about 10 years ago. He sells used auto parts (junkyard). He has become well-known in his town and his sales have increased.

In order to continue to grow, Juan is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD to purchase more merchandise to provide a better variety/quality of products and to provide a better customer service. He commits to repay this loan within 3 months. Be part of this business and support Juan! He and his family thank you very much!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan de Dios es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, ellos vienen en la localidad de San Juanito, Chihuahua. La falta de empleo que hay en el pueblo y la necesidad de obtener los recursos que necesita su familia motivaron a Juan a emprender su propio negocio con la venta de autopartes usadas hace 10 años, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha incrementado sus ventas, mejorando la calidad de los productos que comercializa.

Para poder continuar creciendo Juan está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y mejorar su servicio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante de este crecimiento y decídete a apoyar a Juan, él y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase more spare auto parts

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Mr. C. has a business selling candies and products for children's parties. This business is the source of income for the family, and both my wife and I work in it. We want to invest more in the business in order to have more inventory and a greater variety of goods for the parties. We request a loan of $1200 for the purchase of merchandise and products for parties.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. C. Cuenta con un negocio de dulcería y productos para fiestas infantiles. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de la familia en el negocio, trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Queremos invertir le mas al negocio sin descapitalizarnos lo que queremos es tener mas inventario y variedad de artículos para fiestas. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la compra de mercancía y artículos para fiestas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for children's party store

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu J. is thirty three years old and married with five children.  Married at an early age, Ramatu was forced start a business to meet family expenses when her husband was unemployed.  She now owns a small stall and sells peanut butter, chicken stock, onions, and chili pepper.  Her husband also assists her in managing the business.  She is requesting a loan of $200 to expand her business.

loans.use: Expansion of her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is married with four children.  She is married  to a petty trader. This twenty six year old mother is very concerned about her children’s welfare, especially their education.  She said her business provides income her children's future education.  She runs a stall selling local products such as pepper, peanuts, and beans.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $175 to purchase seven bags of chili peppers to further expand her business.

loans.use: Expansion of her market stall which sells local products.

loans.name: Sallaymatu

texts.en: Sallaymatu K. is married with four children.  She is thirty eight years old and runs a stall selling peanuts and local products. Sallaymatu’s income supports family expenses and she is determined to do more to increase her profits.  Her previous loan improved her business and she would like a loan of $175 for the same purpose.

loans.use: Expansion of market stall for selling local products.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu S. is married with one child.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. Mariatu is a twenty six year old mother who sells fresh fish  She said her income supplements her husband’s income to meet household expenses.  She increased her business volume with her previous loan and would like to borrow more for the same purpose.

loans.use: To increase stock for fresh fish selling business.

loans.name: Pa Amidu

texts.en: Pa Amidu C. is fifty years old and married with children.   His wife is also a petty trader who is trying to supplement her husband’s income.  Pa Amidu has been running his clothing business for a long time.  He said the income from the business is mainly for school fees and medical care.  The rest of the family expenses are being taken care of by his wife.  As some of the children are advancing to secondary schools and college, it means more money is needed, so he is requesting a loan of $350 to help increase his profit.

loans.use: Increase the stock of his clothing business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata B. is twenty five years old, married to a petty trader, and the mother of two children.  With her income from her fish business, she assists her husband in taking care of the family. She is requesting $200 to invest in the business and to purchase a cooler for preserving the fish.

loans.use: Investment in her fish business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is thirty two years old and married with five children.  Like other female petty traders, Isatu took a loan from a friend at a high interest rate to start her business and she did not realize a profit until she completed the loan.  With her previous loan from the program, she was able to realize profit and also diversify her business.  She was very excited when narrating the story.   She said, “My income is for my children and I would like to improve my business to earn more income for them."

loans.use: Improve her business through increased food stock.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa M. L. is thirty one years old and married with two children.  He sells plastic sandals at the center of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone and his business is the sole source of income for his family.  Musa also takes care of his younger sisters and brothers.  His initial capital earned him a meager profit.  With his previous loan, he was able to increase his stock and is requesting a loan of $170 for the same purpose.

loans.use: Increase his profit by purchasing more stock for selling.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul is 25 years old and sells cigarettes and biscuits at the market in Magburaka.  He is married with a child and has a future to build in terms of a good family life.  He would like to develop his business into a big store in the future.  He said his previous loan has allowed him to move his business one step ahead.  Mr. B. therefore is requesting $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Needs to increase his capital for purchasing more goods for trading.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: Gibrilla T. is a father of two children. He runs a small store selling soft drinks, water, and other essential items.  He used to take the goods on credit and could hardly make a profit.  With his previous loan, Gibrilla said he has been able to stand on his own capital.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $200 to continue building his capital base.

loans.use: Increasing his capital base to ensure larger profits.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu S. is thirty five years old, married, and a mother of four children.  Musu survives through her business.  She sells local cooked food in the open space in Magburaka town.  She has a good market and is able to purchase her stock on wholesale.  She would like to improve her eating shelter and buy more ingredients.  She is requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: Improve her restaurant shelter and purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja K. is forty years old and is married to a teacher whose income comes irregularly.  As a mother of five children, she needs to supplement her husband’s salary to meet the family expenses.  She runs a store selling soft drinks and mineral water.  She said she has a high demand during the summer months and is planning to increase her stock. A loan of $175 will enable her to increase her profit and meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: Increase supply of soft drinks during peak times.

loans.name: Moe

texts.en: Being a 54 year old mother of 10 and grandmother of 26, as well as one of the elderly in her community, Moe runs her business just like any other business person.  Two years ago, she received financial assistance from SPBD and that helped start the business, which is a well-known shop within the district.  Although it is successful, she has again requested financial support to maintain the shop in proper order, as well as to set up a communication service for passers-by and many without phones in the area.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the business

loans.name: Lauiula

texts.en: As a 46 year old wife and mother of 2 schooling and 5 working children who is taking care of her in-laws, Lauiula thinks that the income from her business is not enough to take care of her family.  Together with her husband, they work in their taro plantation, which is also the sole source of income.  Thus, she requested aid from SPBD and with this loan, and plans to expand her business in order to earn more to cater for the entire family.

loans.use: Expand business and buy more bananas and yams

loans.name: Maoiai

texts.en: One of the assets in Maoiai’s life is their taro plantation.  Being unemployed with eight children at 48 years old, it is the only source of income for her family.  She enjoys seeing the joy on people’s faces when they buy her products. The financial help she is requesting is very much needed and will rapidly increase the quality and quantity of products being produced, as well as repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and for maintenance of her house

loans.name: José Leobardo

texts.es:
José Leobardo has been in the business of selling roasted chickens and Mexican antojitos for over 2 years. It's a family business that my son and I work in, and we are concerned that our sales will decrease during the cold season, since the location is not set up for cold. We are requesting a loan of $1200 to prepare the location for cold.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. José Leobardo tiene mas de 2 años en el negocio de ventas de pollos asados y antojitos Mexicanos. Es el negocio de la familia en el trabajamos dos de mis hijo y yo, nos esta preocupando que bajen nuestras ventas en tiempo de frió ya que el local no esta acondicionado para la temporada de frió. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para acondicionar el local.

loans.use: Set up location for cold season

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Running a business is not easy but for Senerita, she enjoys it.  Being 29 years old and a mother of three, she sells various products in her stall at the local flea market, but mainly kava bowls with different designs and different shapes.  After all of the expenses, she makes a profit which helps provide for the family and pay for her children’s school fees.  She has requested aid to increase her supplies and products to be sold, and income gained will go to fund her children’s education.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Planting and harvesting taro is the only source of income for 46 year old Susana, a wife and energetic mother of 5.  When she first joined SPBD, the first loan she received was used to buy an extension of land and chemicals for killing pests.  This will be her fifth loan from SPBD and it will be used to build a fence to keep stray animals out of that plantation so that the crops will not be destroyed or damaged.  The money from the sales will help fund her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase barrier fence

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: For taro plantation owner Tin, her family of six is her main priority and because of this, she does everything to provide for them, no matter what. When she first heard about SPBD, she requested assistance and with her first loan, purchased supplies to start her business.  Thus, the business is flourishing and she would like to buy chemicals and fertilizers to ensure that the products are of the best quality.  Money from the sales will help to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: At 40 years old with three young children, Ana owns a taro plantation right behind her house.  Her husband is unemployed like her and they work together for the betterment of the plantation and the family. It is the only source of income for her family; it puts food on the table and children through school.  She has requested financial aid to buy chemicals that would kill pests and diseases from demolishing the crops.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en: Faavae is a forty-five year old mother of two grown up sons.  Both her sons have moved overseas for employment opportunities.  Her husband works hard in order for the business to keep going.  Things went well and the money became plentiful so that they could pay back their loan.  They are asking for more assistance to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tofia

texts.en: A wife and 32 year old mother of 2 children, Tofia owns a ¼ acre of cabbage garden.  She sells the products at the local market in town, and the journey back and forth has taken its toll on her.  To transport the resources back and forth, she hires a local transport to deliver it.  In the previous months, the weather has been unreliable and damaged a large amount of crops.  Therefore, she has requested financial help to purchase a fence for the protection of crops and fertilizers for growing crops of good quality.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and barrier fence

loans.name: Mataiumu

texts.en: Having a diabetic husband and 7 children is not an easy thing for Mataiumu.  At the age of 38, she struggles to get her children to school and take care of her husband.  She sells vegetables on the roadside and sometimes in the market, but when there is not enough money for bus fare, she takes them in a wheelbarrow and sells them from house to house even in the hot sun.  Now, they also own a taro plantation which has helped with their financial status.  In the future, she plans to have her own market to sell the vegetables in.

loans.use: To assist with her business and to improve her home

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Navy is divorced with 6 children: 2 sons and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production business in 1992. 2 of her daughters also weave silk at home.

Mrs. H. has taken out 2 loans from MAXIMA to date. She is now requesting a loan of $600. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread as well as pay fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Srey Touch got married in 1993 and has 3 children: 1 son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production business in 1991. Her eldest daughter assists her with weaving silk at home when she is free after school. Her husband is a rice farmer.

Mrs. Hour has taken out two loans from MAXIMA to date. She is now requesting a loan of $600. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and building one more loom for her daughter.

loans.name: Phath

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Phath got married in 1969 and has 7 children: 3 sons and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her parents and started her silk production business in 1963. Her eldest son also weaves silk at home. 2 of her daughters are working at the garment factory in Phnom Penh and her husband is a rice farmer.

To date, Mrs N. has taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan of $250. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and embroidering on her loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering.

payments.comment:
Dear lender, 

Mrs. Phath Neang has been pay off her loan early befor contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Solema

texts.en: Being a hard-working mother is not an easy task, especially when you have to provide for both your children and grandchildren. Starting with selling chips, Solema now sells barbeque and handicrafts. Solema still believes that when there is no pain, there is no gain. At 54 years old, she is on her feet all the time. She uses the money she earns from the sales to take care of her family. Furthermore, she plans to have her own stall in the local flea market.

loans.use: To assist with her business

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Tha got married in 1979 and has 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. Her husband is a rice and vegetable farmer. She learned to weave silk from her parents and started her silk production business in 1979. 3 of her daughters also weave silk at home. Before borrowing money from MAXIMA, she had only one loom. After a series of loans from MAXIMA she has built 2 more.

To date, she has taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan of $700. She will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and embroidering for her and her daughters' looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering.

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Mrs. Tha Oeur has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract. Thank you so much for lending to her.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
