Mrs. S. Ry is divorced with 2 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1987 and started her silk production business then. Now her eldest daughter also weaves silk at home. She was able to do this with her first loan from MAXIMA, which enabled Mrs Ry to buy a loom for her daughter to use.

She has now taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA to date. She is currently requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material and sewing thread, as well as pay fees for selecting, embroidering and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Yay

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yay got married in 1978 and has 7 children: 3 sons and 4 daughters. She started a business buying and reselling fresh fish in 1997. Her husband is a rice farmer and all of her children study at the local school.

Mrs C. has taken out 2 loans from MAXIMA in the past. She is now seeking a loan of $300. She will use this loan to buy fresh fish to resell in the local market. She is capable of handling the loan and can repay it without any problem.

loans.use: Buying fresh fish to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Srey Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Srey Ton is married and has 1 daughter. She learned to weave silk from her sister in 2001 and started her silk production business then as well. Her husband grows rice and runs a horse cart to carry firewood from one to village to another.

Mrs L. has taken out 3 loans from MAXIMA in the past. She is now requesting a loan of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and buying a sugar cane machine to make juice to sell in the village.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread; fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms; buying a sugar cane machine to make  juice and sell in the village.

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: A tailor by profession, Faaiuga is also a wife and a mother to 4 children. From sewing, she gets money to take care of her family. With a taxi on hand, it really helps with delivery, and receiving financial compensation from SPBD has been a great help. She wants to own her own sewing shop.

loans.use: Top purchase sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: Tepa

texts.en: For 5 years, Tepa has been fishing. She is married with 3 children, and her husband takes care of their pumpkin patch as she sells fish in the village. (She is pictured with the pumpkins). Sometimes, she takes the pumpkins to the fish market.  Earlier, she received aid from SPBD that enabled her to buy fishing gear, fishing nylons, fishing floater and other materials necessary for fishing.  She hopes to own another fishing boat soon.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Faaluaina

texts.en: Faaluaina is a wife and mother whose household contains her husband, five relatives, five children and herself.  Because they were both unemployed, they had a hard time raising their children. She heard about SPBD through other ladies in the village. She then decided to join knowing that there was nowhere else she could get financial support.  Starting off with popcorn, she now has a plantation to get more income to take care of the family. Sales vary but she manages to save and spend at the right time to get family necessities.

loans.use: To assist with her popcorn business

loans.name: Sery

texts.en:
Sery C. is a dynamic, 40-year-old single mother. She is an expert in hairstyle and has more than 17 years of experience in her activity. She lives with her son in Marcory, a suburb in the south of the Abidjan District.

C. is well-known in the Marcory open market where she has been exercising her talents for years. C.'s revenues are mainly used to take care to household expenses and the educational costs for her son. She would like now to go above the day-to-day survival living and establish a sustainable source of revenue that can help her to face the educational costs for her son who is now in secondary school. She wants to open a cosmetic sales store as an ideal complementary activity to her current business.

loans.use: Sery Cyprienne, hairdresser, will use the loan to open a cosmetics store

loans.name: Mamed

texts.en:
Mr. Mamed is a vulnerable low-income person. He is 19, single, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Mamed sells beef in Saatli town and grazes his small herd of cattle. The income from the four cows he has is too low to develop his business. That’s why Mamed applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $400 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of a cow is about 300-400 USD. The rest of the amount he intends to use to buy feed.

loans.use: To buy one cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Yao

texts.en:
Yao N’guessan Y. is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children and her younger boy plays in a local soccer team. She lives with her family in Marcory, a suburb in the south of Abidjan District. Y.'s husband is retired from a civil servant position and no longer significantly contributes to the household expenses.

Thus Y. who sells smoked fish since 1998 in the Marcory open market is actually her family's main resource provider. She cares about the educational expenses of her children. Y. wants to expand her activities to strengthen and sustain her revenues. She also has to face the school re-entry expenses of her kids.

loans.use: Yao N’guessan Yvette will use the loan to pay education expenses of her children.

loans.name: Hosiat

texts.en:
Hosiat is a pretty businesswoman. She is the mother of 5 children. She started her business in 1995, after the collapse of the USSR. Her little salary was not enough for supporting such a big family, and she decided to trade perfumes in the open-air place near the big shop in Ckalovsk, Khujand.

In the beginning she had a limited number of goods on the one table. It was a difficult time for her because she did not have any clients. Gradually she expanded her assortment and attracted many clients. Due her creative nature and sociable personality, she could find distributors of famous firms as Oriflame, Dove, Garineer and Kalina and concluded agreements with them for a long partnership. Today she has her own shop in Chkalovsk; additionally, she rented one stall of soft drinks for her daughter for the summer season. Now Hosiat wishes to buy this stall, and in the winter she wants to trade coffee and some kind of cakes here.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Noruniso

texts.en:
S. Noruniso is a young business lady. She is not marred and lives with her mother and two little sisters in Chkalovsk, Khujand. Her father went to Russia 9 years ago and disappeared. So she is the one member in her family who earns money for the family's needs.

From the beginning she bought newspapers from Khujand and sold them in Chkalovsk. She started her business in 2000. She did not have a certain trade place, she went from one market to another and tried to sell her newspapers every day without a day off. Gradually she could save money to rent one little kiosk for business.

Today she has her own business kiosk, where she sells different kinds of magazines and newspapers. She has good experience in the trade of newspapers, and that’s why she knows her clients' styles and always tries to meet their needs. Her future plan is expanding her assortment by including several new magazines about sport.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ouedraogo

texts.en: Ouedraogo J. P., “African cow-boy,” is 29 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and their 3 children in Port-Bouët, very populated suburbs in the south of Abidjan District. Two children are in primary school, and the youngest is a baby boy of 10 months. He is a meat and cow skin wholesaler at the Port-Bouët slaughter-house of cattle. The cow skins are sold to local shoe makers. P. has more than 8 years of experience in this business. He joined AE&I microcredit program in June 2005 and has already taken loans from AE&I that he reimbursed in a good manner. P. will use the loan to purchase cows. P. is dynamic and ambitious.

loans.use: Ouedraogo Pierre will use the loan to purchase cows

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira is divorced and lives in the Salyan region in Yenikand village. She does not have children. This 39-year-old woman has her own business. 5 years ago she started a farming business. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Gafur

texts.en:
Gafur, 39 years old, is the father of 2 children. He has 7 years of experience in the business of selling spare parts. He and his family live in Salyan region in Khaladj village.

Gafur would like to receive a loan of US$1200 to use to buy spare parts so that he will be able to attract more clients and increase his income from this shop which he owns.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts so as to attract customers

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
N. Jalia is a member of Kigasa Akimanya, literally meaning "It helps one who knows it." She started with a loan of USD 28 in 2001. Her business went smoothly and she decided to increase the loan amount to USD 150 the second time. She paid it very well and currently she is applying for a loan of USD 450.

N. Jalia is married with four children, three girls and one boy. Two of her children are working whereas the other two are still going to school. One is in senior four and the other in senior five. She treasures education and this is why she wants all her children to finish at least college. She is 52 years of age and still going strong. She is confident she will pay back the loan without any difficulty because of the ready market and her previous experience.

loans.use: Increase stock of green bananas

loans.name: Alim

texts.en:
15 years ago, Alim started this business. He is 56 years old, married, and has 5 children. He lives with his family in Salyan region in Khaladj village.
He is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for improving his farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides so as to increase his yield

loans.name: Zuhuriddin

texts.en:
Zuhuriddin is a designer. He has his own workshop in the hospital. His business is to sew coats for doctors of this hospital. He is marred and his wife, Suraiohon, helps him in his business. (She is in the photo). He has three children who go to school.

In the beginning in 1990 he worked at home. He took orders for sewing clothes at home. Gradually he could save money for renting one room for a workshop at the big hospital in Khujand in 2004. Today they have a great number of clients. They additionally take orders for sewing bedclothes and draperies for hospitals. Presently Zuhuriddin wants to open one workshop to sew covers for cars. He noticed a good demand for this kind of product. For this purpose he is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Beyler

texts.en:
A. Beyler is a 47-year-old married man who has three children. He is a farmer. He is from the Lachin region and right now lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses.

In 2005 Beyler borrowed US$500 to add to his own savings of $250 and purchased another milk cow. Since January 2006, prices have doubled. Beyler applied for a loan of $800 from Normicro to purchase two calves for meat production and expanded his business, considerably increasing his income.

Beyler would like to receive a $1,000 loan in order to acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 14 months. He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat Ssekandi is a retired civil servant who has been doing business for the last nine years. Her first loan was USD 28 dollars in 1998. She worked very hard and graduated to take a loan of USD 550 in 2001. She is grateful to Feed the Children Uganda, the parent company of Pearl Microfinance, for their support. “I bought my first car using a Feed the Children Uganda loan," she says.

She is happily married with eight children; fortunately all are independent. She supports her husband who is blind and one niece. Right now she has 1000 one-week-old chicks. In the coming months she anticipates increase in consumption of feed and thus needs more funds. She is currently constructing a bigger house to accommodate over 2000 birds.

loans.use: Buy chicks' mash and stock layers’ mash to take advantage of bulk purchase.

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sony got married in 1984 and has 5 children: a son and 4 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production business in 1992. Her eldest daughter assists her with weaving at home when she has spare time after school. Her husband is a building construction worker.

Mrs S. has taken out 5 loans from MAXIMA in the past. She is now requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay for selecting and building one more loom for her eldest daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and embroidering, building one more loom for her daughter.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sony Sum has enough money to pay off her loan. Thank you.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif has his own business. He is from Salyan region, Yenikand village. This 49-year-old man is married and has 3 children. 
He is requesting a loan of  US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He has been in this business for 13 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sim got married in 2003 and has 1 son. She learned to weave silk from her sister before getting married and has run her own silk production business since 2003. Her husband learned from his neighbor and assists her with her weaving during his free time from fishing.

She has taken out three loans in the past from MAXIMA. She is now requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay to build another loom for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and building one more loom for her husband.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Ms. Sim Por has been pay off her loan early before finishing date and now she also asking a new loan for contiuing her business.

Thank you so much.

loans.name: Natig

texts.en:
Natig R. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He is from Azerbaijan in the Armenian conflict territory, Gubadli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Natig began his business 8 years ago. He is the only income-earner for his family. In 1999 he opened an area for car repairing in Sumgayit city.

In 2004 Natig borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded his business, bought necessary tools and equipments for his repair area, increased the number of his clients, and considerably increased his income. The second time, he borrowed $600 and bought new apparatuses and other car repair necessities.

Now, he needs to borrow $800 to expand his repair area, make necessary changes, and to repair his workplace. He thinks that this expansion will improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay the loan within 14 months.

loans.use: To expand repair area, to make necessary changes, and to repair workplace

loans.name: Sri

texts.id: Mrs. Sri I., 41 years old, owns a food mart. She lives at Jl. Ahmad Yani, Lumintang Denpasar Bali with her husband, three sons and an aunt. Her aunt help her with the business everyday. She opens the mart from 6AM to 6PM. Every other day she goes to the market to purchase her items. She spends 400,000 IDR each purchase(1 USD~9,000 IDR). Her daily income is 250,000 IDR on average. She wishes to expand her business in terms of volume and variety. The expansion will help her to cover for her family's living expense.

loans.use: Membeli barang-barang dagangan dari pasar untuk kemudian dijual di warung

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim H. is 38 years old and a habitant of Huroson district. He has a secondary level education. He is married and has 5 children. Abdurahim grew up in the village so the skills of breeding stock were familiar to him from childhood. All his life he worked on a farm. He grew cotton and worked to breed stock on the farm. He enjoyed his work but times have changed and now he works in own farm breeding stock. He feeds animals to sell their meat.

With the loan amount of $1000, the client is going to buy three bull-calves for feeding and feed-stuff. This loan gives him the opportunity to increase the amount of animals, so village habitants can buy meat cheaper in their local butcher shop. The client is going to pay off the loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy three bull-calves for feeding and selling

loans.name: Sifah

texts.en:
Z. Sifah is married with two children, a boy and girl. She started her business way back in 2001 after finishing a nursing course. She borrowed USD 200 from an uncle and started a drug shop which has grown to an inpatient and out patient health centre.

Since 2001, she has been using loans and currently she is servicing a loan of USD 350. Most ailments in this area are malaria and bacterial infections which is why anti-malarial drugs and antibiotics take the biggest percentage of the drugs stocked.

Her average net profit per month is about USD 55 and this is mainly used to cater for household necessities as well as plowing back into the business.

loans.use: Buy five cartons of Cortem, a new anti-malarial drug,  and three cartons of antibiotics.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.en:
Maksuda K. is 28 years old and a habitant of Yavan district. She has a secondary level education. She is single. Currently she works in a local hospital as a nurse. She lives with her parents and helps them with their finances.

Maksuda has been breeding stock for 11 months. This kind of activity is an additional source of income. Because of this business, Maksuda helped her brother to enter university.

With the loan amount, the client is going to buy two cattle. This loan helps to increase the amount of cattle and gives the opportunity to local habitants to obtain cattle closer to home and cheaper. The client is going to pay off loan amount over 12 months.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Kasdu

texts.id:
Mr. Kasdu sells light snacks that kids love, like crackers, around the neighborhood using a motorcycle. With $35 daily capital, Kasdu buys his goods to be sold from a supplier. He usually works from 9 am to 7 pm and earns about $6 profit daily. With that earning Kasdu supports his wife and only child, and whatever left was saved to pay his land rent (Kasdu built his own home from simple materials like "gedeg"/bamboo walls and dirt floor). The loan from DINARI will be used to finance a new motorcycle. Hi plans to sell his old motorcycle, which is not so reliable anymore. Kasdu expects that his earnings will increase with a new and more reliable motorcycle.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Bapak Kasdu mempunyai usaha menjual makanan ringan dengan cara keliling naik sepeda motor. Adapun jenis makanan yang dijual seperti: makanan ringan untuk anak-anak, krupuk dan sebagainya. Dengan modal perhari Rp.350.000, Kasdu membeli bahan dagangannya tersebut di suplier dan mulai keliling dari jam 09.00 sampai jam 19.00 dan keuntungan yang diperolehnya sebesar Rp.60.000.-, dengan hasil tersebutlah Kasdu menghidupi istri dan 1 orang anaknya dan sebagian disisihkan untuk membayar sewa tanah Rp.25.000 perbulan sedangkan rumahnya dibangun sendiri dan sangat sederhana dengan bangunannya “gedeg” dan lantainya tanah. Pinjaman dari dinari digunakan untuk membeli sepeda motor yang lebih baik dan menjual motornya yang lama karena motornya yang lama sudah tua sehingga jalannya agak lambat, dengan harapan penghasilan akan meningkat.

loans.use: Purchase of Goods to be Sold

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil N. is a taxi driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Ismayil is married with three children and has been driving a taxi for ten years. He is looking for credit so that he can make repairs to his vehicle which is his main source of income. This is Ismayil’s second loan with Norwegian Microcredit which means that there were no problems with his first loan of US$600.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida, 40, is a widow and mother of one child. She lives with her child in Salyan region in Khaladj village.

11 years ago, Saida started her own business. In the beginning she bought a plot of land. Now she needs to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farm's yield. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$1200.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase her yield

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
S. Furkat began to engage in business in 2004. He rented one room for his business in the big bus station ”Abreshim.” His business is to sell different kinds of toys. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He has a high education as accountant, but he could not find a job with a good salary for supporting his family's needs.

He decided to sell toys because he loves children very much. Every day he has many clients as his trade place is situated in the bus stop. He buys his goods every week from the central market Panjshanbe in Khujand. He says that he tries to attract his little clients by the variety of his goods. In the future, he plans to purchase a number of modern automatic toys. For this purpose he is requesting $1000.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en: Sefer E. is a taxi driver, as well as a seasonal fruit and vegetable seller, in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Sefer is married with three children and has been driving his taxi for the last two years. Sefer is looking for funding so that he can make some much-needed repairs to his taxi. This is Sefer’s second loan with Normicro, which means that there were no problems with his first loan of US$225.

loans.use: To make repairs on his taxi

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.pt:
A single mother of 2 children, she entered the program in 2006 and took a loan of 6000 meticais, which she invested in materials to make baby clothes for newborns. The business is evolving and in the future, she plans to open a shop in the city of Xai-Xai, for sales. At this time, she sells from home and at maternity wards.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Mae solteira de 2 criancas, entrou para o programa em 2006 e tomou 6.000, que investiu em materiais para fazer roupa de bebes recem-nascidos. O negocio esta a evoluir e no futuro amesma pretende abrir uma loja na cidade do Xai-Xai, para a venda, neste momento vende em sua casa e nas maternidades.

loans.use: Invest in raw material for production

loans.name: Mirsadig

texts.en:
Mirsadig is 37 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is from Salyan region, Khaladj village. He has been in the farming business for 4 years. 
Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his yield

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en:
Dayanat is 47 years old, divorced, and has a child. He lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village and has been in this business for 15 years.
Now he needs a loan of US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield

loans.name: Hoshimjon

texts.en:
Hoshimjon S. is 30 years old, and he has a high agrarian education. He is married and has 3 children. Currently he works as an agronomist in a farm. Also he has been breeding stock for four years; he has a lot of experience and skills in breeding stock. He has a cow-house and a small piece of land where he grows corn and trefoil (clover) for animal feed. This kind of activity is an additional source of income.

With the loan amount of $1000, the client is going to buy 3 bull-calves for feeding and selling. This loan gives him the opportunity to increase the amount of animals, so village habitants can buy bull-calf cheaper near their homes. Client is going to pay off the loan amount in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy three cows for feeding and selling

loans.name: Lucia Fansiso

texts.pt:
Lucia entered FDM's program in 2006, with a loan of 10,000 meticais. She is married, with 4 children, and at the time, she had one stand. Today, she has 3 stands. Her children are studying and she's improved their diet. She would like to take a new loan in September.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Entrou para o FDM em 2006, com umprestimo de 10.000,00mts. casada, com 4 filhos, quando entrou para o programa tinha um pavilhao, hoje tem 3 pavilhoes, os filhos estao a estudar e melhourou a sua dieta alimentar. Vai tomar outro emprestimo em setembro.

loans.use: Purchase roosters, feed, and medication

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is the father of 5 children. He is 42 years old and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has his own shop where he sells spare parts and so he manages to support his family. He has run this business for 4 years now.

Eldaniz is requesting a loan of US$1200 to buy spare parts to expand his inventory and better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to diversify his inventory

loans.name: Burhan

texts.id:
As the head of his household, Burhan earns his living to supports his family from his motorcycle dealer business. However, his business has uncertain monthly earnings. Sometimes on a good month, Burhan may earn $150 per month, but many times he earned nothing when no one buys his motorcycle. On periods like that, Burhan has to rely on his wife's $3.5 per day earnings as a seamstress. After learning about DINARI, Burhan applied for credit to purchase a new sewing machine, so his wife may work from home as a seamstress. Currently his wife pays a royalty of 25 cents per piece to her employer. His wife usually can work on 5-7 pieces in a 4 hour workday, so by going on her own working from home, Burhan's wife can get $1.25 additional earnings per day. Burhan has no child yet, he plans to use his savings to fix his home in Java.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sebagai seorang kepala rumah tangga Burhan menghidupi keluarganya sebagai Makelar sepeda motor yang pendapatannya tidak pasti, kadang-kadang sebulan bisa menghasilkan uang Rp.1.500.000 kalau sepeda motornya ada yang membeli, kadang-kadang sepeda motornya tidak laku sehingga Burhan hanya mengharapkan pendapatan istrinya yang sebagai buruh menjahit dengan upah Rp.35.000 perhari. Setelah memperoleh informasi mengenai DINARI, Burhan langsung mengajukan permohonan kredit yang rencananya akan dibelikan mesin jahit sehingga istrinya bisa menjahit dirumah sehingga pendapatannya bertambah, karena pasuh yang dijahit bisa dikerjakan dirumah dengan upah Rp.2.500 per potong pasuh. Karena istrinya bisa mengerjakan 5 – 7 potong pasuh selama 4 jam sehingga pendapatannya bisa bertambah menjadi Rp,12.500. Walaupun Burhan belum mempunyai anak, semua pendapatannya rencananya digunakan untuk memperbaiki tempat tinggalnya yang ada di Jawa.

loans.use: Purchase of new Sewing Machine for His Wife's Seamstress Business

loans.name: Hat

texts.en: Hat L. has received loans from Mekong Plus on 3 separate occasions, one of which was funded by Kiva. Hat and his wife, Duoc, would like to receive another loan in order to continue to expand their small microbusiness.  Before the loans, they earned between 5,000 and 10,000 VND per day. The loans have increased their profits to between 10,000 and 15,000 VND per day. They were abL. to buy a new refrigerator with their new profits.

loans.use: Buy more stock for their grocery store

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.en:
Nuriya S. is a pensioner. Her husband died 8 years ago and she was left to fend alone for 7 children. She was compelled to start whatever business she could. She had 10 chickens so she decided to sell eggs. Her first batch was 20 eggs, and she sold them to the canteen located in the station “Abreshim”, Khujand.

Soon the canteen manager offered to let her sell her eggs at a little stand outside of the canteen. Gradually Nuriya increased her working capital and was able to include some different kinds of goods to her inventory such as cigarettes, cookies, and plastic bags. Now she would like to further increase the variety of her goods. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 800.

loans.use: offer a greater variety of goods at her little stand

loans.name: Dembele

texts.en: Dembélé M. is married. She has 9 children. Her husband is a retired domestic electrician. M. is today the main resource contributor to her family. She is a traditional medicine products seller in Marcory, a suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. She is 51 years old, and her business has flourished since she started receiving microcredit from AE&I. That allowed her to buy a store in which she could do her business in a better and more hygienic environment. She will use the loan to diversify her products offered with cosmetics products. M. is honest and a good performer.

loans.use: Dembélé Mariam will use the loan to diversify her products offered.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
Nasim S. has been engaged in business since 2000. In the beginning he worked as a clerk in the shop of his brother-in-law. At present, he has his own shop selling a variety of goods--toys, candies, soft drinks, household goods, etc.. Nasim says that his goal is to attract more clients and his shop is competitive in comparison to other shops.

Nasim's business is located in the big station ”Abreshim”, so he tries to meet all the needs of his customers. As people who stop by are going for a long trip, Nasim wants them to be able to find whatever they may need in his shop. He buys his goods every week from the central market at Panjshanbe, in Khujand. His turnover is rapid and in future he wants to increase the variety of goods he offers. He is requesting a loan of US$ 1,150 for this purpose.

In the photo you see his sister, Suraio, who helps him out when he goes to the wholesale market to replenish his inventory.

loans.use: offering a greater variety of goods in his shop

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
"I would like to borrow money to buy more rice for our rice husking business". A few loans later, Mrs Phan Thị Nhàn and her family have built a small,home based, business of rice husking. Her husband is working alongside with her. Everyday he transports rice and the rice husk from their home to the market 5 km from their home to sell to the villagers from Hưng Nguyên. Their goal is to be able to provide an education for their 2 children. Mrs Phan Thị Nhàn is now requesting a new loan of 750 USD to expand her rice husking business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

"Tôi muốn có vốn mua thêm thóc lúa để hàng ngày xay xát gạo đem bán cho bà con". Sau những lần vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, gia đình chị Phan Thị Nhàn đã có được một cửa hàng nhỏ ngay tại nhà để đặt máy xay xát và dự trữ thóc gạo. Chồng chị hiện nay cũng không đi làm thuê mà phụ vợ đem gạo và những thực phẩm chăn nuôi từ những chiếc máy xay xát ra chợ cách nhà 5 km để bán cho người dân trong huyện Hưng Nguyên. Chị cho biết hai anh chị sẽ phấn đấu cho hai con trai hiện đang học cấp 1 được học hành đầy đủ. Chị đang làm hồ sơ vay mức 750 USD để tăng lượng gạo xay xát mỗi ngày.

loans.use: buy rough rice, husked and sell it

loans.name: Hidogul

texts.en:
Hidogul R. is a pretty young businesswoman. Her little shop of children's clothes is located in the station ”Abreshim”, Khujand. She is herself a young mother of two. Her younger son is 8 months old.

Hidogul loves children very much and she likes her business. She buys her goods from Istaravshan, and her mother looks after her baby at home. Her husband helps with transportation of her goods. Her turnover is fast because she has many faithful customers. For the coming autumn season she wants to purchase modern warm clothes for children. She is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal goods to augment her inventory

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Mỹ is 30 years old. She and her family live in Hưng Tây, in the province of Nghệ An. She and her husband have a rice husking business for retails. They also breed poultry and calves using the free land around their house. They have 3 young children and their dream is to be able to provide them a good education. This is the main motivation factor for Mrs Mỹ and her husband. They are requesting a loan of 625 USD which will be invested in the rice husking business and buy more breeding ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Mỹ năm nay ngoài 30 tuổi. Chị cùng gia đình đang sinh sống tại xã Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Ngoài kinh doanh xay xát gạo, chị Mỹ và chồng vẫn chăn nuôi vịt và bò để tận dụng khoảng đất trống quanh nhà. Hiện gia đình chị có 3 đứa con nhỏ nên với nguyện vọng cho lo cho các con đầy đủ, vợ chồng chị lúc nào cũng chăm chỉ làm ăn. Xin vay mức 625 USD, anh chị đã thống nhất đầu tư một phần vào việc xay xát gạo tại nhà, một phần dùng để mua vịt chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy rough rice, husked and sell it

loans.name: Lucrecia Vicente

texts.pt:
Lucrecia is a nurse, married with 1 child. She entered the program in 2004, with a loan of 1800 meticais to purchase domestic goods. On her 3rd loan, she invested in starting a business to sell basic goods. Today the business has developed and she would like another loan in September.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

'e infermeira ,casada com 1 filho, entrou para o programa em 2004, com um emprestimo de 1.800mts para compra de bens domesticos, no 3.emprestimo investiu para iniciar um negocio da venda de produtos de primeira necessida. Hoje o negocio desenvolveu e vai tomar outro emprestimo em setembro.

loans.use: Purchase of domestic goods

loans.name: Kyelem

texts.en:
Since 1998, Kyelem A. has been a butcher at the market of Port-Bouët, in the south of Abidjan District. He is 24 years old and has 2 children. A. is a dynamic and ambitious young man--very professional and focused on his business. He lives with his family in the very populated suburb of Port-Bouët.

A. will use the small loan he is presently requesting to pay school fees for his first son who will start primary school this month and to purchase 2 cows. A. took out his first loan from AE&I in November 2005 and has performed very well so far.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and pay school fees for his son in primary school

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram has 10 years of experience in the farming business. He is 37 years old , married, and has 3 children. He lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village.
He needs a loan of US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Confident with her selling skills, Mrs. Vo Thi T., 29 years old, who lives in Nghi Hoa commune, Nghi Loc district, Nghe An province, has had a fruit stall for 3 years. Everyday she and her husband wake up early in the morning to buy fruits and then bring it to their stall in the market. Her husband is a pedicab driver. He often helps her transport fruits and close the stall at the end of the days. They have 3 young children, two of whom are going to school. Mrs. T. and her husband are planning to borrow $375 to buy fruits and renew their stall.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Tự tin với duyên bán hàng của mình, chị Võ Thị Tính 29 tuổi ở xã Nghi Hòa, Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An đã duy trì sạp bán hoa quả của mình đến nay được 3 năm. Hàng ngày, hai vợ chồng chị thường dậy rất sớm đi mua hàng đem ra chợ bán, chồng chị làm nghề xích lô cũng giúp vợ chuyên chở và thu dọn hàng khi cuối ngày. Hiện tại gia đình có 3 cháu nhỏ trong đó có 2 cháu đang tuổi đến trường. Anh chị đã tính toán xin vay 375 USD để sửa sang lại sạp bán hoa quả và đa dạng thêm các sản phẩm hiện bán.

loans.use: buy fruits and renew her stall

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị L., 42 years old, lives in Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. She's raising her 2 children alone since her separation from her husband 3 years ago. Her older child is 21 and is attending school in electronic away from home. Her other child is 8 and is in 3rd grade. Mrs L. is the sole bread winner for her family. Her main revenue comes from selling bamboo shoots, pig raising and exploitation of her land of 3/10 acre. She requests a loan of 325 USD to buy a breeding pig and bamboo shoots for resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 42 tuổi, sống tại Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An, hiện đang nuôi 2 con ăn học. Đứa lớn năm nay 21 tuổi học nghề về điện tử ở xa, đứa nhỏ 8 tuổi đang theo học lớp 3. Sau khi chia tay chồng từ 3 năm trước, chị trở thành trụ cột chính về kinh tế trong gia đình. Nguồn thu nhập chính của chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán măng tươi, và một phần từ 3 sào ruộng. Lần vay vốn này, chị dự định vay 325 USD để mua thêm 1 con lợn nái và măng tươi đem bán.

loans.use: buy a sow and bamboo shoots

loans.name: Didier

texts.en:
Didier N. S. is 23 years old. He sells toys and games for children of less than 12 years and lives with his family in Port-Bouët, a very populous suburb in the south of Abidjan District.

Didier is a dynamic and strong young man, who began his business three years ago. He is financially responsible for his fiancee and their baby boy.

Didier is ambitious and wants to have a real store to provide better customer service. He also wants to pay for his fiancee to learn tailoring in order to increase his family's overall revenue. Didier took out his first loan from AE&I in November 2005 and has performed very well so far.

loans.use: pay for a tailor training program for his fiancee

loans.name: Djeyran

texts.en:
Djeyran is the mother of 4 children and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. This 37-year-old woman has been in farming for 4 years.
Now she needs a loan of US$1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase her yield

loans.name: Khudayar

texts.en:
Khudayar is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Salyan region in Yenikand village. He has 10 years of experience in farming.
Khudayar needs a loan of $725 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine K. is an ambitious woman. She was born in 1966 and is a single mother with 4 children. She lives in Port-Bouët, a very populous suburb in the south of Abidjan District with her mother, who takes care of the children when Clementine has to go to the market for her micro-business.

Clementine sells palm seed and various vegetable products in the Port-Bouët open-air market. She wants to be able to purchase products in bulk in order to wholesale them to retailers. She intends to increase her income so as to open a hairdressing shop in the long run, as she has got training in this field 2 years ago. Clementine is a good client who has repaid all the loans she has previously received from AE&I in a timely manner .

loans.use: to purchase palm seed in bulk

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira has run her own business for 6 years now. She is 30 years old and married, with one child.
Elmira wants to improve the yield of her farming endeavor and for that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$950 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar, 27, is single and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has run his business for 6 years and has steady customers who frequently place orders with him. He has some difficulty keeping enough supplies on hand to fill the orders he gets, however, so now he is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase necessary materials for carpentry.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for carpentry

loans.name: Sanfo

texts.en:
Sanfo I. is a dynamic and strong 33-year-old single man. He has 4 years of work experience in selling clothes. He lives in Port-Bouët, a very populous suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. He chose to live near the Port-Bouët market in order to reduce transportation costs.

Sanfo takes care of his younger brothers and sisters. He heard about AE&I two years ago from his cousin. He then joined the AE&I microcredit program and he has been a very good performer so far. Sanfo wants to purchase a batch of loincloths in bulk in order to make fashionable local clothes for Ramadan.

loans.use: purchase loincloths in bulk for resale

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Reine S. A. is a dynamic tailor, 39 years old and married. She has 5 children and lives in Port-Bouët, a very populous suburb in the south of the Abidjan District.

Reine has a tailor shop in the Port-Bouët open-air market. She has long years' work experience as a tailor and selling clothing accessories. All Reine's children go to school and she wants the loan to pay education expenses for them.

loans.use: pay school fees for her five children

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa lives on Avenue Luis Espinal in an area called Villa Ingenio in the city of El Alto Bolivia. She has three children. Her husband recently left them, and so Rosa has started to sell fruit juices and soft drinks from her house. The loan she is asking for is to buy more drinks and refreshments for her business, so that she can improve the economic situation of her family. This is her first loan with Impro, and the evaluation they did showed she is qualified to receive the money.

Rosa vive en la Avenida Luís Espinal de la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene tres hijos, su esposo recientemente hizo abandono del hogar, por lo cual Rosa se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas, refrescos, etc. en la puerta de su domicilio. El crédito que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de mercadería (frutas y refrescos) para su negocio y así mejorar los ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia lives on Avenue Mario Mercado in the Bautista Saavedra zone in the city of El Alto. She has three small children, ages 9, 2, and 3 months. She works with furniture which she sells at different markets in the city of El Alto. Her husband, due to lack of work, had to emigrate to Argentina, where he currentl works as a tailor.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw material (wood, glue, varnish, etc.) to continue her business and try to increase sales and improve the family's economic situation.

This is her second loan with Impro. The first was invested in the purchase of tools to increase her production. Currently, that loan is paid in full.

The evaluation conducted qualifies Julia for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Julia vive en la avenida Mario Mercado de la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de el Alto. Tiene tres hijos pequeños de 9, 2 años y uno de 3 meses, se dedica a la elaboración de muebles los cuales los comercializa en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Su esposo, por falta de trabajo, tuvo que emigrar a la Republica de Argentina donde actualmente trabaja como costurero. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima (madera, cola, barniz, etc.) para continuar con su negocio y tratar de incrementar sus ventas y mejorar los ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, El primero lo invirtió en la compra de herramientas para el mejor desempeño en su trabajo; actualmente dicho préstamo esta pagado en su totalidad. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: Purchase raw materials - wood, glue, varnish

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita lives in the Calle Pujio zone of Villa San Juan. She has four children, ages 9, 7, 5, and 3. She works creating blankets, for which she acquires raw material at wholesale. Her husband works as a boat driver at a tourism agency in Titicaca Lake in La Paz province.

Margarita would like to request a loan for the purchase of whole rolls of raw material, that is, wholesale, in order to lower her costs, which would affect her net earnings.

This is her first loan with Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Margarita vive en la zona de Villa San Juan calle Pujio. Tiene cuatro hijos de 9, 7, 5,3 años, se dedica a la elaboración de frazadas para lo cual adquiere su materia prima, al por menor. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de bote en una agencia de turismo en el Lago Tititcaca del departamento de La Paz.

Margarita desea solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima por rollos enteros, es decir al por mayor y así lograr costos mas bajos lo cual influirá en su ganancia neta.

Este es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 31 years old. She has a clothing shop in the Kirkuk market. She is a single women with two daughters. She lives with her mother and father. She has a big responsibility. She applied to get $1000 to purchase more goods for her shop. She wants to develop her business and increase her income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 33 years old and has an electronic goods shop. He applied to get $1200 from AL-Aman to purchase more goods and develop his shop. He has a big family. He expects his third child in the next month. He wants to increase his sales and income and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Kuruthum

texts.en:
Kuruthum is a 51-year-old strong and energetic mother of 3 and a resident of the Buguruni area, a Dar Es Salaam city suburb.

Her business is one of the most challenging and time-consuming in Dar Es Salaam, a city with an unplanned solid waste management system. She collects solid waste from the households and takes it to the collection center before the car that collects for the city council comes for it. The waste from the household is packed in plastic or polythene bags and she picks them up for a fee depending on the weight.

She has employed three people in her business, and she wants to open up more collection centers and employ more people, because solid waste is increasing. She is currently in need of USD 550 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Open up more collection centers

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson M. is 24 years of age and has one biological son aged three. In addition, he is supporting two (2) dependant children of his late brother. They are currently enrolled in primary school.

Benson is a clothing designer by profession and has been operating the same business for two years. He produces both ladies and men's clothing which he sells retail in his shop and wholesale to other retailers, both in the city and its suburbs.

Benson is a vibrant young man and has so far managed to purchase both electrical and manual sewing machines for his business using the meager proceeds from his business. His premises are located in Wandegeya, a very strategic place for such a business since it is a suburb for the Makerere campus students.

Benson is requesting a loan of US$1,200 to re-stock his business in preparation for the festive season. The profits realized will help him meet pay school fees and also buy a container which will house his business, hence saving money presently being put into rent.

loans.use: Re-stock his business for the upcoming holidays

loans.name: Bright

texts.en:
Bright K. is a business man of 29 who deals in a variety of merchandise such as baby toys, necklaces, puff holders, and pocket mirrors, among others. He sells his merchandise on both retail and wholesale basis and his business is located in the city center.

Bright is looking after three dependant children, girls aged 13 and 15 and one boy of nine years. He has been able to meet the needs of the children using the income from his business but unfortunately this leaves him with almost no savings available as capital for investment.

Bright is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 to expand his business. When this is achieved, he believes he will be able to save money to buy a plot of land where he can construct a house. This loan will be repaid in 6 months.

loans.use: expand his wholesale/retail business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Business Description

Roxana is the owner of a local school named “Soldiers of Jesús” that has over 250 students. She and 10 other teachers work together to educate elementary-aged children from 7 am to 1pm. She was able to build the school on borrowed land and has seen it go from a small bamboo structure into a respectable concrete building.

Loan Use

Roxana wants to borrow from Mifex because she is hoping that she can make new uniforms for her students. The uniforms will be used for a special presentation at the school and a field day. Roxana hopes the students can continue to use the uniforms for physical education. She will buy the materials and have them made at a better cost if she has the money to invest. She figures she will be able to provide parents with much better prices after having the uniforms made in bulk.

Personal Information

Roxana is 36 years old and has five children. She separated from her husband about two years ago and is raising her family on her own. Her school and her faith have helped her get through these two years. She feels confident she can continue to provide not only for her own children, but also for the children of the surrounding community.

loans.use: Buy materials to make new uniforms for her students

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a hardworking restaurant owner in Guayaquil, Ecuador. Her business is small but she benefits from a loyal client thanks to her delicious plates. She makes traditional Ecuadorian dishes such as fried pork with plantains (fritada) and meat pies (empanadas). During off time at the restaurant Blanca delivers baskets of food to homes in the area.

Blanca is requesting this loan from Mifex and Kiva because she is hoping to invest in tables, chairs and utensils for her business. She is proud of her business, but she definitely sees room for improvement, particularly in the aesthetic appeal of her location. She also feels she would benefit from making her restaurant larger to accommodate more clients.

Blanca is a widowed mother of four. Most of her children have already grown up, but she still lives with one daughter who is 18 and helps her with the business. Blanca’s restaurant helped her raise her family during tough times and she is very excited about the possibility of improving it.

loans.use: Fix up her restuarant

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel L. is 27 years of age and has a wife and one son aged five years. Sam is employed on an agricultural farm for only four hours a day, five days a week. He spends the other hours of the day at his own business where he makes bricks for sale.

Sam has been in this business for one and a half years. Sam says the business brings in extra income for the school fees of his pre-primary son and for other necessities for the whole family.

Sam would like to secure a loan of US$ 700 to boost his business by leasing a piece of land where he can make bricks. When he has managed to do this, he will be able to save money to construct his house.

loans.use: Leasing a piece of land

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Married with 8 children, at the age of 40, Ake is a very hardworking woman.  Due to the demand, she has to make enough packets of chips.  Most times, it is an early rise for her, to get things ready and good to go.  She joined SPBD in May 2007 and is quite thankful for the assistance they have given.  She is planning to build a proper place where she could cook and pack her chips.

loans.use: To start up with her chips business

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Eliana is 35 years old and dedicates herself to selling groceries, vegetables, candy and sweets in a store she operates from her home in the Bellavista District in the city of San Martín. She decided to open the business to manage her own income and she wanted a business that would allow her to work from home where she could care for her family, especially her young children. She has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. Two of her children are in grade school and the last one is a baby. She is a woman with a great spirit to overcome adversities. Recently, she began attending computer classes to stay up-to-date with technology. She belongs to the “Virgen de la Puerta” communal bank promoted by Manuela Ramos. She has requested $310.00 with which she plans to purchase basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, legumes, a variety of vegetables as well as stationary items such as notebooks, pencils, pens and erasers. This will allow her to increase the items she is able to offer her customers and satisfy them seeing as how hers is the only store of its kind in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Christian G., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eliana tiene 35 años y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras, dulces y golosinas en un negocio que puso en su propia casa ubicada en el distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Decidió iniciar su negocio para poder manejar sus propios recursos y porque quería un negocio en el cual no hubiera necesidad de ausentarse de la casa ya que de esa forma podía atender a su familia, principalmente a sus hijos. Tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 mujer, 2 de los cuales están en la etapa escolar, y el ultimo todavía es un bebe. Ella es una mujer con un espíritu de superación envidiable, hace poco se matriculó en un instituto donde está recibiendo clases de computación, ya que según menciona quiere estar a la par con la nueva era y la tecnología. Pertenece al Banco Comunal "Virgen de la Puerta" promovido por Manuela Ramos, ha solicitado S/. 1,000.00 ($ 310.00) con lo cual adquirirá artículos de primera necesidad como arroz y azúcar en sacos, cajas de leche, aceite, menestras, verduras variadas, y otros artículos de librería como cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, borradores, esto permitirá aumentar el stock de su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ya que este negocio es el único existente por la zona en donde ella vive.

loans.use:
Purchase products in bulk. Groceries.

Comprar artículos en general. Abarrotes.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Cesar is from San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon. Four years ago, he began his own business as a hairstylist. He began with very few clients, but he has used ads to spread the word and the results have been good. He has always liked this profession, and he has taken various courses in cosmetology and styling, which have helped him grow his business and offer excellent service.

To expand the offerings in his salon, he is asking for a $500 loan which he is committed to repaying in 6 months. He will use the loan to buy the materials he needs to continue offering great service to his clients. You can be an important part in the development of this business. Decide to join -- Cesar thanks you sincerely.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

César es originario de la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, desde hace 4 años inició su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios de estilista, inició con muy pocos clientes pero ha utilizado la publicidad para darse a conocer y ha obteniendo buenos resultados. A él siempre le ha gustado este oficio y es por eso que ha estudiado varios cursos de belleza y estilismo, lo que le ha permitido crecer mucho en su negocio, ofreciendo un excelente servicio.

Para incrementar los servicios que ofrece en su estética y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora César está solicitando un préstamo de $ 500 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses y empleará en la compra de materiales que necesita para darle un buen servicio a sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a apoyarlo, César te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy materials.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Lesslie Dalila

texts.es:
Lesslie is single and has a one year old baby. She started her own business out of the need to provide for her child and to have enough time available to care for him. She and a friend opened a salon a year ago and together they have grown the business and the clientele. Fortunately, there are more clients every day and in order to provide them with better service and a more comfortable experience, Lesslie aims to expand their space. For this remodeling, she needs a $375 loan.

Lesslie is an enterprising young woman with a strong drive to succeed. She is committed to repaying this loan in 6 months. With your help, she can grow her business and improve her quality of life and that of her son. She thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer. Lesslie es soltera y tiene un pequeño de un año de edad, la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para el sustento hijo y tener el tiempo disponible para atenderlo la motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio, con ayuda de una de sus amigas abrieron una estética hace un año y juntas han hecho crecer el negocio e incrementar su número de clientes. Afortunadamente los clientes son más cada día y para poder ofrecerles un buen servicio y más comodidad, Lesslie desea ampliar su negocio por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares.

Lesslie es una joven emprendedora con muchos deseos de salir adelante y se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses, con tu ayuda ella podrá crecer con su negocio y mejorar la calida de vida de su pequeño hijo, por lo que te agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Remodeling.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Due to the lack of employment in his country, it has been difficult for Miguel to find work. He is married with 2 children. His wife works in the home taking care of their children. To provide for his family, Miguel ddecided to start his own business selling clothes at the markets around Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, where he is from. Little by little, he has expanded his inventory and thanks to the good service he offers, his business is growing rapidly.

Now he needs a $650 loan which he will use to buy merchadise to meet the demand of his clients and to continue growing. He is committed to paying back this loan in 6 months. Choose to join in Miguel's efforts. Thank you.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Ante la falta de empleo que hay en el país a Miguel le ha sido muy difícil encontrar un trabajo, él está casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus pequeños, para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa en los mercados rodantes en la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, de donde es originario, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece lo ha hecho crecer rápidamente.

Ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Miguel y decídete a apoyarlo, gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
Jose Luis is married with two small children. His wife works in the home, caring for thie children. Jose did seasonal work, but sometimes he had no income to pay for household expenses. For this reason, he decided to start his own business. He converted a truck and he began working as a mover and local frieght driver. Due to his responsable and honorable nature, his clientele has grown rapidly.

To continue growing his business and be able to meet demand, he is asking for a $275 loan which he is committed to repaying in 3 months. He will use the loan to pay for the maintenance of his truck. Be an important part of the development of this business. Jose and his family thank you sincerely.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

José Luís es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y a cuidar de sus niños. José trabajaba sólo por temporadas y en ocasiones no tenía ningún ingreso para solventar los gastos de su hogar, es por esto que decidió emprender su propio negocio, acondicionó un camión y comenzó a realiza mudanzas y fletes locales, gracias a que es un hombre muy responsable y honrado realiza un muy buen trabajo y ha logrado incrementar su número de clientes rápidamente.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder cubrir todos los pedidos de sus clientes José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses y utilizará en el mantenimiento de su camión, para evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera ocurrir. Se parte importante del desarrollo de este negocio, José y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is from Apodaca, Nuevo Leon. She is single and she has three school aged children who are the reason she began her own business. She started by selling fruits in a small stand she put up at her house. Fourtunately, her sales improved greatly and now she needs $925 to remodel her business. She hopes to expand the space and increase and diversify her inventory.

Juana has had to struggle as a single mother to raise her children, but her love for them and her wish to see them to finish school motivate her each day. She is committed to paying back this loan in 6 months. Be a part of the expansion of this business. Juana and her family give their sincere thanks for your trust and support.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, es soltera y tiene tres hijos, actualmente estudiando, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio, comenzó a vender frutas en un pequeño puesto que acondicionó en su casa, afortunadamente mejoraron mucho sus ventas y ahora para continuar creciendo con su negocio Juana necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su negocio, con lo que podrá ampliar el local e incrementar el surtido que tiene.

Juana ha tenido que esforzarse mucho por sacar a sus hijos adelante ella sola, pero el amor que siente por ellos y el deseo de que puedan culminar sus estudios la motivan cada día a mejorar, ella se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio, Juana y su familia agradecen sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Business remodeling.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Sewing since her mid thirties, Silia enjoys it very much now that she is 50.  It is their source of income to provide for family as well as pay for her children’s education.  Clothes are sewn in any order with any pattern and any style whether it be for men, women, or children.  Schools also recommend her to sew students’ uniforms.  In April, 2007 she became a part of SPBD and appreciates the help the program has given her.  Because she enjoys sewing, she hopes to have a flea market stall in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and sewing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mercaderia y otros equipos

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung has already proven a reliable business partner.  She has repaid 3 previous loans from Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  Her last loan from Kiva increased her daily profits to 10-15,000 VND.  With the increased profits, she bought was able to buy a refrigerator.  Dung would like another loan in order to continue to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: buy more capital for grocery store

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan (pictured left) works with two of her sisters, Sang (pictured right) and Hai.  Loan has proven to be a trustworthy business partner.  She has received a loan from Kiva before and has repaid the loan on time. Her previous loan has increased her profits to 20-25,000 VND per day ($1.25-1.56).  With the increased profits, she was able to buy a used motorbike to help her carry the bananas and banana leaves from the banana plantation to her home and then to the bus stop.  Loan and her sisters sell the bananas in Phan Thiet, a city about 100km away.  They must take the bus to the city to sell their products.  She would like to request a new loan in order to continue to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and banana leaves to sell

loans.name: Bay

texts.en:
Bay has already proven to be a trustworthy business partner.  She has repaid two previous loans to Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  Bay would like a new loan so she can continue to expand her fruit stand, which she has been running for over 10 years.  Bay sells bananas, jack fruit, and Siamese custard apples at her fruit stand.  The loan from Kiva has allowed Bay to avoid borrowing from other sources that charge a high interest rate.  Because of Kiva's 0% interest loan, Bay has increased her daily profits to 10-15,000 VND per day ($0.62-0.94).  
Bay's husband is unable to work because he has been suffering from head and nose pain.  He helps Bay with the fruit stand by going to the farms to buy the fruit.  He also helps at home.  Bay and her husband have seven kids.  Two of their children are married and do not live at home.  Three children are still attending school.  One child helps out at home.  The other child used to work for a company very far away, but life was very difficult and he could not make any money.  He has moved back home recently.

loans.use: to buy more capital for her fruit stand

loans.name: Quan

texts.en: Quan has proven to be a reliable business partner.  She has already repaid 2 loans she received from Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  The loans have helped so much that Quan would like to ask for another one.  Quan sells betels leaves and areca nuts at a nearby market.  The loans have helped Quan's profits increase to 7-10,000 VND per day ($0.44-0.62).  Without the loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, Quan would have to ask for a loan from another source which charges high interest rates.  Kiva's loan has allowed Quan to keep all of the money from her sales.  Quan has raised 2 grandchildren on her own.  One of them now works in Ho Chi Minh City, but he is only able to earn enough to survive.

loans.use: to buy more betel leaves and areca nuts to sell at the market

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Chut and his wife Huong has a small sandwich stand in the community marketplace.  Chut works as a stevedore, so Huong usually runs the sandwich stand.  Huong wakes up every morning at 2am to bake and prepare food.  She then takes her sandwiches to the market at 4am to set up her stand.  She has been running her shop for about 30 years now.  Huong has received two loans from Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  She has paid those loans back on time.  Huong would like another loan to continue to increase her sandwich sales.  The previous loans have increased Huong's profits to around 20,000 VND per day.  The increased profits have really helped to improve the family's life.  Before receiving loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, Chut and Huong went to other sources that charged high interest rates.  Now, the family is able to keep the money that they make.

loans.use: to buy more capital for the sandwich stand

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh and his wife Thanh own a small breakfast stand that they run outside their home.  Thanh often runs the breakfast stand while Binh is a farmer.  Binh's farm is only able to grow enough food for the family to eat.  The breakfast stand sells "pho," a traditional vietnamese noodle soup.  Binh and Thanh would like to request a loan to buy more ingredients.  They have already proven to be trustworthy business parters; they have already repaid 2 loans that they received from Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  The loans have helped increase their daily earnings to 15,000 VND per day ($0.94).

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for breakfast stand

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia has been living in this house for over 14 years. She still lives here with her husband and 4 kids. For the past few years, she has had to take become the mainstay of the family's economic survival, as her husband hasn't had a steady job for quite some time! Occasionally he works as a hired hand in agricultural duties (the area has a lot of cocoa farming, and there's a need for laborers at the time of hand-picking of this precious fruit! He now works assisting her in her clothing sales, by delivering the goods and doing some collections himself! 

The clothing Antonia sells comes from “pacas” (or packs of pressed new and used clothing which Dominicans can buy from donations to the poor on the Haitian side of the island, which the people bring over to the Dominican Republic in order to sell them and thus, be able buy food and groceries). “Pacas” come in at least three types: Type A, B and C. Type A packs are mostly of “premium” goods, as they contain new items, often from signature brands, and which command a ‘premium’ price, for obvious reasons. On type A’s (worth between USD$300 to $400) there is more income to be made, as they can be sold to a higher income bracket customer. However, Antonia tells us thus far she has only been able to buy type B “pacas” (worth some USD$250 to $300 mainly dependent upon the composition and proportion of the new/used portions of clothing to be found on them) which is obviously of a lower quality from those on the type A group. Finally the type C “pacas” (costing anywhere from USD$100 to $250, each) are the cheapest, obviously consisting of used clothing or new of lower quality. “Paca” buyers must trust their intermediaries, as the insides are not able to be seen until the packs are opened. Normally the “pacas” are opened and sold on a piece by piece fashion, which will bring the largest return on the sales. However, those go to the Haiti-Dominican Rep. border in order to buy the “pacas”, as Antonia does, can buy them at lower prices than those that might be found in or near the cities, such as Santo Domingo. The trip to the border costs somewhere in the neighborhood of USD$25-30 each way, expensive, but there’s no other way… Of course, both the sacrifice as well as the cost is recuperated a few times over, once the “paca” buyer has been able to do the purchasing and transportation to the end market’s territory. The unopened “pacas” can command up to three times the value over their original cost once brought into the final market areas, as the owner/buyer is able to maintain the quality standards customary to their customers. But most prefer to have the larger income product, which may be brought in selling them piecemeal! 

Antonia wishes to be able to have her kids grow, become good citizens and show their love for the country! This she plans making via sufficient income in order to be able to pay for their transportation, and daily needs with school. She’s never had a type A “pack”, as she’s only been able to pay for a maximum of the “B’s” value. Eventually, she’ll be able to buy the As type, as she’ll receive more good and larger loans.

loans.use: Antonia will now be able to buy more "pacas" which she expects to need on a weekly basis, as opposed to her now bi-weekly capability. As well, she plans to eventually upgrade her purchasing capacity to the A packs. (see explanation below)

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is experienced businesswomen. She has two beautiful girls. They are friendly family and help each other in their family business. Their business is to sell children clothes, which located in the wholesale market in the Kistakuz, Khujand. Mahfirat started her activity in 2002 from selling socks, handkerchief and underwear for children. Gradually she increased her working capital and expanded her assortment of goods. Her daughters are old enough and they help her to sell her goods after their lessons.
In 2005 she became a client of MicroInvest. Her first loan was $100,which she spent for purchasing the first batch of children clothes Today she sells season children clothes. She has many clients and the turnover of her goods is good.
Mahfirat has two dreams: to help her daughters to get high education and become one of them teacher of Russian languages and second doctor.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong has proven to be a very reliable business partner. She has borrowed from Mekong Plus three times already; her last loan was funded by Kiva. She has repaid all of her loans on time.

Phuong would like another loan to help her continue to increase her sales. The loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva have helped Phuong increase her daily profits to 10-20,000 VND ($0.62-1.25). Without the loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, Phuong would have to seek a loan from another source that has high interest rates. The high interest rates would prevent Phuong from ever escaping poverty. Since switching over to Mekong Plus, she has been able to save enough to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho has received loans from Mekong Plus 3 times already, and she has paid back each loan on time.  Her last loan was funded by Kiva.  Her previous loans were used to expand her grocery store.  The grocery store has really taken off since she's received the loans.  She is able to consistently earn between 10-15,000 VND per day ($0.62-0.94).  Tho also sews clothes at home in order to make a little extra money, but she does not earn money every day from sewing.  Her husband works as a day laborer but his work is very unstable.  He is not able to find work every day, and the job is very difficult.  Tho would like to invest in some pigs in order to earn some extra money.  She is asking for a loan to buy food and supplies for the pigs.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies to raise pigs

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano N. sells sweets and canned food. She has been in business for 8 years. Rano N. is a widowed mother of three children. She has high school education. Rano’s children are in school. After school, Rano’s oldest son helps his mother. Rano started her business after the death of her husband. In the past, she only sold sweets at a small trading spot. Since becoming a MicroInvest client in 2004, Rano N. increased her sales volume and purchased a store at one of the central areas of the local market. She doubled the size of her business assets. In the future, Rano N. plans to hire a salesperson and open another trading spot.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Насырова Раъно занимается реализацией сладкими и консервными изделиями вот уже 8 лет. Вдова, мать троих детей, образование среднее специальное. Дети учатся в школе, старший сын после школы помогает матери. Начала свою деятельность после смерти мужа. Раньше она торговала в маленькой торговой точке, тогда она продавала только сладкие изделия. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, после получения займа и целевого использования она увеличила товарооборот, приобрела магазин в одном из центральных мест рынка. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза больше. В будущем планирует принять на работу продавщицу и открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open another trading spot

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
R. Murodjon is 27 years old. He has a little stall of sport shoes for teenagers.

He became a client of Microinvest in 2005. His first loan was for $100. He spent his loan to increase the number of his goods. He repays his loans on time.

He goes to the wholesale market 3-4 times per month. He brought his goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. His one batch of shoes consists of 50-60 pairs. For today he has many constant clients; additionally, he takes orders from them. The turnover of his business is fast. When he goes on the trip for goods, his mother sells his goods. (She is in the photo).

In the future, Murodjon wants to expand his assortment by including goods from famous firms such as Adidas, Reebok, and Nike. He wishes to attract more new clients with the high quality of the goods from these firms. For this purpose he is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a 35-year-old resident of the Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a kiosk, a business she has been doing for the past ten years. Specifically, she sells soft drinks, water and simple bites. She also prepares breakfast and lunch besides her kiosk. She is also recipient of the business entrepreneur training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. The knowledge has helped her expand her saving capacity.

She now know wants to build another permanent housing for her business and divert her kiosk business into a grocery. She is therefore in need of USD 450 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu has been a very trustworthy business partner. She has received 3 loans from Mekong Plus and has repaid each loan on time. The last loan she received was funded by Kiva. Thu sells porridge and noodle soup from her home. Her business has really improved since she's partnered with Mekong Plus. She used to receive loans from other sources which charged high interest rates, but now she is able to keep all of the profits from her sales. She earns about 20,000 VND per day ($1.25).
