With her profits, she has been able to fix holes in her house to prevent it from collapsing, and she was able to buy cement to build a small water well. She wishes to receive another loan in order to help her microbusiness expand.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for porridge and noodle soup stand

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano R., 56 is married and has three children. She has high school education. Rano R. has been selling eggs for 12 years. Her husband is currently unemployed, her oldest daughter makes a living by sewing, and her other two children are in school. Rano R. started her business with $70. Then, she did not have a permanent trading spot. Since receiving her first MicroInvest loan in 2003, Rano R. expanded her sales volume and purchased a permanent trading spot. Her business assets increased to $300. In the future, Rano R. plans to switch to wholesale trading.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахматова Рано – 56лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее. Она занимается продажей яиц 12 лет. Муж безработный, старшая дочь занимается шитьём, двое младших учатся в школе. Начала свою деятельность с 70$, тогда она не имела постоянную торговую точку. После получения займа в 2003году она начала расширять товар, приобрела постоянную торговую точку. Сейчас её активы возросли до 300$. В будущем планирует перейти и на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Switch to wholesale trading

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu has borrowed money from Mekong Plus on three separate occasions. She has paid back each of the loans on time, and she has shown to be a very trustworthy business partner. Her last loan was funded by Kiva. Without Mekong Plus and Kiva, she would have to go to another source that charges high interest rates; this would prevent her from ever escaping poverty.

Since receiving loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, her profits have increased to 15-20,000 VND per day ($0.94-1.25). With the higher profits, she can send her youngest child to school. Thu wishes to receive another loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva to help her business continue to grow. Thu buys fish from fisherman about 100 km away and brings it to the marketplace in her community to sell. It is very difficult and tiresome work. However, it is the only source of income for her. She is separated from her husband. She is working very hard to support herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Bisharofat

texts.ru:
Bisharofat S., 36 is married and has 2 children. She has high school education. Bisharofat S. began her business by selling clothing for men and children. In 2004, she joined MicroInvest lending program with a loan of $60. Since receiving the first loan, Bisharofat S. changed her business specialty—she now sells dried fruits. Bisharofat S. also moved her business to another place. Now, Bisharofat S. has $230 in business assets. She plans to expand the assortment of goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сулаймонова Бишарофат – 36лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается строительством, дети учатся в школе. Начала она свою деятельность с продажи детской и мужской одежды. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, тогда её активы составляли 60$. После получения займа и неоднократного использования она перешла на другой вид бизнеса стала продавать сухофрукты, изменила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы составляют 230$. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Mr. Le and his wife were born in 1962. They have 3 children who are students at the secondary school and primary school, and who learn well at school. Mr. Le hopes to keep his children at school. He hopes to receive a loan of $75 to invest in his joiner’s workshop so that he can save money to support his family. Mr. Le is going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Investing in his joiner's workshop

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha and her husband were born in 1953. There are 11 members in the family that include: 2 children, 7 working children, and 2 grandsons. Mrs. Ha has a small grocery store at the front of the home but the goods are of poor quality and limited various. She really needs a loan of $75 to run the grocery store. Mrs. Ha will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Buy inventory for grocery store.

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru:
Rohila T., 45 is married mother of 4 children. She has high school education. Rohila T.’s husband also engaged in sales, her oldest daughter is married, and her 3 younger children are in school. Rohila T. has been selling eggs for 5 years. In 2006, when Rohila T. joined MicroInvest lending program, she sold eggs at her place of business. Since becoming a MicroInvest borrower, Rohila T. increased her sales volume and began selling wholesale to confectioners. She now plans to switch completely to wholesale trade.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тохирова Рохила – 45лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей, старшая дочь замужем, трое младших учатся в школе. Вот уже 5 лет занимается она продажей яиц. В 2006 году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда она продавала только на месте своей деятельности. После получения кредита она увеличила товарооборот и стала сама предоставлять товар кондитерским цехам. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза и она планирует перейти и на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Move into wholesale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his fruit stock.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Manzura K. sells canned foods and costume jewelry. She is married and has 3 children. Manzura K. has high school education. Her husband is in Russia working as a seasonal laborer and her children are in school. Manzura K. has been in business for 14 years. She began with $100. When she joined MicroInvest in 2004, Manzura K. was selling only costume jewelry. After repeated borrowing and targeted reinvestment of loaned funds, Manzura K. hired a salesperson and purchased a trading spot at a local food market. Now Manzura K. also sells canned food. In the future, she plans to purchase a store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Манзура- занимается продажей консервных изделий и бижутерией. Замужем, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж на заработках в РФ, дети учатся в школе. Опыт работы в этой деятельности 14 лет. Начала свою деятельность с 100$. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, тогда она торговала только бижутерией. После неоднократного кредитования и целевого использования она наняла продавщицу, и приобрела торговую точку продуктовом рынке. Сейчас она реализует консервные изделия. В будущем планирует приобрести магазин.

loans.use: To purchase a store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock enough fruit.

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru:
Yokubjon Y., 25 is married and has 2 children. He has high school education. For 12 years, he has been selling a variety of baked products. Since he was little, Yokubjon Y. has helped his mother to sell. Now, she constantly supports him in business. Yokubjon Y. joined MicroInvest in the beginning of this year with a loan of $450. After receiving the funds and with the help of gradually increasing line of credit, Yokubjon Y. began to pay cash for his goods, which helps him to pay less. He also purchased a permanent trading spot. In the future, Yokubjon Y. plans to increase the assortment of goods sold. His mother is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Якубов Ёкубчон – 25лет. Женат, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее. Занимается продажей разных видов печенья, вот уже 12лет. С малых лет помогал, матери в торговле и постепенной поддержкой в этой сфере является мать - Якубова С.. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в начале этого года с активами на сумму 450$. После получения и шагового увеличения займа он стал приобрести товар за наличные, что позволяет ему брать их подешевле. Также приобрел постоянную торговую точку. В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент товара. На фото его мать.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
T. Jennifer is 47 years of age, married with four children. Two of her children have completed University, one is in her second year and the last born is in senior three. She has been engaged in business for over ten years. Her first loan was USD 100 which she paid very well in four months. Her second loan was USD 225; she worked very hard and paid it in time.

She sells cosmetics in her shop and rears chicken which she sells to Makerere University and Hotel Equatoria. Jennifer’s shop is located in the heart of Kamwokya, a low-cost housing settlement area. She has a ready market for her products and this has helped her to repay her loans on time. On average, her cosmetics sales range between USD 30-40 per week. Meanwhile, she has ordered 2000 chicks from Ugachick breeders. Through her small businesses, she has managed to educate her children and looks forward to big savings after the two children finish school.

loans.use: Buy one carton of hair treatment oils, body lotions and 15 sacks of chicken feed.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru:
Muhammadjon G. has been a MicroInvest client since the beginning of his business activities. He is 45, married, and has 4 children. Muhammadjon G. has an equivalent of associate degree. He began his business by selling sunflower seeds and pistachios. Gradually, with the constant help of MicroInvest, Muhammadjon G. increased the assortment of goods. He also earned a reputation of exemplary borrower and won multiple MicroInvest awards for financial discipline. In spite of great distance between his home and the nearest city, Muhammadjon G. travels to neighboring countries to acquire his goods and then sells them to a few large stores at the central market. In the future, Muhammadjon G. plans to become exclusive wholesale supplier in his area and offer a larger variety of goods.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гайназаров Мухаммаджон- является клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» с самого начала его деятельности. Ему 45 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее специальное. Начинал с продажи семечек и фисташек. Постепенно кредитуясь у нас, он не только увеличил ассортимент товара, но и стал образцовым клиентом, который неоднократно был удостоен нескольких премий за дисциплинированность перед программой МЗФ «Микроинвест». Несмотря на отдаленность своего дома от города, он ездит за товаром в соседние страны и реализует нескольким большим торговым точкам в центральном рынке. В будущем планирует стать единственным оптовым поставщиком и привозить любой ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: To become exclusive wholesale supplier in the area

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 32-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam. She has done various businesses for the past ten years, but she has been buying and selling cereal foods for the past six years. She supplies mainly maize and beans to clients, many of them in the Dar Es Salaam region. She travels upcountry and buys the maize from her suppliers and supplies them to her clients. Many of them have milling machines.

Christina has gained many customers recently, and she wants to ensure continued supply to satisfy her customers. She also wants to get her own milling machine so that she can compete and build a big store for the grains. She is need of USD 450 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
N. Margaret is a focused young lady aged 30 years. She is married with four children, two boys and two girls. All are in school; three are in primary school and one in nursery.

Margaret and her husband own a truck and it is driven by the husband. This truck helps them in transporting Matoke (green bananas) from Mbarara and Masaka to Kampala for sale. She has one outlet in Kamwokya and every week she sells three trucks of matoke, making a net profit of about USD 250.

She started her business in 2001 with a loan of USD 100. Last month, August 2007, she repaid a loan of USD 600. The business has grown and currently she has a capital of about USD1000.

loans.use: Open another outlet to increase sales.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a 46-year-old mother of 3 and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a restaurant; she sells all sorts of common dishes at her restaurant. She has been in this business for the past twelve years, and ever since she received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation, her business management skills have improved and she can now save more than before. She also sells charcoal alongside her restaurant business.

She is in need of a refrigerator, tables, and chairs to help improve services at her business. She is therefore in need of USD 450 to help her improve the services in her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs and a refrigerator

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha has already proven to be a very reliable business partner. She has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from Mekong Plus. Her last loan was funded by Kiva. Ha makes traditional Vietnamese desserts, called "che", at home and brings them to the marketplace to sell; her home is 2km away from the market, and she carries the desserts on her shoulder. Her dessert stand earns her about 15,000 VND per day ($0.94).

Without Mekong Plus and Kiva, Ha would be paying interest on her loans and would not be able to save up money to send her 10-year-old daughter to school. She wishes to receive another loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva in order to increase her sales and profits. She wants to be able to save enough money to fix up her house. It is very unstable, and she is scared it may collapse during a storm. Ha works incredibly hard, and she is confident she can repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her dessert stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her re-tailored second-hand clothing business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a 56-year-old energetic mother of 5, a poultry keeper, and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam. She has been in business for the past two years. She stocks 2-day-old chicks and prepares them to be egg-layers or broilers. She sells some at her home, and others she supplies to nearby hotels and restaurants.  She also prepares Vitengi, a common clothing in the Dar Es Salaam region. She wants to expand the housing for the poultry and buy utensils for feeding the chicks. She is in need of USD 350 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand housing for the poultry

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 38-year-old mother of 3 and runs a restaurant in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam city. She has been in this business for the past ten years. At her restaurant, she sells all sorts of soft drinks and ready-made food ranging from breakfast, lunch and supper. Most of her clients are business men around the Buguruni area.

She is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business management and entrepreneur skills. Her dream is to build a bigger permanent housing for her restaurant, open up a charcoal store and sell the locally made clothing known as "vitengi". She is therefore in need of USD 450 to help her at least accomplish any one of the above dreams.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Nsubuga Joy is aged 41 and resides in one of Kampala’s suburbs. She has one dependant, her mum of 80 years of age. Joy, together with her mum, have five two-bedroom rental units from which they derive their income. Currently their four operational units fetch a total of $356 per month, while one is pending renovation. To supplement her income, Joy operates a salon business and specializes in braiding ladies' hair.

Joy, together with her mother, wants to secure a loan worth $900 to renovate the fifth unit. This will help them fetch an extra $89 per month hence increasing their income base. The loan will be paid over a 6 month period using money realized from the rental units.

loans.use: Renovation of rental unit

loans.name: Doi

texts.en:
Doi and his wife Hong have a small banana stand at the community market. Doi is very old and unable to work; he helps out around the house. Hong is usually running the stand at the market. They buy bananas at the plantation and bring them to the market to sell every day. They are able to earn 10-15,000 VND per day ($0.62-0.94).

Doi and Hong have borrowed from Mekong Plus and Kiva before. They have been excellent about repaying the loan on time. Without the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, they would have to go to another lender that charges high interest rates. They would never be able to earn much. The loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva allows Doi and Hong to keep all of their earnings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell at the marketplace

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No has been selling groceries at the marketplace for 4 years. She sells various food and household items, including dried noodles, candy, soap, and sweet cakes. She has received a loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva before, and she repaid the loan on time.

She wishes to receive another loan to increase her capital so that she can sell more items. Without the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, No has to borrow from a lender that charges high interest rates. She used to be worried about having enough money to replenish her stock, but she no longer needs to worry since she partnered with Mekong Plus and Kiva. She has been able to increase her earnings to 15-20,000 VND per day ($0.94-1.25).

loans.use: to buy more products for grocery stand

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is what we would term as an extremely shy person. It was difficult to obtain information as to what she really wanted to do with the loan she was requesting. She has lived in this house for over 5 years now, and had one girl prior to her present stage of pregnancy, bearing a boy this time. However, the father was able to keep up with the family costs up to now, but they realize that with the advent of the new child, they need to make additional income in order to maintain their present level of living. Thus, Francisca determined she would help the family finances by establishing a small business of selling vegetables right in her house, where she feels comfortable and can keep an eye on her duties as a mother.

loans.use: She plans to buy various vegetables in order to start this new business at home.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
No, it's not a mistake! Simeona's last name is "D. L. C." from her father and her mother as well! (In Spanish tradition, one's use of last names includes the mother's last name in addition to the father's last name).

She has lived in this place for the past 5 years. She and her husband, who is a hired laborer in the collection of cocoa beans in local plantations, have had 5 children. They couldn't keep up with the cost of such a large family, and that's the reason why Simeona chose to put up this general store in her house which is practically "in the middle of nowhere". The area/community is called Serralles, and belongs to the Yamasa municipality, but it's located some 15 kilometers north of Yamasa, and it takes practically an hour to get to it. There are a lot of ravines with small brooks in this area of the country, as it rains practically on a daily basis. But that means that roads are mostly impassable so it takes a long time to get there, despite being relatively close to the neighboring town of Yamasa.

Simeona has a very small area and a low level of inventory to sell products. It occupies about half the length of her house. (It's not larger than what you can envision, proportioning the size of Simeona vs. the rest of the area you can see in the picture.) This can give you an idea of how poor this family is. But she is the only one in the general area where one can get supplies of foodstuff and other items of daily usage. She sells the equivalent of around 10 dollars worth of goods a day, but now plans to keep a much larger stock and sell over 3 times as much...all possible with the requested loan. She wouldn't say her profit margin, but that's not usually expected from a 'merchant'. However, it was generally evident that she will sell for about a 200% gross margin on sales.

Simeona is dreaming of being able to relocate, or at least be able to rebuild their house in cement blocks, as she feels the wood is not only a fire hazard, but also subject to all kinds attacks, not only from natural phenomena, but also from termites and other bugs. She should do well with her dreams.

loans.use: She needs to diversify, as well as bolster the stock of goods she sells, specially in the area of foods: rice, beans, cooking oil, pasta and eggs.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
No, it's not a mistake! Simeona's last name is "D. L. C." from her father and her mother as well! (In Spanish tradition one's use of last names includes the mother's last name in addition to the father's last name). She has lived in this place for the past 5 years.  The area/community is called Serralles, and belongs to the Yamasa municipality, but it's located some 15 kilometers north of Yamasa, and it takes practically an hour to get to it! Thus the time to get there, despite being relatively close to the neighboring town of Yamasa. Simeona has a very small area and a low level of inventory to sell products, but she is the only one in the general area where one can get supplies of foodstuff and other items of daily usage. She sells the equivalent of around 10 dollars worth of goods a day, but now plans to keep a much larger stock and sell over 3 times as much...all possible with the requested loan. She wouldn't say her profit margin, but that's not usually expected from a 'merchant'. However, it was generally evident that she will sell for about a 200% gross margin on sales. She should do well with her dreams...

loans.use: She needs to diversify, as well as to bolster her capacity to sell products, specially foodstuff, such as: rice, beans, cooking oil, pasta and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise and materials to make accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in new products and improve his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in materials and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her ice cream production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva, from Apodaca in Nuevo León, is an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic woman. As her husband’s income is insufficient to cover the basic needs of the family, she started her business selling cosmetics, in order to help with the household expenses. In association with a neighbor, they have managed to make this business grow, little by little. Genoveva is married and has two children who are studying, so she makes a greater effort every day, so that they are able to finish school and have a better future.

In order for her her business to continue growing and to meet all the orders she gets, Genoveva needs a $275 loan, that she has committed to repaying in five months. You can help improve this family’s life and contribute to their children continuing their studies. Thanks for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva, originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta. Su esposo recibe un ingreso insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia por lo que, para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella inició su negocio de venta de cosméticos. Asociándose con una vecina, poco a poco han hecho crecer este negocio. Genoveva está casada, tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, y se esfuerza más cada día para que ellos puedan culminar sus estudios y tener un mejor futuro. Para continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder surtir todos los pedidos que recibe, Genoveva necesita un préstamo de $275 dólares, que se compromete a regresar en 5 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir a que sus hijos continúen estudiando. Gracias por tu confianza y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy damaged electronics and purchaes the pieces to fix them

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Maria Olga started her own business selling groceries ten years ago. She did it to be able to improve her family’s quality of life. She is divorced and she had to support her two children. They have been her motivation to make a big effort every day. Thanks to this business, she was able to cover her children’s schools fees. Now that they are married, Maria can get the money that she needs to cover her own expenses. She has been able to keep running her business all this time due the good service that she offers.

In order to keep growing, Maria needs a loan of $475 that she promises to repay over a period of 6 months. She will use it to buy more merchandise to be able to cover her clients’ needs. Today you can help some in need. You can support Maria and she will be sincerely grateful for it.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace diez años Maria Olga inició su propio negocio vendiendo abarrotes, comenzó para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella es divorciada y tenia que sacar adelante a sus dos hijos, quienes han sido su motivación para esforzarse más cada día, gracias a su negocio pudo cubrir los costos de los estudios de sus hijos y ahora que ellos están casados Maria puede obtener los recursos que necesita para solventar sus gastos, el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido permanecer por tanto tiempo con su negocio.

Para seguir creciendo ahora Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses y empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a Maria, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Felipe Gregorio

texts.es:
Felipe is a hard working, responsible man, married and father of six children, ranging from 10 to 26 years of age. They used to live in México state but, in search for better opportunities for his family, decided to move to Monclava, Coahuila. There, faced with the difficulty of finding a job and the need to make a living for his family, he started his own business selling seasonal fruits. He initially sold them on street intersections but, with the help of his children, has managed to make his business grow and prosper.

In order to increase sales, Felipe needs a $1075 loan, which he’ll invest in the purchase of tuna fruits and oranges. He has committed to repaying this loan in six months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, está casado y tiene seis hijos, entre 10 y 26 años de edad. Anteriormente vivían en el estado de México pero, en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, decidieron mudarse a Monclava, Coahuila, donde, ante la dificultad de encontrar un empleo y la necesidad de obtener los recursos que necesitaba su familia, inició su propio negocio con la venta de frutas de temporada. Comenzó vendiendo en los cruceros de algunas avenidas, pero con ayuda de sus hijos, ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas, Felipe necesita de un préstamo de $ 1,075 dólares, que empleará en la compra de tunas y naranjas. Se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia. Contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio y ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is married and she has three children, they have motivated her to continue with the family business. It’s a furniture store that has been in the family for three generations. The business was going through some difficult times, but thanks to the good work that she realizes she has managed to keep the furniture store running. Now she wants to increase the variety of furniture that she sells; for this reason she is requesting a loan of $750 that will help to keep her business growing.

Maria is a very responsible woman and she promises to repay the loan in 6 months. The desire to see her daughters finish their studies and have a better future has motivated her to do better everyday. Now with your help she will be able to achieve it. Thanks for the trust and support that you offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es casada y tiene tres hijos, ellos la han motivado para continuar con el negocio familiar, es una mueblería que tiene ya tres generaciones, pasaba por épocas difíciles pero gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ha logrado sacar adelante la mueblería y ahora desea incrementar la variedad de muebles que comercializa para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares, con lo que podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Maria es una mujer muy responsable y se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. El deseo de que sus hijas puedan culminar sus estudios y tener un mejor futuro la motivan a mejorar cada día y ahora con tu ayuda podrá lograrlo, muchas gracias por la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Sra. Beatriz R. Sanchez is 36 years old and has 3 children. She's suffered from an embolism for four years that makes it difficult for her to move her right arm. Nevertheless, she's succeeded by perservering. She started selling beauty products a year ago, both as therapy and because it was necessary for her to contribute to household expenses and to support her three young children.

When she joined the Alborada group in the department of La Libertad (in northern Peru) where she lives, she asked for an initial loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian nuevo soles or about US$96) to start her business. She now sells in the towns of Roma and Casa Grande and has some customers in the city of Trujillo. With the S/.500 (US$159) loan from Manuela Ramos, she will buy beauty products--shampoos, colognes, etc.--to stock inventory for resale.

In addition to being the treasurer of her community bank, Sr. Beatriz is also vice president of the "Santisima Virgen de la Puerta" Club de Madres in her town. She dreams of someday having a grand boutique there.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Beatriz R. S. tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, tiene dificultades para movilizar su brazo derecho debido a una embolia que padeció hace cuatro años, sin embargo es muy empeñosa y próspera. Ingresó a la venta de productos de belleza hace un año por terapia y por necesidad ya que tiene que aportar al hogar para cubrir los gastos de manutención de sus tres menores hijos.

Al ingresar al B.C. “Alborada” en el anexo Roma del Distrito de Ascope del Departamento de La Libertad - Perú, donde vive; solicitó un primer préstamo de S/.300 ($96 aproximadamente) con lo que inicia su actividad económica, actualmente vende en Roma, en Casa Grande y tiene algunos clientes en la ciudad de Trujillo. Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, de S/.500 ($159 aproximadamente) comprará más productos de belleza (Shampoos, cremas, colonias, etc.) ya que desea tener un stock que le permita realizar ventas al crédito.

La señora Beatriz además de ser Tesorera en su banco comunal es Vicepresidenta en el Club de Madres “Santísima Virgen de la Puerta” de su localidad. Ella sueña con tener una gran boutique en su comunidad.

loans.use: Working capital to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
Srta. Cecilia Armida H. Rodriguez is a 54-year old language instructor. She used to work as a public school teacher but had to give up her job when she found a tumor on her throat, for which she had an operation. To keep herself afloat, she began to sell food from her house in the Victor Larco district in the department of La Libertad (in northern Peru). She sold little of her "caldo de gallina" (chicken stock/broth) before she was invited by a neighbor to join the "Las Palmeras" group. With her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian nuevo soles or around US$96), she bought food in bulk--rice, oil, potatoes, etc.--to get the best prices and was able, as a consequence, to vary her menu.

Now she sells caldos in the morning and "criolla comida" (common Peruvian meals) in the evening. She also takes special orders during the week and on weekends for parties. With the S/.800 (around US$255) loan, she will continue buying wholesale food products: rice, oil, sugar, potatoes, "menestras" (a vegetable soup).

Srta. Cecilia is the secretary of her community bank and, in light of her career as a teacher, was chosen as the president of the management committee of the Atencion Integral del Nino de Pobreza y en Riesgo (Joint Attention to Poor & At-Risk Children) for the Victor Larco district. She is responsible for 12 Wawa Wasi daycare centers--a government program for low-income children--with a total of 96 children ranging in age from 6 months to 4 years. She dreams of improving her house for her nieces and nephews, some of whom she's raising, and saving for a time when she might not be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Cecilia Armida H. R. tiene 54 años de edad, ella es profesora de idiomas, trabajaba como docente pero tuvo que abandonar el trabajo debido a padecer de un tumor en la garganta, del cual fue operada. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender comida en su casa en el Distrito de Víctor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Vendía pocos platos de caldo de gallina al día hasta que una vecina la invitó a participar del B.C. “Las Palmeras” y con el primer préstamo de S/.300 ($96 aproximadamente) que recibió compró alimentos como arroz, aceite, papa, etc. al por mayor para obtener mejor precio y pudo así vender un menú variado.

Actualmente vende caldos por las mañanas y comida criolla por las noches, pero además los fines de semana y otros días atiende pedidos para celebraciones. Con el préstamo de S/.800 ($255 aproximadamente) que recibirá seguirá comprando alimentos al por mayor (arroz, aceite, azúcar, papa, menestras, etc.)

La señorita Cecilia es Secretaria en su banco comunal y además debido a la vocación de docente que tiene aceptó la Presidencia del Comité de Gestión de la Atención Integral del Niño de Pobreza y en Riesgo del Distrito de Víctor Larco, tiene a su cargo 12 wa wa huasi (Programa del Gobierno para el cuidado de niños) con un total de 96 niños de 6 meses a 4 años de edad. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa para que sus sobrinos, a los que crió, se sientan a gusto además quiere tener ahorros para usarlos cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Compra de alimentos al por mayor. Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothes business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her retailored second hand clothes business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional electronics stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his tomatoes stock.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: The family has 3 members. The parents work at handicrafts, weaving leaves, bamboo, etc., and their daughter is in the 6th class. The father had arthralgia (joint pain) and the mother had stomachache. Their average income is $17 per month/person and they must save money to cover their family’s expenses. Now they want to borrow $75  to raise chickens to get more profit and will pay back it in 5 months.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: The father is a carpenter but he had asthma and paid a lot of money for his medicines. The mother works as a day laborer. Their two older children, a boy and a girl, are in the 8th and 7th class; their youngest daughter is 4 years old. They plant 100 trees of green dragon fruit. Their average income is $15 per month/person. Now they want to borrow $75 to invest their green dragon orchard and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise green dragon fruit

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en: The mother had heart problems and  stays home. The father and his two oldest children, a boy and a girl, work as day laborers while his youngest daughter attends the 9th class. They plant 120 trees of green dragon fruit. Their average income is $12.50 per month/person. They want to borrow $75 to invest in their green dragon orchard and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise green dragon fruit

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
The family has 4 members. The father works as a day laborer, the mother sells bean sweets. Their oldest daughter is in the 6th class and the other, who has kidney problems, attends the 2nd class. Their average income is 15 per month/person.

The mother wants to borrow $50 to increase her capital to sell extra soft drinks to get more profit to purchase her daughter’s medicines and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Bean sweets and soft drinks

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en:
The father works as a fisherman and his wife weaves bamboo things. They must take care of their mother (85 years old) and 4 children (2-12 years old). Their 3 older children are in the 7th, 5th,  
and 3rd class; the youngest boy is still too young to go to school. Their average income is $8 per month/ person. They want to borrow $75 to raise chickens to get more income to support their family’s expenses and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
The family now has 5 members; the father just died 11 months ago. The mother is a farmer who plants rice for family’s food and 150 pillars of green dragon fruit for their other expenses. The two oldest children are in college and two others are in 11th and 8th class.

They got 2 previous loans. The last loan was $80 and their average income now is increased to $12.5 (before it was $7.25). They want use the new loan $75 to invest their green dragon orchard and pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise green dragon fruit

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
The 5 members of this family live with the grandmother (85 years old). The parents and their 4 children work is day laborers and the youngest daughter is in the 10th class. The mother has strum, a gland disease.

Thanks to their last loan, they earned $70 profit, and now their average income is $12.5 (previously $7.3). They want to have a new loan of $75 to invest in their green dragon fruit orchard and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise green dragon fruit

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is married and the mother of three children, two sons, 6 and 14, and one daughter, 11. Her husband's small income is not enough to cover the needs of the family so Maribel, an entrepeneurial woman, decided to start her own business selling ice cream a year ago. Summer temperatures in Monclova (a city in the northern Mexican state of Coahuila) are very high and, seeing the demand for her ice cream increase, Maribel responded by adding new flavors and offering ice cream in cones.

Maribel now needs a $125 loan that she will use to buy merchandise so that she can increase her sales. She promises to repay that amount in 3 months. With your help, this family can improve their lives. Decide to help. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 6 y 14 años de edad y una hija de 11. Su esposo recibe un salario muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, pero como Maribel es una mujer emprendedora decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de helados hace un año, vio en este negocio una muy buena oportunidad ya que en verano las temperaturas en Monclova, Coahuila son muy altas y la demanda por estos productos se incrementa, comenzó a vender solo paletas heladas y a petición de sus clientes fue incorporando otros tipos de helados y conos.

En estos momentos Maribel necesita un préstamo de $ 125 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda esta familia puede mejorar sus condiciones de vida, decídete a apoyarlos, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mario is originally from Monclova, Coahuila, is married and has three small children. His wife dedicates herself full time to the home and the care of her children. Eight years ago Mario started his own business in carpentry -- taking advantage of the knowledge and experience that he had from working for other people previously. He started with a few tools but had many desires to move his family ahead. Luckily, good work has helped it to grow so much that he needs an employee to keep up with the demand.

At the moment Mario needs a loan $ 325 dollars for the purchase of material that needs to make its work, he is committed to return this loan in 6 months. This will provide for well-being of this family, thanks.



ORIGINAL SPANISH

Mario es originario de Monclova, Coahuila, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus niños. Desde hace ocho años Mario emprendió su propio negocio, ante la falta de empleo de la localidad y la necesidad de obtener el sustento para su familia, abrió una carpintería aprovechando los conocimientos y experiencia que tenía en este oficio, inició con poca herramienta pero muchos deseos de salir adelante con su familia, afortunadamente el buen trabajo que realiza le ha ayudado a crecer con su negocio y para cubrir su demanda ahora cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado.

En estos momentos Mario necesita un crédito de $ 325 dólares para la compra de material que necesita para realizar su trabajo, él se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a contribuir en el desarrollo de su negocio, gracias.

loans.use: Compra de material

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma is married and has three daughters. Eighteen years ago, she and her husband decided to fix up their house, something that they would have found impossible to do with only her husband's income. Faced with this situation, Norma decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Soon afterwards, at the request of her customers, she began selling new clothing and her sales increased considerably. Her hard work has allowed her to build a steady business and to improve her family's quality of life.

To buy merchandise for the coming season and to have a broader selection for her customers, Norma is now asking for a $1,200 loan that she promises to repay in 6 months. You can be a part of the growth of this business and help Norma and her family. They sincerely thank you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es casada y tiene tres hijas, hace 18 años ella y su esposo decidieron mejorar las condiciones en las que se encontraba su vivienda, pero solo con el salario de su esposo hubiera sido imposible, ante esta situación Norma decidió emprender su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada, poco después, a petición de sus clientes, incorporó la venta de ropa nueva y sus ventas mejoraron considerablemente. El buen trabajo que ella realiza le ha permitido permanecer tanto tiempo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Para comprar mercancía de esta nueva temporada y tener una mejor variedad para sus clientes, ahora Norma está solicitando un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Tú puedes formar parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a Norma y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío lives in the locality of Monclova, Coahuila. She is married and has three small children aged 3,5, and 7. In his search for better opportunities for his family, Rocío's husband decided to go and work in the United States, but he has not sent money back home so Rocío and her children lacked many necessities. At the point where they did not have enough to even eat, Rocío decided to begin her own business selling footwear by catalog. This business would allow her to continue caring for her children since she had nobody to help her, so she began selling among her neighbors and acquaintances. Fortunatally, she soon succeeded in increasing both her clients and her sales.

In order to continue expanding her business Rocío needs a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase merchandise to meet the demand of her clients. She promises to return this money in just 3 month. Today you can give help to somebody in great need, so please decide to help this family. They thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila vive Rocío, ella está casada y tiene tres pequeños hijos de 3, 5 y 7 años de edad. En busca de obtener mejores oportunidades para su familia su esposo decidió irse a trabajar a Estados Unidos, pero no le enviaba dinero por lo que Rocío y sus hijos pasaron por muchas necesidades, no tenían ni para comer hasta que ella decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo calzado por catálogo, ya que este negocio le permitiría continuar al cuidado de sus pequeños porque no tiene quien le ayude, fue así como inició vendiendo entre sus vecinos y conocidos, afortunadamente pronto logró incrementar sus clientes y ventas.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Rocío necesita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Ruth Mirey

texts.es:
Ruth is married and has three children who have been the motivation for her decision to undertake her business since her husband's salary is very low and her family has subsided without many necessities. They had many economic problems, and in order to help her husband, Ruth began to sell shoes by catalog and soon succeeded in increasing her client base. Thanks to the good quality of her product's commercialization, her orders and sales grow more every day.

To sustain the expansion of her business and improve this growth spurt Ruth needs a loan of $200 ,which she will use to purchase merchandise. She offers to return this sum in only three months. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands, so please contribute to the development of this business. Ruth and her family give you their sincere gratitude.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth está casada y tiene tres hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual decidió emprender su negocio, ya que el salario de su esposo es muy bajo y su familia pasaba por muchas necesidades, tenían muchos problemas económicos y para ayudar a su esposo Ruth comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, pronto logró incrementar su cartera de clientes y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa sus pedidos y ventas crecían más cada día.

Para tener un mejor surtido y continuar creciendo con su negocio Ruth necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

20 years ago, Sara's three children were small and she had no one to help her with the expenses of the home and their education of its children. She he decided to undertake her own business that sells milk candy, Typical of this region, the demand by these products is very good and their sales improved every day. Single, now her children are older and they help her in its business, together they have managed to make it grow and improve the service that offers.



In order to provide better its business, Sara it is asking for a loan of $ 250 dollars that it will use in the purchase of merchandise to be able to cover the demand of its clients. She is committed to return this amount in 3 months. They thank for much the confidence and support that you offer them.



ORIGINAL SPANISH

Desde hace 20 años Sara enviudó, sus tres hijos estaban pequeños y al no tener a nadie que le ayudara con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos ella decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de dulces de leche y pay, por ser dulces típicos de la región la demanda por estos productos es muy buena y sus ventas mejoraban cada día, de esta manera es como Sara sacó adelante a su familia ella sola, ahora sus hijos están grandes y le ayudan en su negocio, juntos han logrado hacerlo crecer y mejorar el servicio que ofrecen.

Para surtir mejor su negocio Sara está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia contribuyendo con su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Severiana

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Severiana is a hard worker and person in charge, is married and has two daughters. Her husband receives a very low wage and they could not handle all the expenses of his family. For that reason, she saw it necessary to also enter the family business. Severiana began to sell candies and refreshments in their house. This has been a fundamental piece in the growth of this business, together have managed to advance it.

At this moment Severiana is asking for a loan of $ 925 dollars that she will use in the extension of his business to be able to offer a better service to it's clients and to improve the aspect of his store, as well as to incorporate the rent of video game machines. She promises to give back this amount in 6 months. She thanks for much the confidence and aid that you offer her.

ORIGINAL SPANISH

Severiana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está casada y tiene dos hijas, su esposo recibía un salario muy bajo y no podían solventar todos los gastos de su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Severiana comenzó a vender dulces y refrescos en su casa, después fue incorporando la venta de productos de abarrotes y sus ventas mejoraron considerablemente, la unión familiar ha sido una pieza fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante.

En este momento Severiana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la ampliación de su negocio para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar el aspecto de su tienda, así como también para incorporar la renta de máquinas de videojuegos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Severiana, ella agradece mucho la confianza y ayuda que le brindas.

loans.use: Remodelación

loans.name: Yadira Esmeralda

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Yadira is originally from Monclova in the state of Coahuila, is married and has two small ones of 2 and 7 years of age. Her husband is working and receives a small, insufficient salary that can't fully provide for the sustenance of his family. Since they had a second son the expenses of the home were increased. To be able to help, Yadira undertook her own business with the footwear sale, began between her relatives and neighbors, and now already she has many clients.

Their ambition for sales and desire to leave better with their family motivates them to improve day with day. Now Yadira needs a loan $ 200 dollars that will use in the purchase of merchandise to cover the orders with its clients and to increase the variety of its products of the new season, she promises to return this amount in 3 months. This is so important in the development of this business and in the life of Yadira and the family, they you thank for it sincerely.



ORIGINAL SPANISH

Yadira es originaria de Monclova en el estado de Coahuila, es casada y tiene dos pequeños de 2 y 7 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y recibe un ingreso mínimo, insuficiente para conseguir el sustento de su familia, desde que nació su segundo hijo los gastos del hogar se incrementaron y para poder ayudar a su esposo Yadira emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, comenzó entre sus familiares y vecinos, y ahora ya tiene muchos clientes. Su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de salir adelante con su familia la motivan a mejorar día con día.

Ahora Yadira necesita un crédito de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de sus productos de la nueva temporada, ella promete regresar está cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de Yadira y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is originally from Chiapas, in the South of Mexico, but in searching for better opportunities for her family, she and her husband decided to relocate to Apodaca in Nuevo León. In order to improve the quality of life of her three sons, Araceli decided to start her own business in the sale of cosmetics and footwear by catalog after she arrived in the region. Fortunately, thanks to her gusto for sales and a personal character which allows her to easily relate to people, Araceli soon succeeded in increasing her number of clients and expanding her business.

Araceli knows that this is a good time for sales, so in order to able to cover the demands of her clients and offer them good service she is asking for a loan of $1,200 dollars, which she is committed to repay in 6 months. With this loan, she will be able to acquire products for the new season and continue expanding. You can play an important part in the development of this business. Araceli and her family thank you greatly for your confidence and aid.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Araceli es originaria de Chiapas, en el Sur de México, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, ella y su esposo decidieron mudarse a la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus tres hijos Araceli decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y calzado por catálogo desde que llegaron a esta localidad. Afortunadamente gracias a su gusto por las ventas ya su carácter que le facilita el relacionarse con los demás Araceli pronto logró incrementar su numero ce clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Araceli sabe que se aproxima una buena temporal de ventas y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses, con lo que podrá adquirir productos de la nueva temporada y continuar creciendo. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Araceli y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of paint to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Luz has 2 years of experience in this activity. She started her business with her own capital, selling bijouterie, such as earrings and bracelets, as well as lipsticks, eye shadows and perfumes. Ms. Luz works every day of the week, administrating her business from home, with the help of her daughter.

Loan Use

Ms. Luz wishes to obtain the loan in order to buy more bijouterie, since the capital available to her is not enough to satisfy her clients’ demands; she wants to buy at a lower cost, so that she can sell at a cheaper price than the competition.

Personal Information

Ms. Luz is 52 years old, married and has three sons, who are attending college. Along with her husband, she has made a great effort to give a better education to her children. Her husband and sons currently provide monetary help to cover the household expenses. She also wants to use the business’ income to improve their house, in order to assure a better future for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Luz tiene 2 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Ella inició su negocio con un capital propio, vendiendo todo tipo de bisutería de mujer, como aretes y pulseras, así como lápiz de labios, sombras, perfumes, etc. Doña luz trabaja todos los días de la semana y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija. Su negocio lo administra desde su propia casa.

Uso del Préstamo

La Sra. Luz desea el crédito para comprar más bisuterías, ya que el capital que maneja no es suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que tiene de sus clientes y desea adquirir a un costo más bajo y a su vez venderlo a un mejor precio que la competencia.

Información Personal

Doña Luz tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, que están en la universidad. Ella, junto a su esposo, se ha esforzado trabajando duro para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Actualmente sus hijos y su esposo son un soporte económico para solventar los gastos en su hogar. Además ella desea mejorar su casa poco a poco con las utilidades que le genere el negocio y así tener un mejor futuro para ella y sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh (26) and her husband Dung (32) have a small grocery store in their home.  They sell a wide variety of items in their grocery store, including vegetables, candy, and household tools.  They use the money to raise their young 3-year-old girl.  The family is very poor.  Their house (pictured) is built from wooden sticks tied together.  They earn between 10-15,000 VND ($0.62-0.94) per day from the grocery sales.  They used to receive loans from other sources that charged high interest rates.  Most of their earnings went to pay off the interest on those loans.  They received 2 loans from Mekong Plus before, one of which was funded by Kiva, and since then, they have not asked for a loan from their old lenders.  They are now able to keep all of their earnings and save their money to send their daughter to school.  They would like to continue to work with Mekong Plus and Kiva to improve their grocery store.

loans.use: to increase the stock at her grocery store

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung (65) sells sweet tofu soup at a street stall.  Her husband Hai (73) is too old and weak to work.  The tofu stand is their only source of income.  Before receiving a loan from Mekong Plus, Dung was only able sell her sweet tofu soup in the mornings because she only had a small amount of ingredients.  With the money she earned, she could only buy rice to eat.  She has borrowed twice from Mekong Plus, and Kiva funded the most recent of those loans.  Now, Dung is able to sell all day, and she earns between 10-15,000 VND ($0.62-0.94) per day.  She wishes to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva once again to help her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her tofu business

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan (48) sells sweet rice dishes on the back of her bicycle.  She is separated from her husband and must raise a 14-year-old boy and 9-year-old girl on her own.  Ngan usually only sells her dish in the morning from 5 am to 8 am.  Afterwards, she works as a day laborer.  However, the work is very difficult and dangerous.  She hopes to improve her street food business so that she will not have to work as a day laborer.  She has received a loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva before, and she repaid her loan on time.  She has been able to earn 15-20,000 VND ($0.94-1.25) per day.  With her increased earnings, she bought a bicycle for her children to ride to school.  She hopes to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva again.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old has a barber shop in Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1000 to paint the shop and purchase new equipment. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and purchase new equipment

loans.name: Herminia Andre

texts.pt:
Married, with a 30-day-old son, she started the program in 2006. Her first loan was 6000 meticais. As her business has been gradually growing, she has taken additional loans, up to 16,000 meticais, and with the profits, she helped her fiancee organize their wedding and renovate the house where they live. In September, she would like to take a loan of 16,000, to build a wall and invest part in her business. In the future, she plans to build a house to rent near the Xai-Xai beach, where the couple has a piece of land.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Casada, com um filho de 30 dias, Entrou para o programa em 2006, seu primeiro emprestimo foi de 6.000,00, o negocio foi crescendo gradualmente e foi tomando emprestimos sucessivos, ate aos 16.000mt, , com os lucros, ajudou o noivo a organizar o casamento, reabilitaram a casa onde vivem, em setembro gostaria de tomar um emprestimo de 16.000, para construir o muro e investir parte no seu negocio, para o futuro pretende construir uma casa para aluguer proximo da praia do Xai-Xai, local onde o casal tem um terreno.

loans.use: To invest in building a wall at her home

loans.name: Maria Da Gloria

texts.pt:
Maria da Gloria is married. She took out her first loan in April 2006, in the amount of 6000 meticais, to invest in merchandise for the hair salon and dishes for resale. Her business has been growing. In September, she would like to take out her 5th loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticais, to invest in a new commercial establishment for the sale of basic goods.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Casada ,Tomou seu primeiro emprestimo em Abril 2006, de 6.000mt, para investir em mercadoria para o salao de cabelereiro e louca para revenda. Seu negocio foi crescendo. A 11 de Setembro vai tomar o 5. emprestimo no valor de 15.000mt, para investir num novo estabelecimento comercial para a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade.

loans.use: New establishment

loans.name: Eulalia Carlota

texts.pt:
Single, it's the first time that Eulalia Carlota is taking out a loan. She wants to increase the amount she has to buy a car. She would like a loan in September in the amount of 30,000 meticiais.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Solteira, e a primeira vez que toma emprestimo, quer aumentar o valor que tem para comprar um carro. Recebera no dia 10/09 o valor de 30.000mts

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a car

loans.name: Paulino Joao

texts.pt:
Married, with 6 children, Paulino João entered the program in 2006, with a loan of 3000 meticais. As his business evolved, growing gradually, in September he would like to take out a loan of 12,000 meticais. With the profits of the business, he will invest in items for his home, and in the future, he plans to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Casado, 6 filhos entrou para o programa em 2006, com um emprestimo de 3.000mts com a evolucaodo negocio foi subindo gradualmente. no dia 2/9 tomou 12.000mts, com os lucros do negocio tem investido em bens domesticos, no futuro pensa melhorar a sua casa.

loans.use: Purchase roosters and feed

loans.name: Joao Joaquim

texts.pt:
Single, with 5 children, João is a new client who plans to borrow 8000 meticais to purchase firewood in September.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Solteiro, 5 filhos, novo cliente pretende tomar 8.000mt para a compra de lenha, em setembro.

loans.use: Compra de lenha

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en: Hiep (45) and his wife Tam (40, pictured) own a small produce stand at the marketplace.  They sell a variety of fruits and vegetables; however, they often are only abL. to raise enough money to feed themselves and their 4 children. Their 4 children, Dung, Hanh, Phuc, and Truong, are all in school. Mekong Plus has helped the family by giving their daughter Phuc a scholarship to ease the costs of schooling.  Phuc is an excellent student, and the family and Mekong Plus wish for her to succeed in school. Hiep's body has been in a lot of pain, which has prevented him from working. Tam often tends to their stand at the marketplace. They would like a loan in order to increase their stock so that they can sell more each day.

loans.use: To buy more stock for produce stand

loans.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en: M. Smail lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated, and he is married. He has a son. His wife is a teacher. He was also in the Ministry of Education, but he was not satisfied with the salary, so he decided to start a business. He opened a retail shop. Now he needs capital, so he wants to take an individual loan to stock his retail shop and make a good business to support his family and make a good income. He is happy now.

loans.use: To fully stock all his materials

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan runs a small fruit stand at the commune market place.  Her husband passed away, and she is raising two sons on her own.  Her 14-year-old, Anh, goes to school, and her older son, Linh, helps in construction.  He does not get paid very much, but he wants to try to help the family make ends meet.  The family has no land for farming, so they must earn money to put food on the tabL..  Lan's fruit stand sells a variety of fruit including bananas, mandarin oranges, and Siamese custard apples.  She wishes to receive a loan in order to buy more fruit so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more stock for fruit stand

loans.name: Dau

texts.en: Dau runs a small fruit stand at the commune market place.  She sells a variety of fruit that includes bananas, mandarin oranges, and Siamese custard apples.  Her husband passed away, and Dau was left with the soL. responsibility of raising her 4 children.  Her son, Yen, was born with brain damage.  He is unabL. to go to school and must stay at home.  Her other son, Thanh, works in Ho Chi Minh City.  He sews clothes in a factory, but with his earnings, he is only abL. to support himself.  Dau has 2 other children still in school.  Life is very difficult for Dau, and she hopes Mekong Plus and Kiva can help her with a small loan.  She believes the loan will improve her business and increase her daily profits.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her fruit stand

loans.name: Chanh

texts.en: Chanh (35) lives with her mother (71) and 2 children, Ny (13) and Na (10).  Chanh works in the commune market place, where she sells live ducks and chickens.  She also has a small plot of land about 2,000 meters squared.  With the money that she earns from selling poultry and farming, she is barely able to feed her family and send her children to school.  Chanh would like to request a loan in order to buy more chickens so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and bring it to the market to sell

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan is a carpenter; he builds and fixes furniture when customers ask him.  His wife Pham Thi Gai (pictured) sells porridge and noodle soup at the market.  The family would like a loan in order to buy more ingredients so that they can improve their food stall.  Tan and Gai use the money they earn in order to raise their 4 children, Tham, Thuy, V., and Vu.  All of their children go to school.  When Tan is not busy with his carpentry, he tends to their small plot of land.  They are barely able to earn enough money to feed the family and send their children to school.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for food stall

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es:
Dora Maria has a mini grocery store in her house. She is 38 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She is a member of a group called "Grupo Flor de Ocosingo 4". There are other members such as Doña Margarita Molina Torres who sells chorizo and sausage hot dogs from her home, and Doña Ediveri Guadalupe Hernandez who has a small grocery store. Dora Maria and Ediveri will use the loan to purchase more merchandise for both of their stores, and Margarita would like to add a room to her house where she can display and sell her homecooking. They hope to gain more clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

DORA MARIA, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, esta casada tiene 38 años y tres hijos, pertenece al grupo Flor de Ocosingo 4 , junto con doña Margarita Molina Torres (vende embutidos de chorizo , salchichas en su domicilio ) y doña Ediveri Guadalupe Hernández ( tienda de Abarrotes ). Con el préstamo Dora Maria y Ediveri compraran mercadería para abastecer sus tiendas con mayor cantidad de alimentos no perecibles y de consumo, en cambio Margarita espera habilitar un lugar en su casa donde pueda mejor exhibir sus embutidos y lograr mayor cantidad de clientes.

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 45 years old and has 5 children. Her husband works in the countryside as a laborer. Rosa makes tamales and "atole", a traditional beverage prepared with corn and flavors. She used to sell this in the city market, going stall to stall. With the loan she hopes to be able to buy materials to prepare her food and drinks. She is part of the group Grupo Solidario 9, together with Mrs. Micaela L. G., who makes "pozol", ( corn cooked and ground and mixed with water), and sells it in the market. Both hope to buy more cooking utensils to prepare their products in better conditions, and arrange a place in their homes to sell their products.

ROSA tiene 45 años , cinco hijos , su esposo trabaja en el campo como jornalero , ella hace tamales y atole( bebida tradicional , preparado con maíz y saborizantes que le dan color y sabor ) que posteriormente vende en el mercado de la ciudad de manera ambulante.Con el préstamo espera poder comprar materia prima para preparar sus productos .Pertenece a Grupo Solidario 9 junto con doña Micaela López Gómez (hace pozol (maíz cocido y molido que se bate en agua ) y lo vende en el mercado ) Ambas esperan con el préstamo comprar más utensilios de cocina para preparar en mejores condiciones sus alimentos y además adaptar un lugar en sus casas para vender También ahí sus productos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To sell foods typical to the region

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima lives in her own house with her husband and children on Avenida Buenos Aires, in the earthquake prone city of La Paz. She is an artisan and paints shawls and quilts which she takes to the southern zone of the city where they are most appreciated by the housewives. The credit that she is asking for is to buy more paints and materials so that she can make more products with the help of her children, to whom Maxima is teaching this art form. She could therefore increase her profits.

Her track record with IMPRO shows that Maxima asked for $100 credit in March this year, which she paid back. Her qualification is 1, which means she is an excellent client and can ask for more credit with no problems.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Maxima vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la av. Buenos Aires de la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz ; es artesana y pinta manteles y fundas los cuales los acomoda en la zona Sur de nuestra ciudad, lugar donde es mas apreciado el trabajo por las amas de casa. El crédito que solicita es para comprar pinturas y tela y poder realizar el trabajo en más cantidad con ayuda de sus hijos, a quienes Maxima esta enseñando este arte y así mejorar sus ingresos. Su antecedente histórico con IMPRO indica que Maxima solicito un primer crédito por $100 en Marzo de este año, el cual ya ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Su calificación es 1, o sea cliente excelente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito sin ningún problema.

loans.use: To buy raw materials/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 26 years old and has 2 children. She has been separated for a long time from her husband, and since then she works selling typical foods of the region in small markets known as "tianguis campesinos". She makes snacks such as tamales, "atole", a traditional beverage made from corn, and other local foods. She carries her food snacks with her and sells them in different locations. With the loan, she will invest in the materials she needs to make her products. She is part of Grupo Solidario 9.

CATALINA , tiene 26 años y dos hijos , está separada desde hace mucho tiempo con su esposo y desde entonces ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos típicos en pequeños mercaditos llamados “ tianguis campesinos “ ella elabora sus productos tales como tamales , atole , etc. Y los vende de forma ambulante, su préstamo lo invertirá comprando la materia prima que necesita para elaborar sus productos. Pertenece al Grupo Solidario 9.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of food typical to the region

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene lives in his own house on the Calle 16 de Junio in the outskirts of the city of La Paz with his wife and kids. He is a graffic designer and has a workshop in the city of El Alto where he does all his printing. Rene needs to increase his income and to hold off his competition, so he is asking for a loan in order to buy materials and to increase production.

Rene has been a client of IMPRO's since 2004 and he has a very good track record of repayments, and this qualifies him to apply again.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Rene vive en casa propia en la calle 16 de julio de la zona de tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa e hijos; es de profesión grafico y tiene su taller en la ciudad de El Alto donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos de imprenta. Rene necesita mejorar sus ingresos y mantener la competencia alejada, por lo que el crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder atender mas pedidos de imprenta. Rene es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004 y tiene muy buen antecedente y una excelente historia de pagos y eso lo califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To increase his income/Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man aged 40 with two children aged 10 and 8 years who are attending primary section at a nearby school. In addition, he provides shelter and basic needs to two other relatives who reside with him.

Mr. M. sells new clothes, shoe polish, mosquito nets, and many more items. He purchases the above items in bulk at wholesale prices and sells the goods at his shop in the city center and to retailers in villages to get a profit margin. In addition, he keeps poultry, specifically layers, to supplement his income. Despite juggling here and there, Mr. M. feels that he still has potential if given financial assistance of $1200 to expand his income base by re-stocking the clothing business, which will enable him to meet his basic needs comfortably.

loans.use: Re-stock

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal lives in a rented house with his wife and their son, in the alley named Las Nieves in the zone of Alto Chijini in La Paz. He works distributing coffee from a small truck. His wife sells various products from a small stand and with the money she makes she helps Anibal maintain the family. The loan Anibal is requesting will be used to buy more coffee, and be able to grow his market and increase his profits. He is a new client and the analysis shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Anibal vive en alquiler con su esposa y su hijo, en el callejón Las Nieves de la zona de Alto Chijini de la Ciudad de La Paz; el trabajo que realiza es la distribución de café en una camioneta. Su esposa tiene un puesto de venta de productos varios con cuyos ingresos ayuda a Anibal para el mantenimiento de la familia. El crédito que Anibal solicita será destinado a la compra de más café ya que el compra al contado y así poder ampliar su mercado y mejorar sus ingresos Es cliente nuevo y el análisis de flujo de caja indica que puede acceder a un crédito.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Vidaura

texts.es:
Vidaura is 37 years old and has 2 children. She is separated from her husband. To take care of her family she has worked in many businesses, but for three years now she has rented a place near the exit to her neighborhood, where she established a small eatery for the people passing in and out of the area. This has enabled her to provide for her family. With the loan, she hopes to improve her eatery. She is part of Grupo Solidario 11, together with Mrs. Minerva Decelis Dominguez, who has a grocery shop, and will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

VIDAURA , tiene 37 años , 2 hijos , está separada de su esposo y desde entonces para poder mantener a su familia se ha dedicado a trabajar en muchas cosas pero desde hace tres años esta rentando un local a la salida de su localidad en donde estableció un comedor o cocina económica donde vienen las personas que pasan por el sector a servirse los platos que ella ofrece , esto le ha permitido salir adelante con sus hijos .Con el préstamo espera adecuar de mejor manera su local .Pertenece al Grupo Solidario 11 Junto con doña Minerva Decelis Domínguez (tienda de abarrotes) quien con el préstamo invertirá en comprar más mercadería para abastecer su tienda.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: RESTAURANT

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime lives with her husband in her own home in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz.. She is dedicated to making footwear for children, and her shop is located in her home. She works with one person who assembles the shoes and her husband who cuts and sows. The loan she's requesting is for purchasing materials so she can produce larger quantities, hire another person, and increase her income.

Jaime received a loan in 2006, which she repaid in full incrementally. Her credit history classifies her as an excellent client and worthy of receiving another loan.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Jaime vive en casa propia en la Calle Ascencio Padilla de la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
