Jaime se dedica a la elaboración de calzados de niños, el taller esta ubicado en su domicilio, trabaja con una persona que arma los calzados y su esposa que corta y cose. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder elaborar calzados en mayor cantidad, contratar otra persona más y mejorar sus ingresos. Jaime obtuvo un crédito de IMPRO en el año 2006 el cual fue pagado íntegramente y en las fechas establecidas. Este antecedente histórico lo califica como un cliente excelente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase materials and hire another worker

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin lives in a rented home with his wife and daughter in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz. He runs a repair shop out of his father's home in the city and works as a mechanic along with his brothers. His income isn't sufficient to provide for and take care of his family, so he purchased a taxi with a loan to earn extra money.

The loan he's currently requesting is to make repairs on the taxi to get it operating again so he can work as a cab driver and increase his income.

Edwin has been an IMPRO client since April 2006 and since then has received two loan, both of which he repaid on time. He credit history classifies him as a good client and worthy of another loan.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Edwin vive en casa alquilada con su esposa e hija en la calle Caupolican de la zona de Tembladerani de La Ciudad de La Paz; tiene un taller de mecánica en la casa de su padre en la calle Carlos Romero; el trabajo que realiza es de mecánico junto con sus hermanos. Sus ingresos provenientes de esta actividad no son suficientes para mantener a su familia y proveer todo lo que necesita, por lo que Edwin compro un vehiculo al crédito para hacerlo trabajar como taxi. El crédito que solicita es para hacer un mantenimiento total de la movilidad; una vez hecho el mantenimiento, la movilidad entrara en funcionamiento como taxi, de tal manera que los ingresos de Edwin mejoraran en un futuro muy cercano. Edwin es cliente de IMPRO desde Abril de 2006 y desde entonces ha accedido a dos préstamos los cuales han sido pagados puntualmente. Su antecedente Histórico con Impro lo califica como buen cliente y puede solicitar un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel is 42 years old, separated and has 3 small children. In order to be able to send her children to school and feed them, she started to bake bread in her house in small quantities and to sell it around her neighborhood. Now she has a small bread shop in her house which enables her to support her household with the bread she sells. With a loan she hopes to buy a large kitchen where she could bake more bread. She is a member of the Solidario 11 microcredit group. Also in the group are Martha Ureña Martínez (perfume and cosmetics sales) and Martha Martínez Trejo (perfume and cosmetics sales). They hope to combine their loans to order larger quantities and varieties of products from another city to then divide them and expand each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

MARIVEL, tiene 42 años , esta separada y quedo con 3 hijos pequeños , para educarlos y alimentarlos empezó a hacer pan en su casa en pequeñas cantidades los cuales salía a vender por su comunidad , actualmente tiene una pequeña panadería en su casa que le permite mantener su hogar con el producto de sus ventas, con el préstamo espera comprar una cocina grande donde pueda producir en mayor cantidad su pan . Pertenece al Grupo Solidario 11 junto con doña Martha Ureña Martínez (venta de perfumes y cosméticos) y doña Martha Martínez Trejo (vende perfumes y cosméticos) ellas esperan unir sus préstamos y encargar a otra ciudad mayor cantidad y surtido de productos para luego repartirlos y acrecentar sus respectivos negocios

loans.use: TO MAKE AND SELL BREAD

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen lives in her own house with her husband and her youngest daughter in the Agua de la Vida zone of La Paz. Her husband is retried and her daughter is studying tourism, and the loan Carmen is requesting is to purchase a computer and continue helping with her daughter's education until she becomes a professional.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen vive en casa propia en la Calle Coronel Estensoro de la zona de Agua de la Vida de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija menor. El esposo es jubilado, su hija es estudiante de turismo y el crédito que solicitan es para comprar una computadora y poder seguir colaborando con la educación de su hija hasta que sea profesional. Es cliente nuevo; el análisis socioeconómico y el flujo de caja les permite acceder a un crédito, el cual cae en el programa de Fomento, bajo el rubro Educación de nuestra cartera de Créditos.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 23 years old. Her husband works training roosters for the typical cockfights common in the area. Graciela works selling shoes from catalogs. The shoes are much requested by the people in her community. She now has three years in this business, and with the loan she hopes to be able to invest in a greater variety of footwear and special sizes, and set up a small shop in her house. With this, she will be able to increase her profits and offer better conditions for her children. She is part of the group Genesys 1, together with Aurelia Trujillo, who works raising chickens, which she sells to people in her community. She hopes to buy more pairs of birds with the loan, to increase the breeding between the birds and her sales.

GRACIELA, tiene 23 años, casada, su esposo se dedica a entrenar gallos para que participen en los palenques en tradicionales peleas de gallos. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catálogos los que son muy solicitados por las gentes de su comunidad, lleva tres años con esa actividad espera con el préstamo poder invertir solicitando mas variedad de calzados en distintos números y así instalar un pequeño negocio de venta en su casa y poder obtener mas ganancias para ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida para sus hijos. Pertenece al grupo Génesis 1 junto con doña Aurelia Trujillo Trujillo quien se dedica a la crianza de pollos de granja para la engorda los cuales vende entre las personas de su comunidad , ella espera comprar mas parejas de aves para aumentar así la cruza entre ellas y por lo tanto la venta .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of footwear

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lorena is 31 years old and has one child. Her husband works as an accountant in the local social security office. To contribute to the family bills, Lorena has a small grocery shop in her house, which allows her to work while being able to care for the home and the children. She is part of a group called Genesys 1, together with Delia Jesus T., (who also has a grocery shop). With the loan, they would like to buy merchandise to improve their shops.

LORENA, tiene 31 años, 1 hijo, su esposo labora como contador en el seguro social de su localidad. Ella para contribuir al gasto familiar tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa de esta forma pude ganarse la vida trabajando sin descuidar las atenciones del hogar.. Pertenece al grupo Génesis 1 junto con doña Delia Jesús T. (tienda de abarrotes) Con el préstamo esperan comprar mercadería para abastecer sus locales

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: grocery shop

loans.name: Ana Paula

texts.es:
Ana Paula is 19 years old and married. With the loan and some of her savings, she hopes to launch a business selling clothing. She would like to rent a location to exhibit her merchandise, and to be able to go cities close to her community where she can buy materials in more variety and in bulk. She is part of the group Genesis 1.

ANA PAULA, tiene 19 años, casada , con el préstamo y con algunos ahorros que posee desea hincar el negocio de la venta de ropa , quiere arrendar un local para exhibir su mercadería la cual espera ir a comprar a las ciudades cercanas a su comunidad donde hay mas variedad y son mas económicas al comprar por mayoreo. Ella pertenece al grupo Génesis 1

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Clothing sales

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
Olga Isabel works selling catalog shoes to her neighbors and friends. For three years she has had this business and has been able to contribute to the monthly costs of her family. She is 40 years old with 2 children. Her husband works making metal doors and windows. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to have stock in her house. She is part of a group called Genesis 2, together with Ana Lidia Diaz Alfonso, who works as a seamstress for women in the community. For her part of the loan, Ana Lidia will buy thread and fabrics to make garments to sell in her community.

OLGA ISABEL, se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo entre sus vecinos y amigos, desde hace tres años que se mantiene con ese negocio y de esta forma contribuye al gasto familiar, tiene 40 años, 2 hijos y su esposo trabaja haciendo puertas y ventanas de metal .Ella espera con el préstamo invertir comprando más zapatos para tener un stock en su casa .Pertenece al grupo Génesis 2 junto con doña Ana Lidia Díaz Alfonso que trabaja como costurera entre las mujeres de su comunidad y con su parte del préstamo comprará hilos , telas para hacer prendas y vender entre las personas de su comunidad .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Sales of footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria Elisa is 45 years old and separated from her husband. She has one child. Maria Elisa works selling catalog shoes, and in this way she is able to cover the monthly bills. She also works in an office which offers a service of temporary help. She is part of a group called Genesis 2, together with Maria de Jesus Perez, who also works selling the catalog shoes. With the loan, they hope to invest in more quantity of shoes, divide them between the two so that they have stock in their houses and can grow their sales.

MARIA ELISA , tiene 45 años , separada , 1 hijo , ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y de esta forma apoya con los gastos del hogar aparte ella trabaja en una oficina haciendo servicios temporales . Pertenece al grupo Génesis 2 junto con doña Maria de Jesús Pérez quien también trabaja en la venta de calzados por catálogos.. Con el préstamo esperan las dos invertir comprando mayor cantidad de calzados, repartirse entre ellas y así poder tener un stock en sus casas para aumentar las ventas.

loans.use: Sales of footwear

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 43 years old and single. She makes garments which she embroiders and then sells to the wholesalers in the city of San Cristobal, who exhibit in the city's handicraft market. She is part of a group called Esquipulas 3, together with Rosa Lopez P., who also works making handicrafts such as embroidered table clothes and napkins. Both of them would like to use the loan to buy larger quantities of fabric and thread to divide between them, and bring down their costs and increase their profits

PETRONA, tiene 43 años, soltera es artesana se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir las cuales posteriormente borda y vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad de San Cristóbal quienes exponen en el mercado de artesanías de la ciudad Pertenece al grupo Esquípulas 3 junto con doña Rosa López Pérez quien también trabaja como artesana pero confeccionando manteles y servilletas las cuales borda posteriormente. Ambas esperan con el préstamo comprar cantidades grandes de telas e hilos de bordar y repartirse entre ellas y así bajar los costos de compra y aumentar sus ganancias al vender sus productos a los mayoristas de la ciudad .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Juana Salustia

texts.es:
JUANA is 22 years old; she’s married and has two children. She has been separated from her husband for a year since he left her to go to the United States in search for a new life. He forgot about her and their family and now she makes a living by selling table clothes, napkins and shawls. She then hand embroiders them and sells them to the wholesalers of the city every two weeks by the dozen. The pay is not comparative to the quality of her embroidery, this is why she wants the loan, so she can buy more fabric and embroidery floss and divide it with the other ladies in the Esqui Pulas 3 group. Mrs. Rosenda Lopez Perez (artisan) and Mrs. Maria Teresa Perez Vasquez (artisan) belong to this group; they want to sell their products to the tourists without intermediaries.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA, tiene 22 años esta casada , 2 hijos , esta separada de su esposo hace un año y medio ya que el la abandono por irse a vivir a los EE.UU. en busca de una nueva vida, pero se olvido de su familia , ella se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando manteles , servilletas, chales los cuales después borda y vende entre los mayoristas de la ciudad cada quince días por docenas, como el pago no es comparativo en relación con la calidad de su bordado es que espera con el préstamo comprar mas telas e hilos y repartirse entre las otras señoras de su grupo llamado Esquí pulas 3 al cual pertenecen doña Rosenda López Pérez ( artesana ) y Maria Teresa Pérez Vásquez ( artesana ) y además de esta forma poder vender ellas mismas sus productos a los turistas que visitan la zona .

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 40 years old and has 8 children. Her husband works in the corn fields. Maria makes table clothes, napkins and hand embroidered handicrafts and then she sells them to the wholesalers of the city. She belongs to the group EscueL. 3 along with Mrs. Rosa Lopez D. L. C. who also works as an artisan, but she sells them at the handicraft market. They will both invest the loan in buying embroidery floss, and they will mend the looms they use for the making of their hand-maD. fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 40 años, 8 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en el cultivo del maíz, elL. se dedica a L. confección D. manteles, servilletas y prendas artesanales bordadas que venD. a los mayoristas D. L. ciudad. Pertenece al grupo EscueL. 3 junto con doña Rosa López D. L. C. quien también trabaja como artesana D. prendas D. vestir bordadas pero ellas las venD. en el mercado D. las artesanías. Con el préstamo ambas invertirán comprando telas, hilos D. bordar y arreglaran sus telares manuales que elL. mismas confección para bordar sus telas.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
CATARINA is 31 years old and she is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a construction worker. She works as an artisan making table clothes, clothing and napkins, all hand embroidered. She goes out and sells them to the tourists and other people in the streets of San Cristobal. She belongs to the group Escuela 3 along with Mrs. Maria J. Hernandez who is also an artisan and sells her merchandise in Zinacatan to the tourists. They will both invest their loan in buying fabric and embroidery floss.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

CATARINA , tiene 31 años , casada , 2 hijos , su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil. Ella trabaja como artesana confeccionando manteles, prendas de vestir, servilletas todas bordadas y las sale a vender por las calles de la ciudad de San Cristóbal entre los turistas que visitan la zona y gentes del pueblo. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 3 junto con doña Maria Jiménez Hernández, también artesana que vende sus productos (manteles y servilletas) en Zinacantan a los turistas. Ambas invertirán sus préstamos comprando telas e hilos para bordar.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
MARIA is 23 years old and has 3 children. Her husband works in the corn fields. She is an artisan and makes clothing, table clothes and napkins. Maria belongs to the group Escuela 4 along with Mrs. Antonia Hernandez L. (artisan) and Mrs. Petrona L. L. (artisan). Since all of them make embroideries, they would like to invest in the purchase of more fabric, embroidery floss and wood for their looms. They will divide what they buy between them and each one will go out to the street and sell their merchandise to the tourists in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ,tiene 23 años , 3 hijos , su esposo trabaja en el campo en la cosecha del maíz, Ella se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando prendas de vestir, manteles, servilletas. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 4 junto con doña Antonia Hernández López (artesana) y doña Petrona López López (artesana). Como todas ellas se dedican a la confección de prendas artesanales bordadas quieren invertir en sus negocios con el préstamo comprando telas al por mayor, hilos de bordar y maderas para confeccionar sus telares posteriormente se repartirán entre ellas lo comprado y cada una saldrá a vender en forma individual a las calles de la ciudad a los turistas de la zona.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
LORENZA is 25 years old and she has 2 children. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She is an artisan and makes table clothes, napkins and shawls, all of them with embroidery. She belongs to the group Escuela 4 along with Mrs. Catalina Jimenez Lopez, who is also an artisan. They both sell their products to the tourists at the local handicraft market in San Cristobal, Chiapas. With the loan they plan to buy more fabric, embroidery floss and wood for their looms and therefore gain more profit from their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

LORENZA, tiene 25 años, 2 hijos, su esposo vende frutas y verduras en el mercado .Ella es artesana y confecciona manteles, servilletas, chales todos bordados. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 4 junto con doña Catalina Jiménez López también artesana, ellas venden sus productos en el mercado de artesanías de San Cristóbal y a los turistas que visitan la ciudad. Con el préstamo esperan comprar telas, hilos y madera para sus telares para obtener una mayor producción.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
MARIA is 25 years old; she’s single and lives with her parents. She helps her parents by making clothes, table clothes and napkins; she then embroiders them and sells them to the tourists on the streets of San Cristobal, Chiapas. She belongs to the group Escuela 4 along with Mrs. Maria Jimenez L. (artisan), they will both use the loan to invest in their business by buying fabric and embroidery floss to make a larger number of embroidery items and therefore gain more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA , tiene 25 años , es soltera y vive con sus papas y los ayuda confeccionando prendas de vestir , manteles , servilletas y luego las borda y sale a vender por las calles de la ciudad de San Cristóbal a los turistas que frecuentan el lugar .. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 4 junto con doña Maria Jiménez López (artesana), ambas invertirán el préstamo comprando telas , hilos de bordar para confeccionar mayor cantidad de prendas artesanales y así obtener mas ganancias

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
ALBERTINA is 23 years old, she has one child and her husband works as a collective train driver. She works on handicrafts; she embroiders napkins, pillows, table clothes, table runners, and shawls. She displays her art in a shop she has on the side of the international highway (it goes thru her community). She will use the loan to invest in her shop and also to buy more embroidery floss and fabric for her embroidery work. Albertina belongs to the group Merced 1

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

ALBERTINA, tiene 23 años, 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja como chofer de la locomoción colectiva. Ella es artesana, borda manualmente servilletas, cojines, centros de mesa, chales, los cuales exhibe en un local que tiene a las orillas de la carretera internacional (que pasa por su comunidad). Con su préstamo invertirá en adecuar mejor su local y adquirirá hilos y telas para aumentar la producción de sus artesanías .Ella pertenece al grupo Merced 1

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila makes handicrafts such as table clothes, napkins, shawls and cushions which she sells to the wholesalers of San Cristobal, or in Tuxtla Gutierrez where they allow in certain quantities to the handicrafts shops. Domitila is 37 years old, with 3 children. Her husband works selling fruits and vegetables in the village market closest to his neighborhood. With the loan, she will by more thread and fabric, to create and embroider more garments to sell. She is part of the group Merced 1.

DOMITILA , es artesana hace manteles , servilletas , chales , cojines los cuales vende a los mayoristas de San Cristóbal o en Tuxtla Gutiérrez donde entrega por cierta cantidad y ahí son comercializados en tiendas de artesanía . Ella tiene 37 años, 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como comerciante vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado del pueblo mas cercano a su comunidad .Con su préstamo comprara mas hilo , telas y así confeccionara y bordará mas prendas para vender . Pertenece al grupo Merced 1

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hard work has helped Margaret expand her business using the $1,150 loan that was financed by Kiva lenders (#5061). She is very grateful for the support. Margaret used the loan to start a book binding business which is doing well. She fully repaid the loan by 9th September 2007.

Being an enterprising woman, Margaret also rears chickens. She currently has 800 birds. She is looking at expanding her business to 1,200 birds. She would like to borrow $1200 to buy more chicks and expand the chicken housing units. She employs one person, but she will need to employ extra labor when the number of chickens increases. Her dependents also give an extra hand while taking their school holidays. She is very optimistic that the expansion of her businesses will enable her to send her children and dependents through school.

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a 55 year old widow with 3 children. She has made handicrafts all of her life. She sells what she makes in the handicrafts market in the city of San Cristobal, where she travels every 15 days to sell her finished products. With the loan, she will buy thread and fabrics, so she can generate more profits and sell in greater quantity. She is a part of the group called Merced 1.

MARIA, tiene 55 años, 3 hijos, es viuda. Ella ha sido artesana toda la vida, lo que hace lo vende en el mercado de las artesanías de la ciudad de San Cristóbal donde viaja cada quince días para vender sus productos ya terminados. Con el préstamo invertirá en hilos, telas y así obtendrá mas ganancias al vender mayor cantidad.. Pertenece al grupo Merced 1.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: handicrafts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 34 years old and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Maria makes table clothes, shawls, napkins and cushions. She also buys some of the handicrafts from the women in her community and exhibits them at a place in the community of Nachig, along the international highway. She is a part of the group Merced 1. With the loan, she hopes to buy more thread and fabric to embroider, so there's more merchandise from the artisans of her community and more variety to sell.

MARIA, tiene 34 años, 5 hijos, su esposo es campesino. Ella se dedica a confeccionar manteles, chales, servilletas, cojines y también le compra algunas artesanías a las mujeres de su comunidad y posteriormente exhibe en un local que tiene en la comunidad de Nachig a orillas de la carretera internacional. Pertenece al grupo Merced 1 , con el préstamo espera comprar mas tela e hilos para bordar así como también mas mercadería a las artesanas de su comunidad para poder tener mas variedad que vender en sus local .

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 52 years old and has 6 children. Her husband works in the fields. Maria wants to invest her loan to improve the grocery shop she has had in her house for 5 years. She also wants to buy fabrics to continue developing the activity in which almost all the women in her community participate, embroidering clothing. She is part of the group Merced 2.

MARIA , tiene 52 años , 6 hijos , su esposo trabaja en el campo como agricultor, ella va a invertir su préstamo en abastecer una tienda de abarrotes que tiene en su casa desde hace como cinco años , además comprara telas para seguir desarrollando la actividad que casi todas las mujeres de su comunidad realizan que es el bordado en prendas de vestir .Pertenece al grupo Merced 2 .

loans.use: Shop selling groceries and handicrafts

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona has been a craftworker since she was a small girl and supports her husband in the care of her home and her two small children. With her ability of needlework she makes table cloths, napkins, cushions, bedspreads, and other merchandise that she sells around the village of Zinacantan or in the city of San Cristóbal in the market of craftswork. She also has a small stand by the edge of the international road where the tourists buy their products. She belongs to the group of the Market 2, where she hopes to wait for a loan to buy the fabric and string for her handcraft.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny and Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

PETRONA ha sido artesana desde muy pequeña de esta forma apoya a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar y de sus dos pequeños, ella con la habilidad del bordado hace manteles, servilletas, cojines, sobrecamas, chales mercancía que vende en el pueblo de zinacantan o en la ciudad de San Cristóbal de las casas en el mercado de las Artesanías, también tiene un local a las orillas de la carretera internacional donde compran sus productos los turistas que transitan por ahí. Pertenece al grupo Merced 2 , con el préstamo espera comprar mas tela e hilo de bordar para sus artesanias.

loans.use: Buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena is an artisan who every day, along with her daughters, weaves napkins, table cloths, pillow covers and shawls. It takes her approximately 15 days to finish a batch to commercialize in her town (Zinacantan) or in the city (at the Artisans Market of Santo Domingo). She is 26 years old and has three children. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fabrics, threads and weaving looms, in order to increase production and contribute with family expenses; her husband, who works as a driver, earns a very low salary. She belongs to the group called Merced 2.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Elena es artesana y teje todos los días, junto con sus hijas, servilletas, manteles, cojines, chales. Le lleva aproximadamente 15 días terminar una cierta cantidad para comercializar en su pueblo (Zinacantan) o en la ciudad (Mercado de las Artesanías de Santo Domingo). Ella tiene 26 años y tres hijos. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos y telares para aumentar la producción y de esta forma contribuir con el gasto familiar, ya que su esposo tiene un salario muy bajo, trabajando como chofer. Forma parte del grupo llamado Merced 2.

loans.use: Purchase of weaving materials.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 27 years old with 2 children. She makes embroidered handicrafts such as napkins, tablecloths, pillows, shawls, bedspreads and typical clothing worn by the woman in the region. Every two weeks she takes her merchandise to the village or the city to sell to the wholesalers who sell in and out of the state. She also has a business with her husband selling fruits and vegetables in the city of San Cristobal. With the loan, she will buy thread and fabric, as well as fruits and vegetables. In this way they can improve their economic situation as both these businesses grow. Rosa is part of a group called Merced 3.

ROSA tiene 27 años, dos hijos. Ella es artesana borda servilletas, manteles, cojines, centros de mesa, chales, sobrecamas y ropa típica que las mujeres de su localidad utilizan. Para que ella reúna cierta cantidad de mercancía le lleva entre 15 a 30 días y así llevarlas a vender al pueblo o la ciudad con los mayoristas que lo venden dentro o fuera del Estado. También junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de san Cristóbal. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos así como también en las frutas y verduras. De esta forma mejoraran la condición económica en la que se encuentran ya que ambas actividades crecerán. Rosa forma parte del grupo Merced 3.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa creates handicrafts as do almost all the women in her community of Nachig. She embroiders tablecloths, napkins, cushions and bedspreads, and sells them with people in her community who bring their merchandise to other tourist states to sell. Rosa is 26 years old and has 2 children. With her work, she contributes to the household costs. She is part of the group known as Merced 3. With this loan, she will invest in more thread and fabric wholesale, as it's much less expensive to buy this way.

ROSA es artesana como casi todas las mujeres de su comunidad Nachig, ella borda manteles, servilletas, cojines, sobrecamas que vende con gente de su localidad quienes lo llevan a otros Estados turísticos para su comercio. Rosa tiene 26 años y tiene dos hijos, con la actividad que desempeña contribuye a la economía de su hogar. Ella forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Merced 3. Con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de hilo y tela al por mayor ya que adquiriéndola de esta forma es mucho mas barato.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
ROSA YOLANDA is a single 17 years old. Since she was little her mom taught her how to make crafts, which distinguishes her town (Zinacantan). She makes napkins, table cloths, bed sheets, and cushions. She sells them with many other people from her region wich makes her town a comercial tourist center. She also helps bring merchandise to herr moms store. With the loan she will invest on the thread and fabric for her crafts. She also will buy rice, sugar, salt, oils, and other things for her moms grocery store. She's part of the solitary group called "Merced 3".

Translated from Spanish by Mariela and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

ROSA YOLANDA tiene 17 años, soltera, desde muy pequeña su mama le enseño la actividad artesanal que distinguen a su pueblo (zinacantan). Ella hace servilletas, manteles, chales, sobrecamas, cojines y los vende con los mayoristas de su región que lo comercializan en centros turísticos. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de hilo y tela al por mayor, y también ayudara a surtir la tienda de abarrotes que tiene su mama comprando arroz, azúcar, sal, aceites, otros. Ella forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Merced 3.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric for her crafts.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is an artisan. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, and the clothing typically worn by women in her area. She travels once every 30 days to the town of San Cristóbal de las Casas (the market of Santo Domingo) to sell her pieces to wholesalers. She is not married and she supports herself with this activity. She is part of the loan group Merced 3. With her loan, she will invest in buying looms, thread, and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

CATALINA es artesana borda servilletas, manteles, chales, ropa típica que usan las mujeres de su localidad y viaja cada 30 días a la ciudad de San Cristóbal de las Casas (mercado de santo Domingo) para vender a los mayoristas sus artesanías. Ella es soltera y con esta actividad se apoya para su sostenimiento. Forma parte del grupo Merced 3. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de telares, hilo y telas.

loans.use: To buy looms, thread, and fabrics

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita and her husband have a small business selling fruits and vegetables. It is located in their house and they work every day of the week. Juanita is also an artisan. In her free time she embroiders napkins, bedcovers, shawls, and table decorations, which she sells in the artisan market of San Cristóbal de las Casas. With the loan, she will invest in a shelf to exhibit her stock of fruits and vegetables. She will also buy fabrics and threads to continue with her embroidery. In this way they hope to improve the business and thereby increase their income and their economic situation. Juanita is 46 years old and has 6 children. She is part of the loan group Merced 4.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANITA junto con su esposo tienen un pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa y lo trabajan todos los días de la semana. También ella es artesana, en sus ratos libres borda servilletas, sobrecamas, chales, centros de mesa y los vende en el mercado de las artesanías de San Cristóbal de las Casas. Con el préstamo invertirá en un estante para exhibir el surtido de las frutas y verduras de igual forma comprara telas e hilos para continuar con el bordado. De esta forma desean mejorar el negocio y así aumentar las ganancias mejorando la condición económica. Ella tiene 46 años y tiene 6 hijos. Forma parte del grupo merced 4.

loans.use: To buy a shelf to exhibit fruits and vegetables; to buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesus

texts.es:
Magdalena de Jesús is 23 years old, is married, and has one child. She has a small grocery store in her in-laws’ house, since she doesn’t have her own house. With the loan, she will expand the store’s space and also buy a stock of rice, cookies, salt, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, soft drinks, and other such items. In this way, she will help her husband with the household expenses and also be able to save for their own house, where they can establish their business. She is part of the loan group Merced 4.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

MAGDALENA DE JESUS tiene 23 años, casada, un hijo. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus suegros ya que no cuenta con casa propia. Con el préstamo ampliara el lugar y comprara un surtido de arroz, galletas, sal, azúcar, aceite, pastas, bebidas y otros. Con esto apoyara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y así poder ahorrar obteniendo en un futuro una casa propia y establecer ahí el negocio. Ella forma parte del grupo Merced 4.

loans.use: To expand a small grocery store and to buy a stock of grocery items

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is an artisan. She embroiders with patterns and colors that are characteristic of her region. She makes napkins, cushions, bedcovers, shawls, clothing typically worn by people of the area, and other such items. She has always done this type of work and it is how she helps her husband with the household expenses and education for their five children. She takes her merchandise to sell in the town of San Cristóbal de las Casas. Rosa is part of a loan group called Merced 4. With her loan she will buy thread and fabrics at wholesale price so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA es artesana borda con figuras y colores que caracterizan a su región, hace servilletas, cojines, sobrecamas, chales, ropa típica, otros. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad apoyando de esta forma a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus cinco hijos. Su mercancía lo lleva a vender a ciudad de San Cristóbal de las casas. Forma parte del grupo llamado Merced 4. Con su préstamo comprara hilo y telas al por mayor incrementando así la producción.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric at wholesale price

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
MARIA MAGDALENA is 23 years old. She knits scarves, bed sheets, pillows, napkins and traditional clothing. She takes this merchandise to San Cristobal de las Casas and sells them there. She has a son and she is now separated from her spouse. She expects to use the loan to purchase more frames and more yarn to improve production output since it is her only source of income to support her household. She belongs to the solidarity group named "Merced 4" along with Mrs. Petrona Vazquez Perez. She also knits and does the same kind of work that Maria does. She will use the loan to purchase yarn and frames in wholesale quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA MAGDALENA tiene 23 años, es artesana borda chales, ropa típica, sobrecamas, cojines, servilletas y los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Cristóbal de las Casas. Ella tiene 23 años, un hijo y vive separa de su esposo. Espera con el préstamo comprar telas e hilos y aumentar la producción ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para sostener su hogar. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Merced 4 junto con doña Petrona Vázquez Pérez que también es artesana y hace lo mismo que doña Maria magdalena. Con el préstamo comprara hilos y telas al por mayor.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro is a merchant, she sells fruit and vegetables in a place that she rents 30 minutes from her house. Her business is opened to the public every day. She hopes to acquire a product showcase with her loan to exhibit her products since having them in the boxes it’s easier to get decompose and the merchandise gets lost. She is part of a group called “Bugambilia 3” together with Mrs Maria Guadalupe Pérez Gómez (sales of silver jewelery) and Mrs Yolanda Pérez Gómez (sales of cakes). With the loan Maria Guadalupe will acquire more jewelery, and Mrs Yolanda will condition the place that she has on the market to provide a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Socorro es comerciante vende frutas y verduras en un local que renta a 30 minutos de su casa, su negocio esta abierto al publico en general todos los días. Ella espera con su préstamo adquirir un aparador para exhibir el surtido de sus productos ya que teniéndolos en las cajas es más fácil que se descompongan y se pierda la mercancía. Forma parte del grupo solidario Bugambilia 3 junto con doña Maria Guadalupe Pérez Gómez (venta de joyería de plata) y doña Yolanda Pérez Gómez (venta de pasteles). Con el préstamo Maria Guadalupe adquirirá mas joyería para exhibir, y doña Yolanda acondicionara el local que tiene en el mercado para proporcionarles un mejor servicio a los que le compran sus pasteles.

loans.use: Buy a product showcase

loans.name: Clara Magdalena

texts.es:
Clara Magdalena prepares tamales three times a week, and she delivers them to a snack bar that orders them every Saturday. She is 67 years old and she will use the loan to buy pots and pans to to improve the preparation of the food. She is a part of a group called “Circonia 9” together with Mrs Norma del Carmen Najera L. (sales of sweets and refreshments in a secondary school) and Mrs Karla Viridiana Meneses Archil (computers accessories). With the loan Norma will refit the place so that the children who come buy to her store have a better service and Karla will buy more accessories for computers.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Clara Magdalena hace tamales tres veces a la semana, y los sábados entrega por pedido a una cafetería. Ella tiene 67 años y con su préstamo invertirá comprando ollas para agilizar la preparación de los alimentos. Forma parte del grupo llamado Circonia 9 junto con doña Norma del Carmen Najera L. (venta de dulces y refrescos en una escuela secundaria) y doña Karla Viridiana Meneses Archil (accesorios para computadoras). Con el préstamo Norma acondicionara el lugar para que los niños que le compran tengan una mejor atención y Karla invertirá en mas accesorios para computadoras.

loans.use: Buy pots and pans for food preparation.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
AMALIA is 40 years old, she has four children. She is separated from her husband. She sells sandwiches, tacos, hamburgers, quesadillas, etc. She started this business by renting the restaurant premises six months. It’s located 20 minutes from house. She will use part of the loan to refit the place in order to offer her clients a good service. She is a part of a group called “Primavera 5” together with Mrs Francisca Vázquez Morales (grocery store), she will use her loan to buy more merchandise like sugar, coffee, salt, rice, oil, cookies, refreshments, others.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

AMALIA tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos, separada de su esposo. Ella vende tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, quesadillas, otros. Hace como seis meses que inicio con este negocio rentando un local ubicada a 20 minutos de su casa. Con la parte de su préstamo invertirá en el acondicionamiento del lugar para ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio. Forma parte del grupo Primavera 5 junto con doña Francisca Vázquez Morales (tienda de abarrotes), ella invertirá su préstamo en el surtido de la tienda comprando azúcar, café, sal, arroz, aceite, galletas, refrescos, otros.

loans.use: Refit restaurant premises.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia is 54 years old. She started selling tacos 10 years ago. She has a taquería at home and she opens every day. She wants to remodel the place with the loan. Cecilia is a part of the group called “Primavera 5” together with Mrs Rosa Pérez Guzmán who sells food at her house. She will refit the place to provide a better service to her clients and be able to obtain bigger profits that will provide them a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia tiene 54 años, hace 10 años que ella inicio vendiendo tacos, su taquería lo tiene instalado en su casa y abre todos los días. Con su préstamo remodelara el local. Forma parte del grupo llamado Primavera 5 junto con doña Rosa Pérez Guzmán que vende comida en su casa. Con el préstamo acondicionara el local para proporcionar a sus clientes una mejor atención obteniendo ganancias que les proporcionen una mejor vida.

loans.use: Remodel taqueria

loans.name: Rosa Consuelo

texts.es:
Rosa Consuelo learned the seamstress's office when she was 37 years old. She was able to support her four children with this work. At present they all are independent. Rosa has kept making clothes to people who know her and who have qualified her as an excellent seamstress. She is 57 years old and she will use the loan to buy wholesale fabrics, sewing notions, accessories and spare parts for her sewing machine. Rosa is part of the group called “Delicias 4” together with Mrs Beatriz Marisol Jiménez Bermúdez, they sell footwear through a cataloge and she will also invest her loan in buying more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Consuelo a los 37 años de edad aprendió el oficio de costurera, con este trabajo pudo sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos que actualmente son independientes. Rosa sigue confeccionando ropa a personas que la conocen y que han calificado su trabajo como excelente costurera. Ella tiene 57 años y su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de tela al por mayor, mercería, accesorios y refacciones para su maquina de cocer, otros. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Delicias 4 junto con doña Beatriz Marisol Jiménez Bermúdez se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo y que invertirá su préstamo en el surtido de calzado.

loans.use: Buy wholesale fabrics, sewing notions, accessories and spare parts for sewing machine.

loans.name: Vidal Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vidal del Carmen has been preparing tamales for the past 30 years. This is a typical dish of the region where she lives. She prepares them every evening and she sells them at her house. She is 63 years old and although her children want to support her economically, she feels strong and she stills wants to work. For this reason she will use the loan to buy kitchen accessories and wholesale corn to continue with this activity that helped her keep her family going and that is part of her life. Vidal of Carmen is a part of a group called “Delicias 4”.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Vidal del Carmense ha dedicado por más de 30 años hacer tamales, comida típica de su región que prepara todas las tardes y a la puerta de su casa los exhibe. Ella tiene 63 años y aunque sus hijos la quieren apoyar económicamente ella se siente fuerte y con muchas ganas de trabajar, por ello con su préstamo invertirá en accesorios de cocina, maíz al por mayor para continuar con esta actividad que le ayudo a sacar adelante a su familia y que forma parte de su vida. Vidal del Carmen forma parte del grupo llamado Delicias 4.

loans.use: Buy kitchen accessories and wholesale corn.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married woman who is 37 years of age. She has five children and two adopted children. She is very poor. Her husband is a fisherman, and this is the only source of income they have been relying on for many years. She decided to join SPBD, which she thought was the only way she would be able to get some financial assistance. She will use her loan to buy herself a fishing net, canoe, some fishing rods, a fishing spear, and other things she needs for fishing. In the future Maria is planning to own a bigger boat so she will be able to get more fish when they go fishing.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five members of the Karambénor association, led by Jean Baptiste D..  In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The business is located in the village of Cachouane, which is an island in the district of Oussouye [in the Casamance region of southern Senegal].  Cachouane is a touristic village and attracts a lot of tourists.  The young people of the island earn a living by fishing and livestock-raising, which is the principal economic activity.


The Karambenor group's purpose is to resolve the problem of youth migration, and to improve the living conditions of local households.  The business will consist of buying young pigs, raising them, and reselling them after three months of fattening.” 

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le projet se situ dans le village de Cachoune, une île du département de Oussouye. Le ville de Cachouane est un village touristique qui accueille beaucoup de touriste. Les jeunes se donnent à la pêche, et l’élevage qui est l’activité principale.

Objectif : Le groupement Karambénor se fixe comme objectif :
- De résoudre le problème de l’exode des jeunes
- D’allégé le panier de la ménagère 

Activité : il s’agit d’acheter des pourceaux, les élever et les revendre après 03 mois d’engraissement.

Background 

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.  Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of young pigs and peanut cake (feed) for fattening and resale

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs Sim S. M. is a 25-year old mother of one child and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her farmland, growing rice crop and raising pigs, earning around $1.70 each day.  Her husband, meanwhile, works as a fisherman and generally generates about $ 7 per day. This couple has applied for a loan to purchase a boat and fishing net in order to facilitate their fishery business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing net for their fishery business.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng S. N. is 28 years old. She is married with 1 child and was born in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To cover her family’s expenses, she sells Khmer traditional cakes and different kinds of biscuits in her community, earning around $2 each day of profit, while her husband generates on average $4 each day from working as a soldier. Mrs Seng S. N. hopes to use this loan to purchase more biscuits for her inventory. She would also like to build a fence around her house to keep her family safe

loans.use: To  purchase more biscuits for her inventory and build a fence around her house

loans.name: Egue

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the twenty women of the Foulacounda Association, led by Ms Egue S..  In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background:  The Casamance is a very remote region of Senegal.  It has the potential to be rich, but is nevertheless very poor.  Its population is young and the majority are women, who dominate the local economy and constitute the engine of development.  In this area, the majority of young girls and women do not have any source of income, and this is the cause of the exponential growth in migration away from rural areas.

The women of Casamance are brave and hardworking, especially in trade.  However, they lack the chance to put these attributes to good use, because they are trapped in a vicious cycle of poverty and deprivation.  In fact, in many cases the wife is the most important member of the household, thanks to her role in producing food for the family and countless other responsibilities...

Purpose:  The objectives of this trading business include restarting local economic activities, motivating young women to stay in their home villages by creating revenue-generating activities, creating revenues for women at the household level, fighting poverty by increasing income, guaranteeing the grassroots development of the locality, fighting malnutrition among mothers and children, and providing good-quality products to the inhabitants of the village.

Business activities:  This business consists of lending money to the women of the village group so that they can engage in trade of products such as fresh, dried and smoked fish, sugar, tea, palm oil, vegetables, rice, oil, etc.  At the same time, the women will purchase millet, cashew nuts, and other specialties of their own village to resell in the large town markets.  This will allow the women to make a profit and repay the loan.” 

Original French business description:

«Contexte : La Casamance est une région très enclavée du Sénégal. Elle est potentiellement riche mais très pauvre. Sa population est jeune avec une majorité des femmes qui sont prépondérantes dans l’économie locale et constituent le moteur du développement. 
Dans la localité, la plupart des jeunes filles et femmes n’ont pas de sources de revenus et ceci est la cause de la croissance exponentielle de l’exode rural. 



La femme de la Casamance est très brave et tenace face au travail et le commerce en particulier cependant elle ne trouve pas de moyens ou d’opportunités pour exploiter ses potentialités car elle est contrecarrée par un cercle vicieux pauvreté et manque de moyens. 

En effet, dans bon nombre de cas, la femme est plus importante dans le ménage, vu son rôle de production de vivres et tant d’autres... 

Objectifs : Les objectifs visées sont par le projet commerce sont entre autre :

       -Relancer les activités économiques dans la localité   
       -Fixer les jeunes femmes de la localité dans leurs territoires par la 
        création d’activités génératrices de revenues 
      -Créer des revenus aux femmes au niveau des ménages 
       -Lutter contre la pauvreté par la distribution de  revenues                                                                      
       -Garantir l’auto développement de la localité 
       -Lutter contre la malnutrition maternelle et infantile 
       -Mettre à la disposition des populations des produits de bonne qualité

Activités : Ce projet consiste à prêter de l’argent aux femmes des groupements villageois pour faire du commerce des produits tels que poissons frais, secs ou fumés, sucre, thé, huile de palme, légumes, riz, huile etc. Il y’a lieu de noter que les femmes vont en même temps acheter dans leur village du mil, des noix de cajou et d’autres pour les revendre dans les grands marchés. A partir de cette activité, les femmes vont fructifier l’argent pour arriver au bout de la dette. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. loans.use: Purchase of inventory and transport for traveling sales

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: A 26-year-old woman, married with three children woman, Mrs Chhean O. works selling a variety of vegetables in an open air market, where she generally makes about $3 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a recycler, earning around $2 each day. This loan is to be used to purchase a motorcycle to help transporting her husband’s recyclable items further, faster, easier and more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to help transporting her husband’s recyclable items further faster, easier and more effectively.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the twenty-two women of the Kandiadhiou Association, led by Ms. Awa B.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of local goods, storage and transport for traveling sales

loans.name: Dado

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the twenty women of the Taku Ligueye de Thiaroye group, led by Ms. Dado C.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“This loan will reinforce an existing business activity, because in fact all the women are already engaged in commercial activities. However, these activities are informal and not intensive due to the women's inability to invest heavily in them. The purpose of the loan is to give the women of our group the more substantial financial resources they need to intensify their commercial activities.

Our business strategy is the following: the group will purchase products in bulk, and will then share out the products to each woman to retail. The loan will be repaid in monthly installments, to be deposited the tenth of each month.

The products we will purchase will include soaps and bleach, for resale to the residents of the Macoumba Sylla neighborhood. This activity has already been started by the group – it is what brought us together.”

Original French business description:

«Ce projet s’inscrit ans un souci e renforcement une activité ( le commerce) en effet toutes les femmes du groupement font déjà u commerce mais l’activité est informel et eu intense du fait du faible niveau des investissements l’objectif du prêt sera des l’or de doter les femmes du groupement de moyens financiers plus importantes pour intensifier l’activité de commerce .La stratégie d‘action est la suivante le groupement achètera des produits à grand échelle que toues les femmes se partageront pour la revente, le remboursement sera mensuel et sera verse le 10 DE CHAQUE MOIS L’achat de produits détergents : savons et eau de javel à revendre aux populations du quartier de Macoumba SYLLA. Cette active a été déjà essayer par le groupement, et nous avait permis de fonctionner» Background

The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Bulk purchase of cleaning supplies, transport and storage for retail business

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs Em S. is a 58-year old widow. She has one child and lives in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since her husband passed away many years ago, S. has had to struggle in life to cover all the family’s expenses on her own. She has worked selling grocery products to the people in her area, where she generally earns around $ 5 each day. Recently, she has requested  a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand.

(S. is sitting at the left side of the picture with a red scarf around her neck)

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Marie Gabrielle

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Femmes pour la Solidarité et le Développement de Thiaroye (FSDT) association, led by Ms. Marie Gabrielle G.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Women occupy an ever greater place in Senegalese society. They regulate home life, are responsible for children's education, and moreover are called on ever more frequently to contribute to the economic resources of the household. This is why the women of our group wish to work together to find opportunities to develop revenue-generating activities. For a start, the group wishes to request a loan of 400,000 francs ($850), a sum which will be shared among the members of our group. Since our association is composed of subgroups with different business activities, the loan will be divided equally between the seamstress groups and the traveling sales groups. The loan will be repaid in monthly installments, to be deposited on the tenth of each month.”

Original French business description:

«La femmes occupe de plus en plus une place importante dans la société sénégalaise elle jouent un rôle de régulatrice au sein du ménage elle est la responsable de l’éducation des enfants mais est appelé de plus en plus a participer à la vie économique du ménage .d’ou le désir des membres femmes pour la solidarité et le développement de chercher des activités génératrices de revenues. Cependant pour un début le groupement souhaite disposer d’un prêt de quatre cent mille francs (400 000f cfa), somme qui sera repartie parmi les membres du dit groupement .Ce groupement étant constituer de sous groupe avec des activités différentes, ce prêt sera partage entre les groupes couture et a celui de commerce à part égale ( eux cent mille franc (200 000 f cfa ) .le remboursement sera mensuelle et se fera le 10 de chaque mois»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for a seamstress business and household products for aretail business

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
B. Malohat has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.  Her business place is located in the Kostakoz, Khujand.  She is marred and has 4 children.  

She sells children's clothes and men’s socks.  She brings her goods from Khujand herself. She strives to meet her clients' needs, and because of that, she has many clients.  

She became a client of MicroInvest in 2006.  Her first loan was for $100.  She used it to expand her assortment of goods.  She changes her assortment according to the seasons.  Now she has sold all her summer season goods and she is going on a trip to purchase her next batch of goods for the autumn season.  She is going to buy 20 jackets, 30 hats, and 50 dungarees for children.  To do so, she needs a loan of $1200.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Srak

texts.en: Mrs Srak N. is 35 years old and is a widow with one child. She lives in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has worked very hard to supplement her household since her husband passed a way many years ago. Mrs Srak N. works selling grocery products to the people in her community, earning around $2.50 each day in revenue. This loan will be used to expand her inventory by increasing the number of her grocery products in order to satisfy her clients’ needs. In the future, she hopes to save enough money  to expand her business and to construct a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store in order to satisfy her clients’ needs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hosiat

texts.en:
H. Hosiat has her own stall in the big market of ”Farovon”, in Gafurov, Khujand.  She is a widow and a mother of 5 children.

She and her two sons sell different goods in this market.  They have three places of trade.  Her elder son travels to Istaravshan, Khujand to purchase goods for them.  Hosiat became a client of MicroInvest in 2005.  Her first loan was for $100.

Today, she has a wide assortment of goods.  She sells children’s and men’s shoes and t-shirts, and other kinds of clothes for girls, boys and so on.  Her turnover of goods is good.  Her trade place is small, but very profitable because it is situated in the passage of the market.

For the coming autumn season she is going to purchase seasonal goods such as warm boots, jackets and warm sport clothes for teenagers.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
K. Mukaram is an active client of MicroInvest.  She is marred and has 5 children.  Her husband is a worker who gets little salary, so Mukaram helps her husband to support their family.  

Her business is located in Gafurov, Khujand, in the big wholesale market.  She has rented a little place for her goods.  She sells men’s shoes.  Her elder son helps her after his lessons.  He studies at 10 forms (her son is in the photo).

Mukaram goes to the wholesale market every week to purchase shoes.  As she has many clients, she sells her goods in a short time.  For the coming season, Mukaram wants to purchase modern and classic shoes and she is requesting a loan of $1200 for this.

loans.use: Purchase modern and classic shoes for the autumn season

loans.name: Friad Ahammd

texts.en: Friad Ahammd lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 2 children. He is an uneducated man who works selling wood. He has a big area for selling wood, and the rent is too high. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy more wood and make his business big. He will use the profits to help his family and also support one of his little brothers and his mother. He is happy with this loan and is thankful for AFSG.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung (35) runs a small shop in the front of her house. She sells mostly school supplies and snacks. She is separated from her husband and must raise her 9-year-old son, Luu Minh Hoang, on her own. She has borrowed from Mekong Plus before, and she has paid the loan back on time. She is very reliable and trustworthy. She would like a loan from KIVA in order to increase her store's stock. She is able to earn between 10-15,000 VND ($0.62-0.94) per day. With the money she earns, she sends her son to school.

loans.use: To increase her shop's stock

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: A 35-year-old married mother of 3 school-aged children, Mrs Ung M. lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To help cover her family's expenses, M. works as a tailor, earning on average around $4 each day, while her husband typically generates about $7/day from working as a driver. One of her children is  employed at a garment factory and two of them attend school. This loan is primarily to be used to purchase electrical sewing machines to facilitate her business. Mrs Ung M. is confident that she will be able  to save enough money to open a big tailoring store one day.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical sewing machine to facilitate her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ourng

texts.en: Mrs. Ourng S., a 29-year-old widow with one school-aged child, lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a small beauty salon selling different kinds of beauty products to the people in her community. With this business activity, Ourng S. can typically generate up to $10 each day in revenue. In order to generate an additional profit, Mrs. Ourng S. hopes to use the loan to decorate her shop . Another part of the money is to be shared with her relatives to open another shop selling cooked meat and a variety of drinks on the roadside of their community, where a number of travelers pass by. She hopes to have sufficient money to provide her child with aa good education and a better quality of life one day.

loans.use: To decorate her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase modern baking equipment, and hire someone to make deliveries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her vegetable and fruits business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung K. is 50 years old and lives with her husband (pictured here because K. is unavailable) and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her household, Kung K. is self-employed as a teacher, earning around $3 each day, wile her husband works driving a motor-taxi and typically makes up to $10 each day. Two of her children work in a private company, and the rest are enrolled in school. To make an additional profit for her entire family, Mrs. Kung K. would like to open a shop selling rice and different kinds of Khmer food to the people in her area, yet she faces financial constraints. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to help her.

loans.use: To a open a shop selling rice and Khmer food to the people in her community.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Kung Kunthear has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Renovate her food stall and add stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a wheelcart and water cans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more stock to expand his business

loans.name: Mohammad Sadiq

texts.en: M. Sadiq lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 3 sons. All of them are working with him, and 2 of them are married. He is a very talented man. He has lots of experience in his job. He is a shoe seller, and he has a shop. He wants to open another shop, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new designs of shoes for the new generation to add more clients and make a good income for his family. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new designs of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock of cereal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Tailoring Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a wheel cart for his business and more water cans

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun C. N. is 26 years old  and a mother of four children. She lives in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling different kinds of vegetables at an open air market, where she generally makes on average profit of around $2.50/day. Her husband works at a construction site and raising animals, earning around $2.60 each day. This loan isto be used to purchase  a cow and a  pig and to build  a barn for their animal breeding.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and a pig and  to build a barn for their animal breeding.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Chude

texts.en: Chude is a 29-year-old resident of the Buguruni area in Ilala District, Dar Es Salaam region. Chude operates a 60-seat video hall in the Bugururni area, a business he has been doing for the past six years. He is grateful to this business; with the profits, he has been able to construct a house, send his kids to school, and support his family. Chude wants to make renovations to install up-to-date structures in the hall. His dream is to turn the hall into a modern theatre. He is in need of USD 550 to help him accomplish his mission.

loans.use: Expand his video hall

loans.name: Abdujamil

texts.en:
Mirsaliev Abdujamil has been engaged in this business since 2000.  He started his business with trade of men's shoes.  He is an active client of MicroInvest, and is a very responsible person.  His first loan was for about $150, and he used it for expanding his assortment of shoes. Gradually, he increased his working capital and included men's shirts to his assortment.  

Today, he has many clients because he has learned enough of the styles and needs of customers.  His place of trade is one of the known places in the market and every day he serves more than 10 or 20 clients.  

For the future, he wants to purchase new, modern shoes made from leather.  He says that this modern style will have high demand among his clients.  For this goal he is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Abdul Hamid

texts.en: Abdul Hamid lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young and single boy. He lives with his father and mother, and he is supporting them. He is a shopkeeper. He has a small mobile shop where he fixes mobile phones and also sells new mobile phones. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy a variety of mobiles to expand his inventory and make a good monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new kinds of mobile phones

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is thirty-nine years old, and is married with two boys who are in classes three and two. His wife stays at home but is currently training to be a hair dresser. She wants to open a salon so that she can supplement on her husband’s income, and and most important ly, to stay busy. John says, "An idle mind is the devil’s workshop."

As a side business to his work as a builder, John sells firewood to some business people in Malaba. He sells it to milk sellers who use it to pasteurize their milk; fish mongers who deep-fry the fish in their canteens; and sometimes to café owners who use firewood, which is the cheapest source of fuel. John gets his stock of firewood from different places within the district. He usually gets the waste from loggers, gathers the scraps of wood until they fillsa truck, and transports the wood to Malaba. John has been able to provide one the cheapest source of cooking energy to the community and also helps minimize waste from trees cut down for lumber.

Currently, Johns does not own a store, but uses his compound as the site for displaying his product. The price he charges for the wood is based on the quantity that his customer buys. He also offers a discount to those customers that come to get the firewood themselves. He does this to motivate customers to come get the wood rather than delivering it to them. He employs a young man who delivers the wood to his loyal customers.

With a loan from PEMCI, John plans to increase his stock by making more trips to get wood. He says that the demand is there and his problem is being able to supply enough firewood.

loans.use: Improve his firewood business

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang S. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she sells a variety of grocery products in her community, where she typically generates around $2 a day profit. Her husband works as a fisherman, and earns about $1.50 per day. Four of her children are enrolled school, and one is married and lives with her own family.

Mrs. Heang S. has applied for a loan to increase her inventory of grocery items in order to meet her growing number of customers.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by adding more grocery items in order to meet her growing number of customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Salimahon

texts.en:
S. Salimahon has been engaged in this business for over 5 years.  She is married and has two children.  Her husband is her business partner and helps her with the transportation of her goods.  They go together on the purchasing trip to Israravshan, Khujand once a week.

Her business place is located in the big market - Atushbazaar, Khujand.  The turnover of her goods is good.  Today, she has many constant clients.  She has a wide assortment of goods and her goods are of high quality.  Many customers order their individual styles of underwear from her.  Salimahon does all she can to meet their needs.  She is very satisfied with her business.  

In the future, she would like to increase her stock of goods and she is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase the next batch of underwear.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock and expand business

loans.name: Sayaad Ramzhan

texts.en:
Sayaad Ramzhan lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is an educated man. He has the responsibility of taking care of his family and his brother's family because his brother died a few years ago. He is supporting their children.

He is a shopkeeper, and he sells shoes in the bazaar. He wants to take an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy more shoes for his shop. With the profits, he will help these two families. He hopes that he can expand this business.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells cooked meat to the people in her community, and earns up to $7 per day. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver and can generate approximately $2.50 each day. One of her children works as a computer repairman and two are students.

Mrs. Sok C. wants this loan to purchase utensils and more supplies for her business. She would use the leftover money to buy a motor-bike for her husband to operate a business.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and more supplies for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry K. Y. is a 28-year-old widow who lives with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a diligent mother who struggles very hard to support her three school-aged children by working at a construction site.

Mrs. Ry K. would like to sell fish at an open air market to general additional income for her household. To do so, she has applied for a loan to help her purchase a motorcycle. The motorcycle would allow her to travel faster and make it easier for her to get to the fish to the market to sell.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle to get fish to the market

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Ry Kim Ya has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Mohammad Karim

texts.en: Mohammad Karim lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and married. He is a shopkeeper, and he has a shop for making sweets. He has a lot of experience in his job. He did this business for a long time in Iran and Pakistan. He has lots of workers in his shop. Now he wants to open another shop in another part of Kabul, so he wants to take an individual loan to purchase all of his supplies and expand his business. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To open a second shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of cereal

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty Almuaenmwosa is 44 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 6 years as a leader of her union.

She has been in business since 1995. Beauty believes that once she has additional stock, her customers will be able to purchase more goods from her and thus help her store thrive. She is therefore requesting a $450 loan to help increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a 31-year-old mother of two who operates a beauty salon and sells clothes (traditional attire commonly known as kanga) in the Vingunguti area of Dar Es Salaam city. She has been doing this salon business for the past three years. Her salon provides all sorts of common styles to her clients ranging from weaving, hair washing, and other beauty-related services. Her salon can now accommodate three customers at a time, and due to the increasing number of her customers, Deborah wants to get more equipment to cater to more customers at one time.
