She is in need of USD 350 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Buy more equipment for the salon

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and her child in Benin City, Nigeria. She fixes and braids hair and also sells drinks and provisions. She has been with LAPO for 6 years and has been running her business for 7 years.

Florence wishes to expand her business, for which she is seeking a $250 loan.

loans.use: To buy more goods & a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is a 43 year old widow with 7 children. She deals in the sale of clothes, pots and plastic slippers. She has been in this business for the past 7 years and has also been with LAPO as an assistant leader for 4 years,where she has been very happy.

Joy plans to reach out to more customers by increasing the variety of stock in her shop. She needs the above $250 loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and plastic products (slippers, baskets, etc.)

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing E. is 30 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a married mother of 2 and has been  a LAPO client for 3 years. She learnt how to run a general store from her mother and started her own store in 2004. She is seeking a $250 loan to buy more goods for sale i.e. clothes and plastic goods.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and plastic goods for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: "LAPO has being a source of financial strength to my business," says Patience O., who is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Patience is a hair stylist and is requesting a $250 loan to buy more weavon (wigs), relaxer and hair cream for her hair salon. She has been a LAPO client for 4 years and has been in the hair salon business for the past 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more weavon and relaxer for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet N. is a 52 year old widow and mother of 10 children who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells a variety of different types of clothes, shoes and bags. She has 24 years' experience in her business and has been a LAPO client for 3 years. She hopes to expand her business with above loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags & provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock of local brown sugar

loans.name: Joao Baptista

texts.pt:
Joao Baptista N. is 33 years old, father of 3. He was born in Maputo and raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation allowed him to study until the 9th grade. Joao was a soccer player until he suffered injuries. Later he decided to open his own business producing construction bricks in the neighborhood of Campoane. Joao was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema by his god father. There he applied for his first loan in order to expand his business. With the income from the business Joao supports his family including the schooling of his children and the care for his elderly parents.

With the loan of 20.000,00MT, Joao plans on increasing the volume of his stock of sand and concrete to keep up with demand and grow his business. In the future, Joao also plans on purchasing a brick making machine to increase his production. Joao’s business has positive impact in his community because it provides full time employment for 1 member of the community, and also generates other 6 part-time positions. The business also brings construction material closer to all members of the community of the neighborhoods of Campoane and Belo Horizonte.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇAO : Bairro Campoane - Boane CLIENTE: Joao Baptista N. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE: Transformacao VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 20.000,00 MT (800.00US$) APLICAÇAO DO MONTANTE:Compra de cimento para fabrico de blocos Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Joao Baptista N. de 33 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, pai 3 filhos, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, as condiçoes financeiras da familia permitiram-lhe que estudasse ate 9ª classe. Foi jogador de futebol antes de sofrer uma lesao, mais tarde decidiu gerir um negocio pessoal e possui um negocio de fabrico de blocos e um pequno estabelecimento comercial no bairro Campoane. Atravez do seu Padrinho soube da existệncia da Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para ampliar a sua actividade e como forma de responder com a procura. A sua actividade esta inserida na comunidade, providencia emprego a 1 trabalhador efectivo e mais 6 eventuais. Com os rendimentos do seu negocio suporta os encargos da familia, as despesas escolares e de saude dos filhos e cuida dos seus pais já idosos.

Com o emprestimo de 20.000,00MT pretende aumentar receitas e volume de mercadoria de forma a evitar ruptura de stock no seu estaleiro. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego a ele proprio mais (um) 1 trabalhador efectivo e outros eventuais ,coloca o material de construcao mais proximo da populaçao do bairro de Campoane e Belo horizonte e tem como perspectiva fazer crescer o negocio e ter uma maquina para fazer mais em pouco tempo.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement to produce bricks

loans.name: Carlos Silva

texts.pt:
Carlos Silva S. is 46 years old, father of 2. He was born in Manhiça and raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation did not allow him to attend school. Since he was very young he started his own businesses. Today, he owns 3 small stores in Vila da Matola-Rio, Laulane, and in the city of Maputo. Carlos was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by a friend. There he requested his first loans in hopes to expand his business. Carlos’ business is very close to the community, employing 3 full time workers (two men and one woman). Carlos supports his family with the income from the business.

With the loan of 38.600,00MT, Carlos plans on increasing and diversifying the stock of his stores in order to keep up with demand and compete with other stores. The business has a positive impact in his community because it creates employment for Carlos and his wife, as well as 3 other employees. In addition, the stores also bring quality products closer to the residents of Matola-Rio which is 15 kilometers away from the city of Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZACAO: Matola-Rio CLIENTE: Carlos Silva S. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE: Comercio VALOR DO EMPRESTIMO: 38.600,00 MT (1,544.00US$) Aplicaçao do montante: Venda de produtos da primeira necessidade e refrigerantes.. Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/10/2007

Carlos Silva S., de 46 anos de idade, natural da Manhiça, pai de 2 filhos, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, a situaçao financeira da familia criou lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde jovem assume na integra a gestao de um negocio pessoal e possui 3 pequenos estabelecimentos comercias em pleno funcionamento da vila da Matola-Rio e em Laulane na cidade de Maputo. Atravez da conversa com um colega, soube da existểncia da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para ampliaçao do seu negocio. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade e providencia emprego a 3 trabalhadores (dois homens e uma senhora), com os rendimentos do negocio, garante a sobrevivencia da sua familia.

Com o emprestimo de 38.600,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria, diversificar produtos de forma a evitar roptura de stock nas suas lojas e pretende concorrer em pế de igualidade de oportunidades com os concorrentes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade pois alem de providenciar emprego a sua esposa mais 3 trabalhadores, coloca o produto mais proximo dos residentes da Matola-Rio que distam 15 km da cidade de Maputo.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Francisco M. is 60 years old, father of 3. He was born in Mafuiane and raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation only allowed him to study until the 6th grade. Since Francisco was a teenager he has been working on machambas (small agricultural fields). Francisco was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by his daughter. There he requested his first loan with plans to prepare the fields and buy seeds to diversify and increase his production. Francisco’s business if close to his community because it generates employment for 3 people, including Francisco himself. With the income from the Machambas Francisco supports his family, sends his children to school and takes care of his younger grandchildren. Francisco has 17 cows, and 11 goats.

With the loan of 17.000.00MT, Francisco plans on buying seeds and fetilizers in oder to increase his cultivation area from 4 to 10 hectares. He also plans to increase the volume of his production of couve, repolho (cabbage), potatoes, carrots, lettuce, peppers, corn and onions to keep up with demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao: Mafuiane - Boane Cliente: Francisco M. Sector de actividade: Agro-pecuaria Valor de empréstimo: 17.000,00 MT ( 680.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de insumos agricolas e fertilizantes Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Francisco M., de 60 anos de idade, natural de Mafuiane, pai de 3 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais, as condições financeiras permitiram-lhe estudar ate 6 classe. Desde a adolescência assume na integra a gestão de duas machambas com sistema de regadio. Através da sua filha soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo solicitado um empréstimo para pagamento de preparação de terreno e compra de semente como forma de aumentar a produção e diversificar os vegetais. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade, providencia emprego para 3 trabalhadores, incluindo ele proprio, com os rendimentos da machamba suporta os encargos da família, a educação dos filhos, despesas de saúde e cuida dos netos menores. Conta com 17 cabeças de gado bovino e 11 cabeças de gado caprino.

Com o empréstimo de 17.000 00Mtn pretende comprar mais sementes, lavrar mais terras de forma aumentar o volume de produção de culturas de rendimento como (couve, repolho, batata reno, cenoura, alface, pimenta, milho, cebola) e como forma de satisfazer a procura. Tem como perspectiva aumentar as areas de cultivo de 4 para 10 ha.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizes

loans.name: Airina

texts.pt:
Airina Feniasse C. is 52 years old, mother of 6. She was born in Chilembane, a Gaza Province, and raised by her parents who had 20 children. The financial situation of her family did not allow her to attend school. Since 1977 Airina has been working for herself in a 80 square meters Machamba (small agricultural field) in the city of Mafuiane. Airina sought HLUVUKU ADSEMA in Boane. There she requested her first loan with hopes to expand her activities. Airina’s work provides employment for Airina and her husband, as well as enough income to support her family and send her children to school.

With the loan of 16.000.00MT, Airina plans on increasing the volume and diversifying her production. Airina’s work has a positive impact in her community because it brings vegetables closer to the residents of Mafuiane and other neighborhoods in Maputo. In the future Airina hopes to buy 1 acre to increase her production.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

ocalização: Mafuiane - Boane Cliente: Airina Feniasse C.. Sector de actividade: Agro-pecuária Valor de empréstimo: 16,000,00MT (640.00US$) Aplacado de montante: Compra de insumos agricolas e insecticidas. Inicio: 18/08/2007 Fim: 15/12/2008

Airina Feniasse C., de 52 anos de idade, natural de Chilembane, Província de Gaza, mãe de 6 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais, numa família alargada de 20 irmãos, A situação financeira da sua família criou-lhe poucas oportunidade para estudar. Desde 1977 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de um negocio pessoal e possui uma machamba de 80 metros quadrados na localidade de Mafuiane por curiosidade e interesse soube da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA em boane, tendo solicitado um empréstimo para aplicação no negocio sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade e providencia emprego para própria e o seu marido. Com os rendimentos do seu negocio suporta encargos escolares para duas pessoas,

Com o empréstimo de 16.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria e diversificar o tipo de vegetais. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque coloca o produto mais próximo dos clientes da localidade de Mafuiane e de diversas pessoas vindas dos bairros da cidade Maputo. Tem como perspectiva adquirir mais uma parcela de 1 hectar de terra para aumentar o seu volume de negocio.

loans.use: To buy seeds and Land preparation

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is 25 years old and runs a grocery store. He buys maize, mills it to flour and sells the flour. He has been in business for the past 4 years. He buys about 5 tonnes of dried maize from farmers each month, mills it and packs the maize in packets of 5, 10 and 25 kilograms. Omari employs three people in his business.

Omari wants to expand his grocery store to cater for the increasing demand of various customers and build a bigger store for his maize business. He is in need of $350 to help him expand stock for his grocery store.

loans.use: Expand the stock of his grocery store

loans.name: Ananias David Jossia

texts.pt:
Ananias David Jossias M. is 41 years old, father of 2. He was born in the city of Maputo, where he was raised with his 6 brothers. His family’s financial condition allowed him to study until the 9th grade. Since 2003, he has been supporting his family with a construction brick business in his back yard.

Ananias was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by friends. There is requested his first loan to invest in his brick business. Ananias’ work employs 3 part-time workers. With the income from the bricks, Ananias supports his family and saves. With the loan of 12.500.00MT, Ananias plans on increasing the volume of his stock of sand and cement. Ananias’ work has a positive impact in his community because it generates employment for 3 people, and brings construction materials closer to the residents of his neighborhood. In the future, Ananias hopes to open a construction material store and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: km 16 - Boane Cliente: Ananias David Jossias M. Sector de actividade: Fabrico de blocos Valor do empréstimo: 12.500,00MT (480.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de cimento e areia Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Ananias David jossias M., de 41 anos de idade, natural de Maputo,pai de dois filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais, numa família de 6 irmãos, a situação financeira da família lhe permitiu estudar ate 9 classe. De 2003 ate então vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio pessoal possui um pequeno estaleiro de venda de blocos no quintal da sua casa, por indicações de alguns amigos do mesmo bairro soube da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA e aproximou-se da instituição onde solicitou um empréstimo para aplicação no seu negocio de fabrico de blocos.

A sua actividade esta sendo bem inserida na comunidade e que providencia emprego a 3 trabalhadores envetuais. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta encargos familiares e uma parte para a poupança, com o empréstimo de 12.500.00Mtn pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria, tais como pó pedra e areia. A sua actividade tem maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a 3 trabalhadores coloca material de construcao mais próximo da comunidade, contrubuindo deste modo para o desenvolvimento do seu bairro. No futuro gostaria de construir um armazém para a venda de material de construção e fazer crescer o seu negocio.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

payments.comment: Ananias has repaid this loan in advance.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate U. is 32 years old and married with no children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Kate is a hardworking woman who has run a small business selling clothes, shoes, bags and baby products for 5 years. As she acquires more customers, she needs capital to expand her business.

Kate has been a LAPO client for 3 years and is seeking a $325 loan to expand her business. "I believe my business will improve with the above loan amount," explained Kate when talking about her reasons for requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags & baby items for sale

loans.name: Otilia

texts.pt:
Otília Timane is 50 years old, mother of 3. She was born in Xinavane in the district of Manhiça. She was raised by her parents along with her 5 siblings. Otília studied until the 4th grade. Since 1973 she has been supporting her family by working in the machamba (small agricultural field) in Mafuiane. She was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by friends. There she requested her first loan to invest in her field. Otília supports her family and sends her children to school with income from the machamba.

With the loan of 15.000.00 MT she plans on buying seeds and fertilizers in order to increase her farming area from 0.5 to 0.75 acres. Otília’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment and income for Otília. It also brings fresh vegetables closer to the residents of her neighborhood.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Mafuiane - Boane Cliente : Otília Timane Sector de actividade : Agricultura Valor de empréstimo : 15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação de montante: compra de insumos agricolas Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Otília Timane, de 50 anos de idade, natural de xinavane, distrito de manhiça mãe de 3 filho, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais numa família alargada de 5 irmãos, estudou ate 4 classe. Desde 1973 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de actividade da machamba possui uma machamba de sistema de regadios na localidade de mafuiane e por indicações de amigos soube da existência da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA tendo recorrido a esta para solicitar o primeiro empréstimo para aplicação na sua actividade agricola. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade providencia emprego a propria, com os rendimentos do seu negocio suporta encargos familiares e uma parte vai a conta poupança, despesas escolares e da saúde dos seus 3 filhos.

Com empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar sementes e fertilizantes para aumentar sua area de cultivo de 0,5 para 0,75 ha. A sua actividade tem grande impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a 1 jovem coloca os produtos frescos mais próximo dos residentes e pessoas vindas dos diversos cantos da cidade.

loans.use: To buy seeds and land preparation

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is a hairdresser in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Through her home based hair salon business, she is able to supplement her husband’s income and provide for their 5 children.

Evelyn has been with LAPO for 2 years as secretary of her union. With this $175 loan, she will purchase weavon (wigs), relaxer and other hair salon equipment to expand her business. She hopes that this will improve her family's current standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more weavon(wigs), relaxer & hair salon equipment

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla, 28, is a resident of Buguruni area in Tanzania, where she operates a kiosk. Her kiosk sells mainly soft drinks, fresh juice and other simple snacks. She has been in business for the past 10 years, and ever since she received business management training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation, her business has been earning more profit than before.

Ramla is now in need of resources to convert her kiosk in to a grocery. She is therefore requesting $350 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Helder Alberto

texts.pt:
Hélder Alberto M., 39 years old, native of Maputo, father of 3 children, grew up with his grandparents. His family's circumstances only allowed him to study through 8th grade. As a young man, he took on responsibility for the management of a personal business and has a business selling building materials and a store for basic goods in Campoane, near the town of Boane. Through friends and a neighbor, he found out about Hluvuku-Adsema. He has requested a loan to increase his brick production. The job is well-integrated into the community, and it provides jobs for 4 workers. With the income from the business, eh supports his family, his children's school expenses, health care, and savings for the future.

With the loan of 15,000 meticais, he plans to buy raw material (sand and fine stone) to manufacture bricks, increasing sales to generate more profit.

His work has a greater impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for himself plus 4 more people, he brings the construction material closer to Campoane residents. He has plans to increase production capacity from 720 to 1500 bricks/day.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Campoane - Boane Cliente: Hélder Alberto M. Sector de actividade: Transformacao Valor do empréstimo: 15.000,00MT (600.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Fabrico de blocos para venda Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008 Hélder Alberto M. de 39 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, pai de 3 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos avos, as condições da família só lhe permitiam estudar ate 8 classe. Desde jovem assume na integra a gestão de um negocio pessoal e possui um negicio de venda de material de construcao e uma loja de produtos da primeira necessidade em campoane arredores da vila de Boane. Através de um amigos e um vizinho soube da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA. Tendo solicitado um empréstimo para aumentar a produção de blocos. A actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade, providencia emprego a 4 trabalhadores, com os rendimentos do negócio suporta os encargos da família, despesas de educação dos filhos, de saúde e poupancas para o futuro. Com o empréstimo de 15.000.00MT pretende comprar materia prima (Areia e pedra fina) para fabrico de blocos aumentando assim o volume das vendas o que ira gerar mais rendimentos. A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais 4 pessoas, coloca o material de construção mais próximo dos residentes de campoane. Tem como perspectiva aumentar a capacidade de producao de 720 para 1.500 blocos/dia.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of clothing for resale

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Leonor Antonio T. is 53 years old and a mother of 10 children. She was raised solely by her mother in a large family with 8 siblings. Since she never knew her father, her family’s financial situation did not afford her the opportunity to study. Since she was very young she worked to support her family. She has two plots of land with irrigation. With advice of some people who knew about HLUVUKI ADSEMA, she applied for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies. Her work supports the community and provides employment for one young woman and her husband. With the income from selling produce she is able to support her family and pay for the education of her children in Boane, in the cities of Matola and Maputo and to care for the health of her children and three grandchildren. With the loan for 15,000MT she plans to purchase additional seed for various crops to meet the increasing demand for her produce.

Her work has a large impact on the community. In addition to providing employment to one person and her husband, she provides fresh products to the neighborhood of Mafuiane and to the city where she brings her produce to sell. She hopes to increase the area of cultivation from 0.75HA to 1.25HA to harvest more food.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

LEONOR ANTONIO T., de 53 anos de idade, mãe de 10 filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade da sua mãe, numa família alargada de 8 irmãos. A situação financeira da família, uma vez que não chegou a conhecer o seu pai, criou-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde a sua infância trabalha na machamba para a sua sobrevivência e a da família. Possui dois (2) terrenos com sistema de regadio .Por recomendação de algumas pessoas soube da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA e aproximou-se para solicitar um empréstimo para a compra de insumos agrícolas. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade e providência emprego a um jovem e ao seu marido. Com os rendimentos da venda de vegetais suporta os encargos familiares. as despesas de educação para seus filhos em Boane, cidades da Matola e Maputo, assim como as de saúde para seus filhos e três netos, com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar mais sementes para diversificaras culturas de rendimento para satisfazer a procura de vegetais .

A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade pois para alem de providenciar o emprego a um (1) jovem e o seu marido fornece produtos frescos ao bairro de mafuiane e da cidade para onde leva os produtos e tem como perspectiva aumentar as areas de cultivo de 0,75 para 1,25 ha de modo a produzir mais comida.

loans.use: To buy seeds and land preparation

loans.name: Sofia

texts.pt:
Sofie M. is 53 years old and she was born in Matola. She is a widow and mother of six children. She was raised by her parents in a family of 11 siblings. Marrying at an early age kept her from pursuing an education and after her husband's passing, she took up full leadership of their crop raising business - she owns a fully irrigated parcel of land. She became aware of Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and relatives. She was the recipient of a loan that was applied to purchase seeds and to rent a tractor.

Her business is well established within her community and it provides employment to a young man. With the revenue generated from selling crops she pays her household's expenses, including healthcare and education costs for two grandchildren.

She plans to pay for a third-party tractor service provider and purchase more seeds to fulfill demand and diversify their crop output. This venture contributes in major ways to the community: not only it generates employment for herself and another person, but it also provides fresh produce to the Malufaine area residentes and to people that come from different places in Maputo looking to buy fresh products. She plans to expand her farming area and to purchase her own water pump that way facilitating crop irrigation.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sofia M. de 53 anos de idade natural da Matola, mae de 6 filhos viúva, Cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais numa familia de 11 irmaos o casamento precoce criou-lhe poucas oportunidades de continuar a estudar, com a morte do seu marido assume na integra o negocio virado a culturas de rendimento e conta com um terreno com sistema de regadio, Atraves de vizinhos e amigos, soube da existencia da Hluvuku- Adsema, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para a compra de sementes e aluguer de tractor. A sua actividade est? bem inserida na comunidade, e providencia emprego a um jovem. Com os rendimentos dos vegetais suporta os encargos familiares, educaç?o dos 2 netos e cuida da sa?de da familia. Com o emprestimo de 12.500,00MT pretende pagar a prestaç?o de serviços de um tractor agricola e comprar mais sementes para satisfazer a procura e diversificar os vegetais . A sua actividade tem um maior impacto na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ela propria, mais um jovem fornece produtos frescos ao bairro de Mafuiane para alem de pessoas proveniente de diferentes bairros da cidade de Maputo que se deslocam a este local a procura de produtos frescos. Tem como prespectiva fazer crescer a sua area de cultivo e obter uma motobomba propria para facilitar a rega das culturas.

loans.use: To buy seeds and land preparation

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
People can't live without garri (a popular West African dish made from cassava tubers) and firewood, says Rose O. who is married with six children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Rose is 56 years old, and has been a client of LAPO for 3 years. She has been in the garri and firewood business since 1980.

She hopes to buy more foodstuffs and improve her business with the $175 loan she is requesting.

loans.use: To buy bags of garri and firewood for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is 32 years and is married with 4 children. She runs a shop in Siluko Road, Benin City, selling provisions.

Josephine has been in this business for the past 3 years and has been a member of LAPO for 4 years. She is in need of a loan of US$ 175 to allow her to purchase more provisions for resale in her little store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Mrs. Anthonia O. is married with four children and lives in an area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has 4 years' experience in her business. She believes that the requested loan of US$ 325 will allow her to increase her turnover and thus her profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy gallon quantities of local gin

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
"My business gives me great satisfaction," says Mrs. Rose O.. She sells local drinks to people in her community and she hope to increase her business if granted a loan of US$ 325.

Rose is 35 years old ,married with six children, and happy that she is able to send her children to school. She started this business back in 2000.

loans.use: To buy gallon quantities of local drinks

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a 41-year-old mother of four and runs a ladies' beauty salon in the Buguruni area of Dar es Salaam city. She is been in business for the past six years, and her salon offers all sorts of common beauty services most ladies like.

For the moment Tatu has two hair dryers but she wants to buy two new ones so that she can cater for the increasing number of customers that come to her. She is need of a loan of US$ 350, to help her improve her business by buying these dryers.

loans.use: pruchase two new hair dryers for her salon

loans.name: Bon

texts.en:
Bon runs a small food stall where she sells traditional Vietnamese beef noodL. soup called "pho." Her husband was in a motorbike accident, and he is no longer abL. to work. Bon's "pho" stand earns the family between 10-15,000 VND per day (US$ 0.62-$0.94). They also own 2 billiard tables which they let other peopL. rent to play.

Bon has proven to be a responsibL. and trustworthy partner; she has borrowed from Mekong Plus and Kiva once before, and she has repaid the loan on time. Mekong Plus has also been generous enough to give their daughter Van (13) a scholarship to continue her studies. Bon would like another loan in order to continue to expand her small "pho" business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her soup stand

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christina is 38 years old, married and a mother of five children. Having lost her father when she was only seven years old, she was not able to have a basic education which made her unemployable. With her husband’s meager salary, the needs of the family could not be met so she decided to get a loan from GHAPE with which she invested in crop cultivation and raised money to pay school fees for her children. 

Given a new loan of $1200, she plans to operate a motor bike taxi in the urban area. The bike will be driven by a hired driver and the business will be lucrative because a motor bike is a necessary means of transport in this area because of poor roads. However, she plans to add this activity as a new business to her previous activity (farming). 

She plans to repay the loan in 24 months and the first installment of repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of motor bike

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 35-year-old mother of 5. She sells charcoal and "vitenge" (a common local clothing). She gets her "Vitenge" from Malawi and supplies it to Arusha and Moshi (Northwestern Tanzania), where it is in high demand. She travels frequently upcountry for the charcoal and sells it as a retailer.

Both of Lucy's businesses are booming, and she now wants to open a shop selling traditional attire. She is in need of a loan of US$ 400, to help her expand her micro-business venture.

loans.use: Expand on business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella I. is the owner of a store in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she supplements her husband’s income by selling provisions, food stuffs and drinks to her community.

Stella's business is important to her in ensuring the well-being of her 6 children. With the requested loan of US$ 400, Stella will expand her business and enhance her business operation by adding to her inventory.

Stella has been in business since 1999. She is 51 years old and has been a LAPO member for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, food stuffs & drinks for sale

loans.name: Dau

texts.en:
Dau (40) sells groceries and brewed coffee in the front of her home. She is able to earn between 5-10,000 VND (US$ 0.31-$ 0.62) per day. She wishes to increase her inventory so that she can sell more items.

Dau's husband Than (47) works at the train station. He fixes the railways when they are in bad condition, but he only gets paid 30,000 VND ($1.87) per day. With the money they earn, they are able to put food on the table, but they cannot afford to pay for their son's education, so he must stay home to help the family. Dau and Than have 2 children. D. Ngoc Son is 25 years old and D. T. Ha is 11 years old.

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her little grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: "Being a LAPO member is not a mistake for me and my family. I have been with LAPO for 4 years as a leader of my union. I hope to improve my business and the standard of the living of my family through the US$ 250 loan, I have requested," says Mrs. Elizabeth A. who is married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. 52 years old, Elizabeth sells eggs in the open-air market.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix the floor in her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory for their clothing store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice R. is 35 years old, married with 4 children. She sells eggs in the open-air market. This business is a source of income to the family. Eunice lives in Benin City and has been with LAPO for 6 years; she has been in this business since 1992.

Eunice hopes to receive a loan of US$ 250 so that she can buy more eggs for resale and improve her turnover and thus her profits.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh (40) and his wife Huyen (28) are originally from a town near Hanoi in the north of Vietnam. They moved to Tanh Linh in hopes of being able to make a better living for themselves. Finding work was initially very difficult, so they asked for a loan in order to get started. The lender they received the loan from charged an exorbitant interest rate, which left them stuck in poverty.

Huyen runs a small grocery store in the front of their home and Thanh works as a day laborer. Huyen is able to earn between 10-15,000 VND (US$ 0.62-$ 0.94) per day. Thanh earns about 30,000 VND per day (about $1.85 US), but he is not always able to find work. With the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, they can save more of their money and not spend it paying interest on a loan. They are trying to raise 2 children, H. Thi Tuyet Loan (8) and H. Minh Cong (4).

loans.use: to expand their little grocery store

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
"I need to put a wall in front of my house, since when it rains the street floods and it comes up to the sidewalk, then it enters the entryway of my house, and it's a problem to have this water in the entrance because it makes it very difficult for us to go out. I am requesting $800 for the construction of a wall."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Me hace falta poner una barda al frente de mi casa ya que cuando llueve la calle se inunda y llega hasta la banqueta, por lo tanto entra al portal de mi casa y es un problema tener el agua en la entrada por que se nos dificulta mucho salir”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para la construcción de una barda.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy O. is 34 years old, married with 2 children. She has been with LAPO for 6 years and is seen by us as a leader. She sells provisions to her community.

Joy lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has 11 years' experience in her business. She needs a loan of US$ 325 to build up her business by purchasing more goods for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Tereso

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished construction. I need to add protection and an iron door, mainly for the safety of my family during the night. I am requesting $600 to finish the construction by adding the protection and the door."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me falta poner protecciones y una puerta de fierro para la seguridad de mi familia sobre todo en las noches”. Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para terminar la construcción poner las protecciones y la puerta.

loans.use: To install protection and an iron door

loans.name: Nkwain Irene

texts.en: Irene has learned that her talents and skills were already a source of income to her. After being trained in GHAPE on business skills, she decided to put her skills to work. Given $100, she planned to use the loan to make hair nets and sell palm oil and use the income to pay her bills and children’s school fees. She plans to pay the loan in 15 months.Her first installment repayment  will be done on the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil, thread

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam (35) goes to the market at 5 am in order to buy groceries and produce. She carries the groceries in a cart on her bike and takes them around town to sell. She earns about 15-20,000 VND per day (US 95 cents to $1.25). Her husband Vu Tien Cuong works as a day laborer and earns about 30,000 VND ($1.87) whenever he is able to find work.

Tam and Cuong have proven to be very reliable business partners. They have borrowed from Mekong Plus on 3 different occasions and have repaid each loan on time. Her previous loans have helped Tam's family to be able to build a new small home with a bathroom. They were even able to paint their home with the money they saved up. They would like to continue to partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva so that they can expand Tam's grocery business.

loans.use: to buy more produce for her little grocery business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C., mother of 3 children, has requested a loan of US$ 175 to help her expand her business. She is a motivated, hardworking entrepreneur who has been building her business for the past 8 years.

Joy recognizes the value of expanding and hopes to improve her business turnover with a loan of $175 which will allow her to buy more fabrics and fashionable material. Joy has been with LAPO for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics & fashionable material for her business

loans.name: Mbang Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a single mother of two who has been struggling to get a job since she left high school. Given the fact that she has two children depending entirely on her, she sought for a loan from GHAPE and was trained in business skills.
Given a loan of $100, she plans to sell fire wood in front of her house. She believes the business will succeed as firewood is the main source of energy in this area and she is the only retailer there.She is planning to established this new business of firewood retailing and some food items  since it is of high demand.
She will raise money to provide for her children.
She plans to pay the loan in12- 15 months. Her first installment repayment will be done on the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood and  transportation

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
"For the safety of my family, I need to place protection on the windows of my house, because my work is on the night shift and during that time there are lots of evildoers. I am requesting $800 to install protection on my home."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Por la seguridad de mi familia necesito poner las protecciones en las ventanas de mi casa ya que mi trabajo es en el turno de noche y en ese fraccionamiento hay muchos maleantes”.Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para la instalación de protecciones en mi vivienda.

loans.use: To place protection on the windows of my house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth cannot forget the past memories of hunger when she delivered her baby in the hospital; Afterward, her husband could not provide food for her and the family, not to mention school fees for the children. Due to hardships, she decided to join GHAPE. Motivated by other members, she received training in business skills.
Given a loan of $100, she wants to sell foodstuffs along the public roadside and she believes this business will succeed because she will buy from villages at cheaper prices and sell in town at at higher price to make a profit. This activity is more profitable in her area as compared to her previous activity. She will use the profit to pay school fees for her children and to feed her family with some of the food she sells. She plans to pay the loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will be done on the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of plantain, cocoyam, rice, and potatoes, etc

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung (32) and his wife Cuc (35) run a small butcher stand in the commune marketplace. They sell pork at their stand. Before working with Mekong Plus and Kiva, they took out loans from other sources. They had to pay high interest on those loans, which severely cut into their profits. They were not left with much to raise their 2 sons, M. Nhat Hong (12) and M. Nhat Huong (10). They hope that they can partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva so that they can increase their profits and save money to send their children to school.

Cuc usually tends to their stand in the market. They earn about 20-25,000 VND (US$1.25-1.56) per day from selling pork. They would like this loan in order to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to provide pork to sell at their meat stand

loans.name: Emelda Bih

texts.en: Emelda was born in 1963 and is a mother of eight children. Her husband, A. Martin, was fired from his job when their first child was just five years old. This places a heavy responsibility on her as she became the main bread winner for her family. As if to worsen matters, the husband mismanaged the small money they had gathered over the years. With these challenges she was motivated by other GHAPE members to join them in 2004. Then she obtained a first loan of $40.00. Since then she has obtained three loans with which she fattened pigs for sale and cultivated crops and raised money to pay school fees for her children. She also bought other school needs and trained her son in motor mechanics. Given a loan of $500, she plans to continue in same line of business so she can use the profits to continue educating her children and pay house rent for her child who lives in Bamenda. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, pig feed, fertilizer construct pig sty,

loans.name: Vunegho

texts.en:
Born in 1962, K. is a widow with six children. Her difficulties in life stem from the fact that she has no relatives to help her take care of her six children. After the death of her husband, she could not pay bills, pay school fees, or buy other things her children need for school so she sought help from GHAPE. Here, she was given her first loan of $40 with which she raised money to pay school fees for some of her children.

Given a loan of $400, she plans to sale fresh ground nuts, roast corn, and other food items along the roadside where there are many passerbys. The profit will be used to continue educating her children and to increase her business. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of groundnuts, bananas, plantains, corn, and garri etc

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson A., 47, is a responsible and hardworking man; he is married with 3 children. Seeking a better life for his family, he sells books & gift items. He has been in this business for 7 years. His family welfare is what motivates him to work hard each day.

Wilson has been with LAPO for 6 years and is a secretary of his union. He believes he will acquire more customers and increase his business turnover if he is granted a loan of US$ 400.

loans.use: To buy more Christian books & gift items for resale

loans.name: Pedro Daniel

texts.es:
"I urgently need to add a room to my home, because my family needs more space. My house is very small and my children are growing up. I am requesting $1,000 for the construction of a room."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Me urge la construcción de un cuarto en mi vivienda ya que mi familia necesita más espacio, mi casa es muy pequeña y mis hijos están creciendo”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto”.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
"I have a business selling new and used clothing in my home, and my sales are very good, but I would like to invest a bit more since my customers ask for things which I have not been able to buy, due to the fact that they are too expensive. I am requesting $1200 to invest in my business."

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Tengo una venta de ropa nueva y usada en mi casa y mis ventas son muy buenas, pero me gustaría invertir un poco más ya que mis clientes me piden cosas que no he podido comprar debido a que me cuestan más caras”. Solicito 1,200.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio

loans.use: To invest in my business

loans.name: Brenda Rocio

texts.es:
"I have a business selling footwear from a catalog in my home, and I would like to invest in the purchase of footwear, in order to have various models on hand, since my customers have asked asked me for them and I would like to increase my sales to have more income. I am requesting $1200 to buy footwear for my business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

“Tengo un negocio de venta de calzado por catalogo en mi casa y me gustaría invertir en la compra de calzado para tener en existencia varios modelos, ya que mis clientes me lo han solicitado y quisiera que mis ventas aumentaran para poder tener más ingresos” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar calzado para mi negocio.

loans.use: To invest in my business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elias is originally from Sabinas in Nuevo Leon, three years ago he became unemployed and, faced with the difficulty of finding new work, he decided to open up his own business selling sweets and novelty items for children. With this be able to obtain the basic necessities for his family. Elias is married and has two small children. He began by selling very few products but thanks to his hard work he was able to sell his wares to other shops and his sales have increased considerably, recently he has been able to obtain a truck in order to increase the distribution of his products. His wife also helps out with the business.

At this moment, Elias needs a loan of $925 dollars that will be dedicated to the purchase of merchandise in order to cover his clients’ demands and continue to grow as he has been. He promises to payback this money within 6 months. Become a part of the development of this business and help this family, they sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Elías es originario de la localidad de Sabinas en Nuevo León, hace tres años quedó desempleado y ante la dificultad para conseguir un nuevo trabajo emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y novedades para niños, y así obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, él está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Comenzó vendiendo muy pocos productos pero gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ahora surte a varias tiendas y sus ventas se han incrementado considerablemente, últimamente ha adquirido una camioneta para aumentar la distribución de sus productos y su esposa también le ayuda en el negocio.

En estos momentos Elías necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, él promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte del desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria is a hardworking woman with three children currently in school. Unfortunately, four years ago Maria’s husband suffered an automobile accident and lost his life, leaving the family without any kind of help. Maria has had to make great efforts to move forward with her life and her family, so she started her own business selling soft drinks and snacks. She maD. a lot of headway and today, with the help of her children, she has her own corner market.

This market has been the only source of income for her home. Maria now seeks $475 dollars of credit which she promises to payback in 6 months. With this money Maria will be able to improve the variety of products in her store and continue the growth of her business. Today you can help someone who really needs it; this family deeply thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando. Lamentablemente hace cuatro años su esposo sufrió un accidente automovilístico y perdió la vida, dejando a su familia sin ningún tipo D. ayuda, para sacar adelante a su familia Maria ha tenido que esforzase mucho e inició su propio negocio con la venta D. refrescos y botanas, que después comenzó a surtir mejor hasta tener ahora su tienda D. abarrotes, donD. recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos y juntos han logrado hacer crecer este negocio.

Esta tienda ha sido la única fuente D. ingresos para este hogar y para darle un nuevo impulso ahora Maria esta solicitando un crédito D. $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, con esto ella podrá mejorar la variedad D. productos que comercializa y continuará creciendo con su negocio. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, esta familia agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchadise

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is married with three children, ages 13, 10 and the smallest just 1 year old. Her husband is a mechanic. To improve their quality of life, Rosa decided to buy the land next to her house. In order to cover this purchase, Rosa opened up her own business selling tacos six years ago. She began selling them from a small corner and, thanks to the good quality of her products, her sales increase with each day that passes. Later her business was constructed on her new land and with this her business continued to improve.

She now has greater ability to attend to her clients. Rosa needs a bigger grill and a canvas to cover part of the structure out of which she has her business. For this she is asking for a loan of $475 dollars which she promises to payback in 6 months. With your help Rosa will be able to continue to increase her business and she appreciates this opportunity that you have provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Maria está casada y tiene tres hijos, de 13, 10 y el más pequeño de sólo un año de edad. Su esposo es mecánico, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Rosa decidió comprar el terreno de al lado de su casa y para poder cubrir el costo emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de tacos hace seis años, comenzó a vender en un pequeño puesto y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, sus ventas se crecían día con día. Después fue construyendo en el terreno y mejorando el aspecto de su negocio.

Ahora que tiene una mayor capacidad para atender a sus clientes Rosa necesita de una parrilla más grande y una lona para cubrir una parte de la estructura de su negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio y agradece mucho esta oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is 46 years old, married with two children, ages 14 and 21. Her husband has his own business, but because he does not receive a reliable income at all times the family has been through some hard times. So in order to get some additional income and help out their children with school, Maria started selling sweets and hamburgers. Little by little her business has improved and the number of clients has grown. Maria is an enthusiastic woman and thanks to her personality she has been able to help her business and her family move forward.

At this time Maria is asking for a loan of $375 dollars that will be used to purchase additional consumables to serve along with her hamburgers due to the increased demands of her clients and Maria’s desire to be able to meet these demands. She has promised to repay the loan within 6 months. Please become an important part of this family’s life and in the development of their business, they very much appreciate your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Maria del Carmen tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 21 años. Su esposo tiene un negocio propio por lo que no recibe un ingreso seguro pero y en ocasiones pasa por momentos difíciles, para poder obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a que sus hijos continúen sus estudios Maria inició la venta de dulces y hamburguesas, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio e incrementando su número de clientes, Maria es una mujer entusiasta y gracias a su carácter ha sacado adelante su negocio y a su familia.

En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita en la elaboración de las hamburguesas porque su demanda se ha incrementado y desea poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia y en el desarrollo de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is 48 years old. She is an enterprising woman with grand desires of overcoming hurdles. She is married with three daughters, ages 21, 22, and 24. They have been her motivation for opening a jewelry, cosmetic and lingerie store 10 years ago in order to help out her spouse, their daughters’ educations and some expenses around the home. Fortunately, Maria Dolores has a great personality which allows her to get along with ease with others and her business, which was started among family members and friends, now has many more clients.

So that her business may continue to grow, Maria is asking for a loan of $650 dollars which she promises to repay in 6 months. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise to fulfill some requests and extend the variety of her products in order to offer her clients products for the new season. Please become a part of Maria’s achievements, she very much appreciates the opportunity that you are giving her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Dolores tiene 48 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella está casada y tiene tres hijas, de 21, 22 y 24 años de edad, ellas han sido el motivo por el cual desde hace diez años inició su propio negocio con la venta de joyería, cosméticos y lencería, para poder apoyar a su esposo con las colegiaturas de sus hijas y con algunos gastos del hogar, afortunadamente su carácter le facilita relacionarse con los demás y el negocio que inició entre familiares y amistades ahora ya tiene muchos más clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses y empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir unos pedidos que tiene y ampliar su variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de la nueva temporada. Forma parte de los logros de Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria is 50 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 35 and 32. They are all married. Juana’s husband works as a lathe operator in a company in Escobedo in Nuevo Leon where they live. Four years ago, Juana opened her own business selling perfumes and jewelry from a catalog in order to help out with household expenses. She also makes and sells handicrafts for special events. Her patience and originality have allowed her to make tasteful, quality products which have helped her business to grow.

Now, in order to provide more handicrafts due to greater demand, Juana Maria needs a credit of $650 dollars which she will use towards the purchase of material in order to be able to make her products. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Please become part of the growth of this business and help Juana improve the life of her family, they will be forever appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Maria tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos entre 25 y 32 años, todos ellos ya casados, su esposo trabaja de tornero en una empresa de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León de donde son originarios y para ayudarlo con los gastos de su hogar desde hace cuatro años emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes y joyería por catálogo, también elabora y vende manualidades para eventos especiales, su paciencia y originalidad le han permitido elaborar productos calidad y muy buen gusto, lo que le ha ayudado a crecer con su negocio.

Ahora surte grandes pedidos de manualidades y necesita un crédito de $650 dólares que empleará en la compra de material que requiere en la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Juana a mejorar la vida de su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia is a hard working, enthusiastic woman borned and raised in Escobedo in Nuevo Leon. She is married with three children, ages 12, 18, and 22. Her spouse is a taxi driver and, since he does not receive a fixed income, their family has had to go through some hard times. However, because Patricia is an entrepreneur, she decided to begin her own business four years ago selling jewelry and cosmetics so that she would to be able to obtain extra income to improve the quality of her family’s life.

At this time Patricia needs a credit of $650 dollars which she will use towards the purchase of merchandise in order to be able to offer good service to her clients and cover their needs. She promises to repay this loan in 6 months. Patricia very much appreciates the opportunity that you are providing her to improve her business and make it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Patricia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 12,18 y 22 años de edad, su esposo trabaja de taxista por lo que no recibe un ingreso seguro y en ocasiones su familia pasaba por muchas necesidades, pero como Patricia es una mujer emprendedora decidió comenzar su propio negocio hace cuatro años, con la venta de joyería y cosméticos, para poder obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

En estos momentos Patricia necesita un crédito de $ 650 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio y cubrir sus necesidades, ella se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Patricia agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, 38 years old, is from Manunu. She is an expert in making fine mats, pictured above with one that is half-made. Christina says that she cannot wait to finish it, so she can make more. Since she left school, she has been part of a team of women who all specialise in fine mat production - Christina learnt the skill from watching the older women. Since she was given the assistance from SPBD, Christina has been able to put her fine mat production skills into good use, and to earn money for her family. She is very happy with the contribution she now makes towards supporting her family, in particular, to the church and village obligations that they have as a family and members of the Manunu village. 
Christina is asking for a loan of US$500 to help further develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Liua Isapela

texts.en: Liua Isapela M., 35 years old, is from Faleu Manono and owns a banana plantation (pictured in the photo), even though it is quite unusual for a woman. For Liua, the banana plantation is an additional source of income, along fine mat making, handicraft production and other tasks traditionally carried out by women. The banana plantation provides income and a source of food for Liua's family.  Even though getting a good plantation running requires hard work, it has been worth it for Liua. The SPBD assistance has already helped Liua develop her talent as an agriculturalist, and now she is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase agricultural chemicals to increase the volume of banana harvest.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural chemicals

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania K., 49 years old, is from Faleu Manono. She owns a pig farm, which she developed with the help of SPBD's assistance. The farm has become a source of income for her and her family. According to Epifania, this is a particularly good business in Samoa. Epifania has a number of customers from her village and at times even from outside. Epifania says that she is fortunate to have received the assistance from SPBD, as she now has a good business where her family can rely on for financial support. She would, nevertheless, like to expand the business, and is therefore asking for a loan of US$300.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Jeunes Femmes de Loudia (Young Women of Loudia) group, led by Ms. Aissatou D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: Located in the region of Ziguinchor at nine km from the town of Oussouye, the village of Loudia Oulof is a farming village whose inhabitants live together in complete harmony, with a traditional village chief. The young people of the village earn a living by farming in the case of men, and traveling trade in local products in the case of women. In order to resolve the financial constraints to investing properly in their business activities, the young women of Loudia Oulof are requesting a loan of 500,000 francs ($1050) from SEM.

Purpose: The Jeunes Femmes de Loudia group have the following purposes: to create employment, to combat rural emigration, and to improve the living conditions of our families.

Business activities: These will consist of buying local products [dried fish, palm oil, cashews, etc.] and reselling them in surrounding villages and in local tourist hostels [where they command a higher price]. Cosmetic products will also be purchased in Ziguinchor [the nearest city] to be resold in the village.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

Original business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Situé dans la région de Ziguinchor a 9 Km de Oussouye, le village de Loudia Ouolof est un village d’agriculteur dans le quel les populations vivent en parfaite harmonie autour d’un chef de village. Les jeunes du village ont pour activité ; l’agriculture pour les jeunes garçons et le petit commerce pour les jeunes filles. Faisant face à un problème de moyens afin de bien mener leurs activités, les jeunes filles du village de Loudia Ouolof sollicitent un prêt auprès de SEM d’un montant de 500 000f.

Objectif : Le groupement des jeunes filles de Loudia Ouolof se sont fixées entre autre objectifs :

De crée de l’emploi

De lutter contre l’exode

D’améliorer leur conditions de vie et celle de leur familles.

Activités : Il s’agit d’acheter des produits au niveau local est les revendre dans les villages environnants et dans les structures hôtelier. Des produits cosmétiques seront aussi acheter à Ziguinchor et seront vendu dans le village.»

loans.use: Purchase of local village products and commercial goods  for traveling sales

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: The good soil at Faleu Manono and the financial assistance from SPBD are the reasons for Apolonia’s plantation's success. Apolonia is a 33 year old woman from Faleu Manono and currently owns a plantation. It is the main source of income for her and her family. Apolonia (pictured in the photo) is very happy, showing her plantation to the SPBD staff, and is asking for a loan of US$300 to help further develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Tafaoga

texts.en: Tafaoga, a 42 year old woman from Manunu, is the Secretary for a Centre that specialises in making Samoan fine mats. Pictured in the photograph, she is showing off another product of her hard work. With the assistance from SPBD, Tafaoga was able to purchase the materials she needed to produce the fine mats. Whereas before she had to buy such materials, she now has her own supply of materials through owning several plants. She would like to acknowledge the assistance of SPBD as the reason behind her success, and is asking for a loan of US$900 to help her further develop the mat business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Masina

texts.en: Masina, 46 years old, is from Manunu. She specialises in fine mat production, and is pictured above with other women as they showcase another addition to the Mat Production Centre’s assets which they intend to sell in order to be able to produce more fine mats. Masina is very much aware of the time and effort that goes into the production of a fine mat, and financial support is important for such an initiative to survive and to be sustained. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to help further develop her business.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Dalila pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Bombonaje", se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en dos tiendas, una de ellas ubicada en el mercado central del distrito de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín y la segunda en su domicilio.  Lo que la motivó a dedicarse a este negocio fueron las ganas que tenía de seguir haciendo estudiar a sus menores hijos y además que le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes, así satisfacer sus necesidades primordiales. 

Tiene 39 años y 04 hijos, tres de los cuales son varones y una mujer, el mayor de los varones y la mujer son los que le ayudan en la atención del negocio en la casa, además de acompañarla algunos días en la compra de sus productos. Siempre se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas.

El crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2,500.00 ($790.00), será  invertido en la  compra de diversos abarrotes como:  cajas de jabón por cada marca (Marsella, Bolívar, jumbo, etc.), sacos de 50 kg de  arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros, además quincenalmente se traslada a la ciudad de Cajamarca para comprar granos,  frutas y verduras frescas para ofertar a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es:
Juana belongs to the Community Bank (Banco Comunal) "El Alto Mayo." She sells clothing exclusively for women and girls because she's says that they are her taget clientele. Her store is located on Jr. Faustino Maldonado Nº 581 in the Rioja district in San Martín. She currently rents the store and is thinking about moving to a location near her home but wants to have it properly equipped first. Juana, 36, is from Piura and has 2 children who are 3 and 8 years old. She believes that it is the charisma and patience she shows her clients that help sustain her business and make it grow. She considers herself to be very independent as far as managing the store. Her knowledge of accounting also helps her manage the finanaces. The loan in the amount of S/.1000.00 ($ 316.00) will be put towards buying intimate apparel for women and girls (2 dozen of the brand Peter Pan), outfits for girls (1 dozen), jeans and workout pants for women (2 dozen each), and blouses and sports polos (2 dozen). She always pays attention to her clients' tastes and needs, and tries to look for the most up-to-date fashion trends in clothing for young people.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Alto Mayo", se dedica a la venta exclusiva de ropa para damas y niñas, ya que dice que son ellas sus clientes selectas. Su local se encuentra ubicada en el Jr. Faustino Maldonado Nº 581 del distrito de Rioja, en el Departamento de San Martín, es un local alquilado, esta pensando pasarse a un local cerca de su casa, solo espera acondicionarlo. Natural de Piura, tiene 36 años de edad y 02 niños, el mayor tiene 08 años y el último 03 años. Ella cree que el carisma y la paciencia que tiene para sus clientes es lo que la caracteriza, la mantiene y hace crecer en su negocio. Se considera independiente para el manejo del mismo, además de tener conocimientos en contabilidad lo cual le permite manejar muy bien sus finanzas. El préstamo de S/.1000.00 ($ 316.00) lo invertirá en la compra de ropas interiores de damas y niñas (02 docenas de la marca exclusiva de Peter Pan), conjuntos para niñas (01 docena), jeans y pantalones deportivos para damas 02 docenas de cada uno, además de blusas y politos deportivos (02 docenas). Siempre esta pendiente de los gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes, trata de buscar prendas y modelos actuales y juveniles.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing (intimate apparel).

loans.name: Sophoan

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Sophoan was married in 1998 and has 2 children, 1 daughter and 1 son. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor before she got married in 1998 and started her silk production at that time. She trained her husband, Mr. Yim Sophath to weave as well. Now, her husband is  assisting her in  weaving silk after he finishes his day of growing vegetables and raising cows.  

She requests a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and setting up another loom for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and set up another loom for her husband.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. C. Sophal was married in 1982 and has only 1 daughter. He learned to repair many types of machines during on the job training from his friend in 1980. He started his own business after he got married in 1982. His wife does the house work and looks after her daughter. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA for five times already. Now he is requesting a loan of $400. He will use this loan to purchase some spare machine parts for his stock.

loans.use: Purchasing some spare machine parts  for his stock

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Tha was married in 2000 and has one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her sister-in-law in 1998 and she started her silk production business in 2001. Her husband  also assists her in weaving. In addition, he sometimes cooks for  wedding ceremonies, which he learned from his brother in 2001.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $150. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Siem Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Siem Seng was married in 1980 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 2002. She has also  trained her eldest daughter to weave and now they weave silk at home together. Her husband grows rice and plants vegetables in the same village.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  four times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her and her daughter’s looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her & daughter’s looms.

loans.name: Sophary

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sophary was married in 1989 and has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. She started her business of buying and reselling silk products in 2003. In addition, she is also in the business of selling grocery items from her home.  Her husband is a teacher at High School in the village. All of their children are studying in high school and primary school. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase finished silk products for her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing finished silk products for her stock.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Pheap is a widow with 3 children. She has been in the business of weaving silk at home since 1988 after she learned to weave from her mother. Now she has two looms, one for herself and another for her daughter. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her and her daughter’s looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her and her daughter’s looms.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Pheap Phuong has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Hing was married in January 1975 and has 8 children, 5 sons and 3 daughters. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1973. She started her silk production at that time but stopped during the Khmer Rouge regime and continued again in 1979. She also trained her daughter and son to weave as well. After receiving a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, she set up looms for her son and daughter. Now they weave silk at home together with her. Her husband grows rice and plants vegetables in the village.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $900. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for herself,  her son and her daughter’s looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk for her, son and daughter’s looms.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Phally was married in 1985 and has 5 children, 1 son and 4 daughters. Since 2006, she has been in the business of weaving scarves by using semi-automatic machines at home. She learned from her sister. She owns one machine and now wishes to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her business in scarf production. Her husband is a brick construction contractor in the Kean Svay district.

She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,200. She will use this loan to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her scarf production and buy cotton fabric.

loans.use: Purchasing one more scarf semi-automatic machine and cotton fabric.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Srey Mauch

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Srey Mauch was married in 1997 and has 2 children. Since 1995, she ihas been in the business of weaving scarves by using semi-automatic machines at home . She learned from her old generation. She currently owns one machine and now wishes to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her business in scarf production. Her husband is a chief cook of wedding ceremonies in the Kean Svay district.

She is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,200. She will use the loan to purchase another semi-automatic machine to expand her scarf production and to buy one motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing one more scarf semi-automatic machine and one motorbike.

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Quang Khe is a poor village in the southern Quang Xuong district of Thanh Hoa province. People there have difficult lives. Since they do not easily get capital funds from the government or the banks, they often have to borrow money with a high rate of interest from loan sharks. In 2003, TYM Fund opens a branch in this village and starts to lend the villagers money using microfinance. Mrs. Ha Thi C.’s family has become a member of TYM Fund since then.
